analyzed: can mig dmar ser bgrad pa lta bu dang ldan pa /
translated: red eyes staring wide open,🔽and with hands outstretched, fingers long and rough, ready to strike, terrifying.

original: lag sor gyi sen mo ring zhing rtsub pa'i lag pa brkyang zhing rdeg par gzo ba 'jigs su rung ba dag mthong ba las des nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor shar ba na mun pa ma lus par bsal te /
analyzed: lag sor gyi sen mo ring zhing rtsub pa'i lag pa brkyang zhing rdeg par gzo ba 'jigs su rung ba dag mthong ba las des nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor shar ba na mun pa ma lus par bsal te /
translated: When the orb of the sun rises, all darkness is dispelled,

original: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams gsal bar snang ba'i tshe na 'jigs shing skrag pa dang bral te /
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams gsal bar snang ba'i tshe na 'jigs shing skrag pa dang bral te /
translated: and when the directions and intermediate directions are illuminated, one is free from fear and terror.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i 'byung po ci yang mi mthong ba de bzhin du 'dir yang sems can srid pa'i mtshan mo ma rig pa'i mun pas shes pa'i snang ba bsgribs pa'i mun khrod na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pas blo gros dkrugs
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i 'byung po ci yang mi mthong ba de bzhin du 'dir yang sems can srid pa'i mtshan mo ma rig pa'i mun pas shes pa'i snang ba bsgribs pa'i mun khrod na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pas blo gros dkrugs
translated: Just as the person with the eye disease does not see anything that is not a hair, in the same way, here, in the darkness of the night of existence, in the midst of the darkness of the night of ignorance that obscures the light of consciousness, those whose minds are disturbed by false imagination

original: pa dag gis nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po don dam pa ma yin pa yul dang yul can gyi ngo bo nyid du nges par gnas pa 'jigs su rung ba dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: pa dag gis nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po don dam pa ma yin pa yul dang yul can gyi ngo bo nyid du nges par gnas pa 'jigs su rung ba dag mthong ngo //
translated: see the terrifying things that are not ultimate, the inner and outer things that are definitely present as the nature of subject and object.

original: de nyid kyis stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i shes pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi nyi ma shar nas mi shes pa'i bag chags dang / mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa mtha' dag bsal ba'i tshe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i shes pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi nyi ma shar nas mi shes pa'i bag chags dang / mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa mtha' dag bsal ba'i tshe na /
translated: When the sun of the perfect wisdom of the knowledge of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness rises and all the latent tendencies of ignorance and the afflictions that connect to the next life are removed,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i spyod yul dang bcas pa rnams dngos po dang ngo bo nyid du mi mthong zhing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i spyod yul dang bcas pa rnams dngos po dang ngo bo nyid du mi mthong zhing mi dmigs te /
translated: The objects of mind and mental factors are not seen or observed as things or entities.

original: bla na med pa'i ye shes shar ba na dbugs phyin pa chen po thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i ye shes shar ba na dbugs phyin pa chen po thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When unsurpassed wisdom dawns, one attains the great relief.

original: don de nyid tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis kyis ston par byed de /
analyzed: don de nyid tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis kyis ston par byed de /
translated: This point is taught by two verses:

original: dper na mtshan mo mun khrod na //
analyzed: dper na mtshan mo mun khrod na //
translated: For example, at night in the dark,

original: 'byung po yang dag min mthong ba //
analyzed: 'byung po yang dag min mthong ba //
translated: beings see what is not real.

original: nyi ma shar zhing mig bye'i tshe //
analyzed: nyi ma shar zhing mig bye'i tshe //
translated: When the sun rises and the eyes open,

original: snang bar 'gyur ba ma yin ltar //
analyzed: snang bar 'gyur ba ma yin ltar //
translated: what was seen does not appear.🔽In the same way, when the sun of

original: de bzhin mkhas pa yang dag gi / shes pa'i nyi mas mi shes pa'i //
analyzed: de bzhin mkhas pa yang dag gi / shes pa'i nyi mas mi shes pa'i //
translated: the wisdom of the wise

original: bag chags ma pus bcom pa'i tshe //
analyzed: bag chags ma pus bcom pa'i tshe //
translated: destroys the darkness of ignorance,

original: sems dang sems byung yul mi mthong //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung yul mi mthong //
translated: the mind and mental factors do not see objects.

original: zhes bya ba gnyis kyis bstan to /🔽// / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gnyis kyis bstan to / // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba /
translated: This is taught by these two verses.

original: bam po bcu pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu pa /
translated: The Blaze of Reasoning, a commentary on the Essence of the Middle Way,

original: gal te 'di snyam du /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du /
translated: If you think,

original: rab rib can mig dag pa dang / gnyid log pa sad pa dang / mun khrod na 'dug pa snang ba dang phrad nas 'khrul pa dang bral bar gyur pa dag gis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid mthong bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rab rib can mig dag pa dang / gnyid log pa sad pa dang / mun khrod na 'dug pa snang ba dang phrad nas 'khrul pa dang bral bar gyur pa dag gis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid mthong bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Those with blurred vision who have clear vision, those who are asleep and those who are awake, and those who are in the dark and those who are in the light, when free from delusion, see the essence of things such as form.

original: rnal 'byor ba de nyid shes pa'i shes pa skyes pa'i tshe na ni ci yang mi mthong bas dpe dang don mi mthun pa'i phyir dpes don mi 'grub par sems na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba de nyid shes pa'i shes pa skyes pa'i tshe na ni ci yang mi mthong bas dpe dang don mi mthun pa'i phyir dpes don mi 'grub par sems na /
translated: But when the consciousness of the yogi arises that knows suchness, he sees nothing at all. Therefore, since the meaning of the example does not accord with the meaning of the text, you may think that the example does not prove the point.

original: de la bshad pa /🔽'di la rnam @119a * //
analyzed: de la bshad pa / 'di la rnam @119a * //
translated: To this we reply:

original: pa thams cad du mthong ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir mthong ba med pa nyid mthong ba'o zhes nye bar gdags so zhes bstan zin mod kyi /
analyzed: pa thams cad du mthong ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir mthong ba med pa nyid mthong ba'o zhes nye bar gdags so zhes bstan zin mod kyi /
translated: We have already explained that in every way seeing is not established, and therefore the absence of seeing is designated as seeing.

original: yang bshad par bya ste /🔽dngos rnams ngo bo nyid yod par //
analyzed: yang bshad par bya ste / dngos rnams ngo bo nyid yod par //
translated: But we will explain it again.🔽Things are not seen to exist inherently

original: mi mthong dngos nyid ma grub phyir //
analyzed: mi mthong dngos nyid ma grub phyir //
translated: Because their reality is not established.

original: yang na dngos nyid skye med phyir //
analyzed: yang na dngos nyid skye med phyir //
translated: Or else, because their reality is unborn,

original: sgyu ma'i glang chen ji bzhin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i glang chen ji bzhin no //
translated: They are like an illusory elephant.

original: zhes bya ba ni mkhas pa rnams ni kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa ji ltar yid kyis rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la sgro 'dogs bar yang mi byed /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mkhas pa rnams ni kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa ji ltar yid kyis rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la sgro 'dogs bar yang mi byed /
translated: This verse shows that the wise do not reify or depreciate the nature of form and so on as it is imagined by the mind on the conventional level.

original: skur ba 'debs par yang mi byed par 'jig rten dang mthun pa'i shes bas lta bar byed pas dngos po ci yang mi mthong ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: skur ba 'debs par yang mi byed par 'jig rten dang mthun pa'i shes bas lta bar byed pas dngos po ci yang mi mthong ba yang ma yin la /
translated: They see things in accordance with the world, without seeing any thing at all,

original: ngo bo nyid med par yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med par yang mthong ngo //
translated: and they see that things are essenceless.

original: don dam par ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par mi mthong ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par mi mthong ste /
translated: On the ultimate level, they do not see things as having any essence.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma grub pa'i phyir sgyu ma'i glang po che bzhin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma grub pa'i phyir sgyu ma'i glang po che bzhin no zhes ston to //
translated: This is because the essence of things is not established, like an illusory elephant.

original: de la re zhig sems dang sems las byung ba dag ni skad cig tsam las mi sdod de /
analyzed: de la re zhig sems dang sems las byung ba dag ni skad cig tsam las mi sdod de /
translated: In this regard, first, minds and mental factors do not remain even for an instant.

original: skad cig de yang dang po dang bar dang tha ma'i dbye bas ches phra ba nyid du zhugs pas rang gi ngo bo spang ba'i phyir nges par mi 'grub pas re zhig de ltar sems dang sems las byung ba dag ngo bo nyid du ma grub ste /
analyzed: skad cig de yang dang po dang bar dang tha ma'i dbye bas ches phra ba nyid du zhugs pas rang gi ngo bo spang ba'i phyir nges par mi 'grub pas re zhig de ltar sems dang sems las byung ba dag ngo bo nyid du ma grub ste /
translated: Thus, mind and mental factors are not established as entities.

original: lag bzangs kyis zhus pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: lag bzangs kyis zhus pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: As the Subāhupariprcchāsūtra teaches:

original: 'jig rten 'di ni skad cig las lhag par mi gnas te /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ni skad cig las lhag par mi gnas te /
translated: “This world does not remain for more than an instant.

original: skad cig gang yin pa de la yang skye ba'i dus kyang gzhan gnas pa'i dus kyang gzhan 'gag pa'i dus kyang gzhan no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: skad cig gang yin pa de la yang skye ba'i dus kyang gzhan gnas pa'i dus kyang gzhan 'gag pa'i dus kyang gzhan no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: That instant also has a different time of arising, a different time of abiding, and a different time of ceasing.”

original: gzugs can yang nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po lus dang myu gu la sogs pa thams cad kyang /
analyzed: gzugs can yang nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po lus dang myu gu la sogs pa thams cad kyang /
translated: Also, all physical things, both internal and external, such as the body and sprouts,

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang / gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas brgyad 'dus pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang / gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas brgyad 'dus pa sha stag ste /
translated: are merely a collection of the eight substances called earth, water, fire, wind, form, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: de la lus dang myu gu dag ni sa ma yin la sa las gzhan pa yang ma yin /🔽de gnyis la yang sa med /
analyzed: de la lus dang myu gu dag ni sa ma yin la sa las gzhan pa yang ma yin / de gnyis la yang sa med /
translated: Earth is not the sprout, nor is the sprout something other than earth.🔽Earth does not exist in the sprout,

original: sa la yang de gnyis med do //
analyzed: sa la yang de gnyis med do //
translated: nor does the sprout exist in earth.

original: de bzhin du bdun po gzhan dag la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdun po gzhan dag la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same is to be applied to the other seven.

original: sa dang chu la sogs pa dag nyid kyang rdzas brgyad 'dus pa'i bdag nyid de ;
analyzed: sa dang chu la sogs pa dag nyid kyang rdzas brgyad 'dus pa'i bdag nyid de ;
translated: Earth, water, and so on are also the nature of an aggregation of eight substances.🔽Form is not earth, nor is earth something other than form.

original: de la gzugs ni sa nyid ma yin la gzugs las sa gzhan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de la gzugs ni sa nyid ma yin la gzugs las sa gzhan pa yang ma yin /
translated: Earth does not exist in form,

original: gzugs la yang sa med /🔽sal yang gzugs med de /
analyzed: gzugs la yang sa med / sal yang gzugs med de /
translated: nor does form exist in earth,

original: gzhi dang gzhag pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi dang gzhag pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the basis and that which is based on it does not exist.

original: de bzhin du ltag ma re re la yang re re'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du ltag ma re re la yang re re'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: In the same way, each of the other elements does not exist in the nature of each.

original: de bzhin du 'byung ba gsum @119b yang sa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'byung ba gsum @119b yang sa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the three elements are not earth,

original: ngo bo nyid dang / las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their natures and functions are different.

original: 'byung ba gsum las sa gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba gsum las sa gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Earth is not something other than the three elements,

original: de dag ma gtogs par sa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ma gtogs par sa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because earth is not perceived apart from them.

original: gal te 'byung ba gsum ma gtogs par sa 'grub par gyur na de'i phyir 'byung ba gsum la sa gnas pa'am sa la 'byung ba gnas par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba gsum ma gtogs par sa 'grub par gyur na de'i phyir 'byung ba gsum la sa gnas pa'am sa la 'byung ba gnas par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If earth were established apart from the three elements, then either earth would be the location of the three elements or the three elements would be the location of earth.

original: 'byung ba gsum ma gtogs par sa'i ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: 'byung ba gsum ma gtogs par sa'i ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: But apart from the three elements, there is no intrinsic reality of earth.

original: me las logs shig na bud shing med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: me las logs shig na bud shing med pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the fact that fuel does not exist apart from fire.

original: me yang 'byung ba gsum 'dus pa spyir gnas pa nyid la dmigs par zad kyi me 'ba' zhig gi ngo bo nyid ni rdul phran tsam yang med do //
analyzed: me yang 'byung ba gsum 'dus pa spyir gnas pa nyid la dmigs par zad kyi me 'ba' zhig gi ngo bo nyid ni rdul phran tsam yang med do //
translated: Fire is merely the observation of the general presence of the three elements. There is not even an atom of fire that exists by its own intrinsic reality.

original: gal te 'byung ba gsum ma gtogs par me 'ba' zhig yod par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba gsum ma gtogs par me 'ba' zhig yod par gyur na /
translated: If fire existed apart from the three elements,

original: bud shing med par yang me dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: bud shing med par yang me dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: it would be logical that fire would be observed without fuel.

original: de bzhin du chu dang rlung gnyis kyang ngo bo nyid 'ba' zhig pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu dang rlung gnyis kyang ngo bo nyid 'ba' zhig pa med do //
translated: In the same way, water and wind also do not exist as mere intrinsic realities.

original: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyang dri dang ro dang reg pa ma gtogs par med la de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyang phan tshun gcig la gcig ma gtogs par med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyang dri dang ro dang reg pa ma gtogs par med la de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyang phan tshun gcig la gcig ma gtogs par med do //
translated: The entity of form does not exist apart from smell, taste, and the tangible. The entities of those do not exist apart from each other.

original: de dag gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: They are not identical, nor are they different.

original: gzugs nyid kyang dri dang ro dang reg pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs nyid kyang dri dang ro dang reg pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Form is not smell, taste, and the tangible,

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their characteristics are different.

original: gzugs de dag las gzhan pa nyid kyang ma yin la /🔽gzugs la yang de dag med de /
analyzed: gzugs de dag las gzhan pa nyid kyang ma yin la / gzugs la yang de dag med de /
translated: Form is not different from them,🔽and they are not in form.

original: de dag la yang gzugs med de /
analyzed: de dag la yang gzugs med de /
translated: They are not in them,

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not different.

original: tha dad pa'i dngos po las kyang sa la sogs pa dag las gzugs la sogs pa tha dad du bkar te de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang / de la de dag yod pa dang de dag la de yod pa ma yin par dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i dngos po las kyang sa la sogs pa dag las gzugs la sogs pa tha dad du bkar te de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang / de la de dag yod pa dang de dag la de yod pa ma yin par dgag par bya'o //
translated: The difference of things is refuted in the case of earth, etc., and form, etc., when they are distinguished as identical or different, as existing in each other or not existing in each other.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag kyang phan tshun blos rnam par phye ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag kyang phan tshun blos rnam par phye ste /
translated: Form, etc., are also distinguished by the intellect.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang de la de dag yod pa dang / de dag la de yod pa ma yin par dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang de la de dag yod pa dang / de dag la de yod pa ma yin par dgag par bya'o //
translated: and that they are neither identical nor different, and that they do not exist in each other, and that each does not exist in the other.

original: 'ba' zhig pa'i dngos pos kyang gzugs las rdul phra rab bkar te /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa'i dngos pos kyang gzugs las rdul phra rab bkar te /
translated: By the thing itself, one should refute that form is different from the atoms,

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang / de la de dag yod pa dang / de dag la de yod pa ma yin par dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang / de la de dag yod pa dang / de dag la de yod pa ma yin par dgag par bya'o //
translated: and that they are neither identical nor different, and that they do not exist in each other, and that each does not exist in the other.

original: rdul phra rab dag kyang phyogs kyi bye brag gis cha drug tu dbye bas tha dad la /
analyzed: rdul phra rab dag kyang phyogs kyi bye brag gis cha drug tu dbye bas tha dad la /
translated: The atoms are different, because they are divided into six parts by the directions.

original: cha yang phyogs kyi bye brag gis drug tu dbye bas tha dad pa dag kyang de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang / de la de dag yod pa dang de dag la de yod pa ma yin par dgag par bya ste /🔽de ltar dngos po rnams ngo @120a * //
analyzed: cha yang phyogs kyi bye brag gis drug tu dbye bas tha dad pa dag kyang de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang / de la de dag yod pa dang de dag la de yod pa ma yin par dgag par bya ste / de ltar dngos po rnams ngo @120a * //
translated: The parts are also different, because they are divided into six parts by the directions. One should refute that they are neither identical nor different, and that they do not exist in each other, and that each does not exist in the other.

original: bo nyid yongs su ma grub par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: bo nyid yongs su ma grub par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus one should understand that things are not established by their own nature.

original: yang na dngos nyid skye med phyir //
analyzed: yang na dngos nyid skye med phyir //
translated: Or, because of the non-arising of the thing itself,

original: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis ni rgyu ni 'bras bu logs shig par skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis ni rgyu ni 'bras bu logs shig par skyed par mi byed de /
translated: The reason “because” indicates that the cause does not generate the effect as something separate.

original: rgyu 'bang zhig yod du zin kyang 'bras bu skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu 'bang zhig yod du zin kyang 'bras bu skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if the cause exists, the effect does not arise.

original: rkyen rnams kyang skyed par byed pa dag ma yin te /
analyzed: rkyen rnams kyang skyed par byed pa dag ma yin te /
translated: The conditions also do not generate.

original: rgyu med na 'bras bu bskyed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med na 'bras bu bskyed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without a cause, they cannot generate an effect.

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa dag kyang skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa dag kyang skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The assemblage of causes and conditions also does not generate.

original: de dag la 'bras bu myu gu'am mi zhes bya ba dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la 'bras bu myu gu'am mi zhes bya ba dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect, such as a sprout or a person, does not exist in them.

original: de'i phyir kun rdzob tu rgyu dang rkyen du snang ba'i bdag nyid las skye bar mthong ba zhing ngo bo nyid ni med de sgyu ma'i glang po che bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun rdzob tu rgyu dang rkyen du snang ba'i bdag nyid las skye bar mthong ba zhing ngo bo nyid ni med de sgyu ma'i glang po che bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, although arising is seen conventionally from a self-entity that appears as causes and conditions, it does not exist in reality, like an illusory elephant.

original: dper na sgyu ma'i glang po che ni sgyu mkhan gyi bsam pa dang / rtsva dang / me tog dang / sman dang / rma bya'i mjug sgro dag gis mngon par bsgrubs pa rgyu rkyen dang / glang po che lta bur snang ba ni yod la de la glang po che yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid ni med do //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i glang po che ni sgyu mkhan gyi bsam pa dang / rtsva dang / me tog dang / sman dang / rma bya'i mjug sgro dag gis mngon par bsgrubs pa rgyu rkyen dang / glang po che lta bur snang ba ni yod la de la glang po che yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid ni med do //
translated: For example, an illusory elephant is accomplished by the intention of the magician, the grass, flowers, herbs, and peacock feathers, etc., which are the causes and conditions, and it appears as an elephant. But the elephant does not have a real nature.

original: glang po che yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong yang glang po che'i gzugs ni snang ste /
analyzed: glang po che yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong yang glang po che'i gzugs ni snang ste /
translated: Although the elephant is empty of a real nature, the form of the elephant appears.

original: de la sgyu ma shes pa dag gis ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa de bzhin du phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad kyang rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pas bskyed pa bcos ma'i ngo bo nyid du ni dmigs su yod la /
analyzed: de la sgyu ma shes pa dag gis ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa de bzhin du phyi dang nang gi dngos po thams cad kyang rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pas bskyed pa bcos ma'i ngo bo nyid du ni dmigs su yod la /
translated: In the same way, those who know illusion do not perceive a real nature. In the same way, all outer and inner things are produced by the assembly of causes and conditions. They are perceived as having a fabricated nature.

original: de dag la rgyu dang rkyen du snang ba ma gtogs pa'i dngos po ni rdul phra rab tsam gyi cha shas kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag la rgyu dang rkyen du snang ba ma gtogs pa'i dngos po ni rdul phra rab tsam gyi cha shas kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But in them there is not even a part as small as an atom of a thing that exists apart from the appearance of causes and conditions.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: rab 'byor gang la gnas nas sems can rnams las sna tshogs mngon par 'du bya ba byed pa'i dngos po ni sgra'i rtse mo'i cha shas tsam yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang la gnas nas sems can rnams las sna tshogs mngon par 'du bya ba byed pa'i dngos po ni sgra'i rtse mo'i cha shas tsam yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: Subhūti, there is not even a mere portion of the tip of a sound that is a thing that sentient beings engage in various actions based on.🔽And similarly,

original: dngos po 'ga' yang med mi skye //
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' yang med mi skye //
translated: Nothing arises that exists.

original: yod pa mi skye yod med min //
analyzed: yod pa mi skye yod med min //
translated: The existent does not arise. The existent-nonexistent does not arise.

original: rkyen rnams nyi tshe 'ba' zhig dag / skye ba dang ni 'gag par snang //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rkyen rnams nyi tshe 'ba' zhig dag / skye ba dang ni 'gag par snang // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Only conditions are seen to arise and cease.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa gzhan gyis tshad ma gnyis nye bar sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa gzhan gyis tshad ma gnyis nye bar sbyor bar byed de /
translated: In order to demonstrate that meaning, another set of verses applies two valid forms of cognition.

original: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid yod par //
analyzed: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid yod par //
translated: Things do not exist inherently

original: mi mthong kun rdzob skye yod phyir //
analyzed: mi mthong kun rdzob skye yod phyir //
translated: Because the existent is not seen and because the existent arises.

original: yang na rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yang na rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir //
translated: Or because they possess a cause,

original: sgyu ma'i glang chen ji bzhin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i glang chen ji bzhin no //
translated: Like an illusory elephant.

original: zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
translated: Things do not exist inherently because the existent is not seen.

original: kun rdzob tu rgyu dang rkyen 'dra ba'i bdag nyid las skye ba yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rgyu dang rkyen 'dra ba'i bdag nyid las skye ba yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because on the conventional level, arising from a cause that is similar to itself does exist.

original: sgyu ma'i glang po che bzhin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i glang po che bzhin no //
translated: It is like an illusory elephant.

original: yang na so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu bskyed nus pa'i rgyu dang @120b ldan pa'i phyir sgyu ma'i glang po che bzhin no //🔽'dir smras pa /
analyzed: yang na so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu bskyed nus pa'i rgyu dang @120b ldan pa'i phyir sgyu ma'i glang po che bzhin no // 'dir smras pa /
translated: Or, it is like an illusory elephant because it is a cause that is able to produce a result that is similar to itself.

original: khyod skye ba med pa bsgrub pa'i sgo nas yod pa nyid 'gog par byed pas med pa nyid khas blangs shing chad par smra ba yang bsgrub par gyur to zhe na /
analyzed: khyod skye ba med pa bsgrub pa'i sgo nas yod pa nyid 'gog par byed pas med pa nyid khas blangs shing chad par smra ba yang bsgrub par gyur to zhe na /
translated: Here, someone might say, “Since you refute existence by proving non-arising, you accept nonexistence and you are a proponent of nihilism.”

original: bshad pa / gal te kho bos bsgrubs pa'i tshul gyis dngos po rnams kyi yod pa nyid bkag pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid bsgrubs par gyur na ni de ltar yang 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi phyir kho bo mtha' gnyis spang ba'i tshul gyis dbu ma'i lam ston pa'i shes
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te kho bos bsgrubs pa'i tshul gyis dngos po rnams kyi yod pa nyid bkag pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid bsgrubs par gyur na ni de ltar yang 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi phyir kho bo mtha' gnyis spang ba'i tshul gyis dbu ma'i lam ston pa'i shes
translated: We would reply, “If by refuting the existence of things through a method of proof, we were to prove their nature of nonexistence, then that would be the case. However, because we teach the middle path that abandons the two extremes, our knowledge of the nature of things is not like that of the tīrthikas.

original: pa rtogs par 'dod pa de'i phyir med pa nyid kyang 'gog par byed de /
analyzed: pa rtogs par 'dod pa de'i phyir med pa nyid kyang 'gog par byed de /
translated: Therefore, non-existence is also refuted.

original: dngos rnams med ces bya ba'i blo //
analyzed: dngos rnams med ces bya ba'i blo //
translated: The cognition that things do not exist

original: don bzhin yin par mi 'dod de //
analyzed: don bzhin yin par mi 'dod de //
translated: is not accepted as being in accordance with fact,

original: rtog pa'i sgo nas grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rtog pa'i sgo nas grub pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is established by way of conception,

original: mtho yor la ni mi blo bzhin //
analyzed: mtho yor la ni mi blo bzhin //
translated: like the cognition of a man with respect to a cairn.

original: zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams med do zhes bya ba'i blo gang yin pa de yang don dam par ni log pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams med do zhes bya ba'i blo gang yin pa de yang don dam par ni log pa yin te /
translated: The cognition that things do not exist is also erroneous in the ultimate, because it is established by way of conception.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de yang rtog pa'i sgo nas grub pa'i phyir dper na mun khrod dam thag ring po na 'dug pa'i shing rdo la sogs pa la mir shes pa'i blo bzhin no //🔽yang na yang dag ma yin blos //
analyzed: de yang rtog pa'i sgo nas grub pa'i phyir dper na mun khrod dam thag ring po na 'dug pa'i shing rdo la sogs pa la mir shes pa'i blo bzhin no // yang na yang dag ma yin blos //
translated: It is like the cognition that apprehends a man with respect to a cairn, or a post in the dark, or something at a distance.🔽Or,🔽the object of the unreal imagination

original: dmigs bya'i dngos bdag 'og bar 'dod //
analyzed: dmigs bya'i dngos bdag 'og bar 'dod //
translated: is accepted as the obscuration of the ultimate.

original: rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul yin phyir //
analyzed: rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul yin phyir //
translated: Because it is the object of conceptual consciousness,

original: smig rgyu la ni chu blo bzhin //
analyzed: smig rgyu la ni chu blo bzhin //
translated: like the cognition of water with respect to a mirage.

original: zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i blos dmigs par bya ba'i don gyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni log pa yin gyi yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i blos dmigs par bya ba'i don gyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni log pa yin gyi yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of an object that is perceived by an unreal imagination is unreal, not real.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i rtog pa shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i rtog pa shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is the object of a conceptual consciousness that does not correspond to the object.

original: dper na smig rgyu la chur 'du shes pa yod du zin kyang chu nyid ma yin pa bzhin no //🔽gang dag 'di skad ces dngos po rnams ni gcig tu yod pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na smig rgyu la chur 'du shes pa yod du zin kyang chu nyid ma yin pa bzhin no // gang dag 'di skad ces dngos po rnams ni gcig tu yod pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: For example, even though one may perceive a mirage as water, it is not water.

original: rgyu'i skad cig ma 'gag pa'i phyir ro //🔽gcig tu med pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i skad cig ma 'gag pa'i phyir ro // gcig tu med pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Some say that things are not exclusively existent because the moment of the cause has not ceased.

original: 'bras bu'i skad cig ma skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i skad cig ma skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not exclusively nonexistent because the moment of the effect has arisen.🔽Their cognition is the nature of both existence and nonexistence.

original: de'i blo yang yod med kyi ngo bo nyid kho na'o zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i blo yang yod med kyi ngo bo nyid kho na'o zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
translated: To respond to them, it is said:

original: yod med blos ni rtogs bya ba //
analyzed: yod med blos ni rtogs bya ba //
translated: The cognition of existence and nonexistence

original: bkag phyir de bzhin mkhas rnams kyi //
analyzed: bkag phyir de bzhin mkhas rnams kyi //
translated: is refuted, and so the wise

original: rnam par mi rtog blo gros ni //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog blo gros ni //
translated: have a nonconceptual mind.

original: skye ba med pa'i tshul gyis skye //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i tshul gyis skye //
translated: They arise in the manner of non-arising.

original: zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams yod med gcig yin no snyam pa'i blo gang yin pa de yang de nyid du na log pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams yod med gcig yin no snyam pa'i blo gang yin pa de yang de nyid du na log pa yin te /
translated: The cognition that things are both existent and non-existent is also, in reality, erroneous,

original: de yang rtog pa'i sgo nyid nas grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang rtog pa'i sgo nyid nas grub pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is established by the door of imagination.

original: dper na mtho yor la 'di mi'am mtho yor snyam du the tshom zar zin kyang mi nyid yin no snyam pa'i blo log pa bzhin no //🔽de bzhin du yod med kyi blos dmigs @121a * //
analyzed: dper na mtho yor la 'di mi'am mtho yor snyam du the tshom zar zin kyang mi nyid yin no snyam pa'i blo log pa bzhin no // de bzhin du yod med kyi blos dmigs @121a * //
translated: For example, when one doubts whether this is a man or a post, the cognition that it is a man is erroneous.

original: par bya ba'i dngos po'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de yang de nyid du na log pa yin te /
analyzed: par bya ba'i dngos po'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de yang de nyid du na log pa yin te /
translated: In the same way, the nature of things that is the object of the cognition of existence and non-existence is also, in reality, erroneous,

original: de yang rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir smig rgyu la chu nyid bzhin te /
analyzed: de yang rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir smig rgyu la chu nyid bzhin te /
translated: because it is the object of conceptual cognition, like water in a mirage.

original: de la yang dang po chu'i blo skye zhing chur mi dmigs pa na de'i blo yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang dang po chu'i blo skye zhing chur mi dmigs pa na de'i blo yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, in the first place, the cognition of water arises, and when water is not perceived, the cognition of that also does not exist.

original: de'i phyir de ltar yod pa dang med pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi shes bya med pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa'i blo yang skye ba med la blo de'i skye ba med pa gang yin pa de nyid skye ba zhes nye bar gdags te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yod pa dang med pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi shes bya med pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa'i blo yang skye ba med la blo de'i skye ba med pa gang yin pa de nyid skye ba zhes nye bar gdags te /
translated: Therefore, since there is no object of knowledge that is the nature of both existence and nonexistence, the nonapprehending mind also does not arise. The nonarising of that mind is itself designated as arising,

original: dmigs su med pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the realization of nonapprehension.

original: skye ba med pa nyid ni de'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa nyid ni de'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that nonarising itself is its nonconceptuality.

original: gal te pha rol po dag 'di snyam du stong pa nyid ni dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med par byed pas dper na thobs bum pa la sogs pa 'jig par byed pa dang / mings  kyis skye bo zad par byed pa lta bu yin la stong pa nyid de rang gi stong pa nyid ma yin pas stong pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te pha rol po dag 'di snyam du stong pa nyid ni dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med par byed pas dper na thobs bum pa la sogs pa 'jig par byed pa dang / mings  kyis skye bo zad par byed pa lta bu yin la stong pa nyid de rang gi stong pa nyid ma yin pas stong pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir /
translated: If the opponent thinks, “Emptiness makes things nonexistent, like a hammer destroying a pot or a disease destroying a person, and that emptiness is not itself empty, because it is not free from the conception of emptiness,”

original: ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo gros srid par 'gyur snyam du sems pa bsal ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo gros srid par 'gyur snyam du sems pa bsal ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: he explains:

original: chos rnams thams cad stong pa'i phyir //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad stong pa'i phyir //
translated: Because all phenomena are empty,

original: de mi stong pa'i sgo nas kyang //
analyzed: de mi stong pa'i sgo nas kyang //
translated: the mind that is not empty

original: mi rtog blo gros mi 'dod min //
analyzed: mi rtog blo gros mi 'dod min //
translated: is not asserted to be non-conceptual,

original: de ni sngar bzhin bkag phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sngar bzhin bkag phyir ro //
translated: because it is refuted as before.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos rnams stong ngo snyam pa'i blo gang yin pa de yang don dam par na log pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos rnams stong ngo snyam pa'i blo gang yin pa de yang don dam par na log pa yin te /
translated: The mind that thinks, “All phenomena are empty,” is also ultimately mistaken,

original: rtog pa'i sgo nas grub pa'i phyir dper na mtho yor la mi'i blo bzhin no //
analyzed: rtog pa'i sgo nas grub pa'i phyir dper na mtho yor la mi'i blo bzhin no //
translated: because it is established by way of conception, like the thought that a cairn is a human.

original: de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi blos dmigs par bya ba'i dngos po'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni log pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi blos dmigs par bya ba'i dngos po'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni log pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, the nature of the entity that is observed by the mind of emptiness is mistaken,🔽because it is established by way of conception, like the thought that a cairn is a human.

original: rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dper na smig rgyu la chur shes pa bzhin no zhes snga ma bzhin du de yang bkag pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo gros mi srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dper na smig rgyu la chur shes pa bzhin no zhes snga ma bzhin du de yang bkag pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo gros mi srid pa ma yin te /
translated: Since this is refuted in the same way as above, it is not impossible for nonconceptual intelligence to exist.

original: 'o na ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it?

original: srid pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: srid pa kho na yin no //
translated: It is definitely possible.

original: mdo sde las stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces gsungs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir bshad pa /🔽gang phyir stong nyid stong sogs kyi //
analyzed: mdo sde las stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces gsungs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir bshad pa / gang phyir stong nyid stong sogs kyi //
translated: Because it follows the sutra’s statement, “The emptiness of emptiness,” it is explained:🔽Because emptiness is empty of the entity of emptiness and so on,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong de'i phyir //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong de'i phyir //
translated: it is empty by its very essence.🔽Therefore the learned do not view

original: mkhas pa stong pa nyid la yang //🔽stong pa nyid du lta mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mkhas pa stong pa nyid la yang // stong pa nyid du lta mi 'gyur //
translated: even emptiness as emptiness.

original: zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir stong pa nyid yin la de yang ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs su med pa dang dngos po med pa yin pas mkhas pa rnams de la stong pa nyid yin no zhes stong pa nyid kyi dngos
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir stong pa nyid yin la de yang ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs su med pa dang dngos po med pa yin pas mkhas pa rnams de la stong pa nyid yin no zhes stong pa nyid kyi dngos
translated: Because the entity of things is not observed, they are empty. That emptiness is also not observed and is nonexistent by its very essence. Therefore the learned do not view even emptiness as emptiness.

original: por gyur par mi lta bas stong pa nyid du @121b yang rnam par rtog par mi byed do //
analyzed: por gyur par mi lta bas stong pa nyid du @121b yang rnam par rtog par mi byed do //
translated: Since they do not view emptiness as an entity, they do not conceive emptiness.

original: gang yang yod pa ma yin pa de la dngos por 'dzin par byed pa de dag ni smad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang yang yod pa ma yin pa de la dngos por 'dzin par byed pa de dag ni smad par 'gyur te /
translated: Those who apprehend as an entity that which does not exist are to be disparaged.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang stong pa nyid du lta ba de ni gsor mi rung bar nga smra'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid du lta ba de ni gsor mi rung bar nga smra'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: I say that those who view emptiness as an entity are incurable.

original: ci ste 'di snyam du stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid yin te /
analyzed: ci ste 'di snyam du stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid yin te /
translated: If you think, “What is emptiness is suchness,

original: de ni snang ba med pa dang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: de ni snang ba med pa dang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: and since it is the absence of appearance and the absence of entity,🔽is it not the case that the object of the Tathāgata’s wisdom, which observes that, is not reality itself?”

original: de la dmigs pa bde bar gshegs pa'i ye shes de yang don ji lta ba bzhin nyid ma yin par 'gyur ram ci zhes bya bar sems pa dag gi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa bde bar gshegs pa'i ye shes de yang don ji lta ba bzhin nyid ma yin par 'gyur ram ci zhes bya bar sems pa dag gi phyir bshad pa /
translated: The response to that is:

original: dngos po'i bdag nyid snang med na //
analyzed: dngos po'i bdag nyid snang med na //
translated: If the nature of an entity is not apparent,

original: mi rtog blo yi spyod yul yang //
analyzed: mi rtog blo yi spyod yul yang //
translated: then the object of a nonconceptual mind

original: don bzhin ma yin dmigs bya'i phyir //
analyzed: don bzhin ma yin dmigs bya'i phyir //
translated: is not real because it is observed.

original: chu zla la ni zla blo bzhin //
analyzed: chu zla la ni zla blo bzhin //
translated: It is like the cognition of a moon in the water.

original: zhes bya ba ni chu zla la yang mngon sum gyi blo rnam par rtog pa skye ba med pa'i phyir dmigs par bya ba nyid du mthun pas log pa yin pa de bzhin du snang ba med pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yang log pa nyid yin te
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chu zla la yang mngon sum gyi blo rnam par rtog pa skye ba med pa'i phyir dmigs par bya ba nyid du mthun pas log pa yin pa de bzhin du snang ba med pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yang log pa nyid yin te
translated: Likewise, the domain of non-apparent pristine wisdom is false.

original: / 'dir khungs ni mdo sde las /
analyzed: / 'dir khungs ni mdo sde las /
translated: The source for this is a sutra, which states:

original: byang chub kyang rmi lam lta bu dang sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyang rmi lam lta bu dang sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: “Enlightenment is like a dream, like an illusion.”🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / rnam par mi rtog don yul gyi //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rnam par mi rtog don yul gyi //
translated: The awarenesses whose objects are non-conceptual

original: blo rnams rtog pa med pa'ang brdzun //
analyzed: blo rnams rtog pa med pa'ang brdzun //
translated: Are also false, being non-conceptual.

original: bdag med la sogs ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag med la sogs ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: Because they have the nature of selflessness, etc.,

original: dper na rnam rtog bcas blo bzhin //
analyzed: dper na rnam rtog bcas blo bzhin //
translated: They are like conceptual awarenesses.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo'i don gyi yul snang ba med pa zhes bya ba gang la yod pa'i blo rnam par rtog pa med pa de yang log pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo'i don gyi yul snang ba med pa zhes bya ba gang la yod pa'i blo rnam par rtog pa med pa de yang log pa yin te /
translated: The awarenesses that have the objects of non-conceptual awareness, which are called “non-apparent,” are also false.

original: bdag dang bde ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa spangs su zin kyang /
analyzed: bdag dang bde ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa spangs su zin kyang /
translated: Even though they have abandoned the conceptions of self, pleasure, etc.,

original: bdag med pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it has the nature of conceptualization, such as the self, suffering, and so on.

original: dper na rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i blo gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i blo gzhan bzhin no //

analyzed: gal te 'di skad ces gzhan gyi phyogs su 'byin pa'i phyir dang / rang gi phyogs mi 'dzin pa'i phyir co 'dri ba nyid du ma gyur tam zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las grags pa'i de nyid dang / de thugs su chud pa'i ston pa phyogs nyid du gzhag par bya ste / shes bya rnam kun ma grub phyir //

original: gang la rnam par mi rtog pa'i //

original: blo yang skye bar mi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: blo yang skye bar mi 'gyur ba //

original: de nyid mnyam med de mkhyen gsungs //
analyzed: de nyid mnyam med de mkhyen gsungs //

original: zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba rnam pa lnga po bstan pa de dag rnam pa thams cad du ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir @122a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba rnam pa lnga po bstan pa de dag rnam pa thams cad du ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir @122a * //
translated: The five aspects of the ultimate truth that were taught—past, future, present, inexpressible, and unconditioned—are not established in any way as having any nature.

analyzed: zhi ba mtshan nyid med pa tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa dngos po med pa mngon par 'du bya ba med pa brjod du med pa /

analyzed: mnyam pa med pa nyid yin par de mkhyen pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa gsung ngo //

original: de rtogs phyir na gang zhig la //
analyzed: de rtogs phyir na gang zhig la //

original: blo skye med pa sangs rgyas dngos //
analyzed: blo skye med pa sangs rgyas dngos //

original: rnam rtog gnyid ni sangs phyir dang // rtog pa med pas rgyas phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam rtog gnyid ni sangs phyir dang // rtog pa med pas rgyas phyir ro //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de nyid rnam pa de lta bu de rtogs pa'i phyir gang la blo skye ba med pa de ni sangs rgyas dngos zhes bya ste /

analyzed: rtog pa med pa nyid rtogs pa'o zhes nye bar gdags ba byas pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'o na rtog pa de nye bar btags par 'gyur te /

original: nye bar btags pa ma yin te /

analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de nyid rtogs pas mdzad pa nyid yin zhe na /

original: yongs su shes par bya ba dang spang bar bya ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba'i rnam pas sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang / lam mthar thug pa brnyes pa'i blo gang gis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag yongs su shes pa dang spangs pa dang mngon sum du mdzad pa dang /

analyzed: bsgom pa thugs su chud pa des 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: yongs su @122b shes bya yongs shes shing //
analyzed: yongs su @122b shes bya yongs shes shing //
translated: The object of full knowing is fully known,🔽The object of abandonment is abandoned,

original: spang bya spangs shing mngon sum byas //
analyzed: spang bya spangs shing mngon sum byas //

original: bsgom bya dag ni bsgoms pas na //
analyzed: bsgom bya dag ni bsgoms pas na //

analyzed: de phyir bzod ldan nga sangs rgyas // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis ni mnyam pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
translated: According to the Mahayana, he is called a Buddha because he realizes the equality of all things.

original: ji skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo las /
analyzed: ji skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo las /

analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' zhing sdug bsngal gyis kyang mi 'da'o //

analyzed: yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi steng na 'og min zhes bya ba'i gzhal med khang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mchog khyad par du 'phags pa bla na med pa las nges par byung ba'i dkyil 'khor na byang chub
translated: Also, above the trichiliocosm is the celestial mansion called Akaniṣṭha, the realm of the highest gods. In the center of that realm, which is the supreme, exalted, and unsurpassed source of the roots of virtue that transcend the world, is the bodhimaṇḍa, the site of enlightenment.

original: sems dpa' 'dod pa tsam gyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i mthu yod pa dkrigs pa dag gis mchod cing /

original: bde bar gshegs pa phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa mtha' yas pa dag gi phyag gis bla na med pa'i dam pa'i chos kyi rgyal srid la mnga' gsol ba'i cod pan dbu la gsol ba /

analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas med sangs rgyas pas ;
translated: The perfect buddhas are not buddhas,🔽and so they are called perfect buddhas.

original: / lha mir bcas pa'i 'jig rten na //
analyzed: / lha mir bcas pa'i 'jig rten na //
translated: In the world with its gods and humans,

original: de ni rdzogs sangs rgyas zhes brjod //
analyzed: de ni rdzogs sangs rgyas zhes brjod //
translated: they are called perfect buddhas.

original: ces bya ba ni chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid sra ba nyid dang / gsher ba nyid dang / tsha ba nyid dang / yang zhing g-yo ba nyid la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa du ma ngag mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa mnyam @123b pa nyid du thugs su chud cing bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid sra ba nyid dang / gsher ba nyid dang / tsha ba nyid dang / yang zhing g-yo ba nyid la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa du ma ngag mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa mnyam @123b pa nyid du thugs su chud cing bskyed pa dang /
translated: The nature of phenomena is not different in terms of the various distinctions of solidity, fluidity, heat, and mobility, and so forth. It is the realization and creation of the equality of sameness in the single characteristic of the absence of characteristics.

original: dgag pa ma mdzad par bdag dang / gzhan dang / gnyi ga dang / rgyu med pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa las skye ba med pa'i phyir skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: dgag pa ma mdzad par bdag dang / gzhan dang / gnyi ga dang / rgyu med pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa las skye ba med pa'i phyir skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: Without making any distinctions, it is the equality of sameness in the absence of origination and cessation because there is no origination from self, other, both, no cause, existence, or nonexistence.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid mnyam pa nyid kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa med pas shes bya dang / shes pa dbyer med pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid mnyam pa nyid kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa med pas shes bya dang / shes pa dbyer med pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: And the equality of self and others is also perfect buddhahood, in the manner of the inseparability of the object of knowledge and the knower, because there is no conceptualization of subject and object.

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid du rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa med pa'i tshul du rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid du rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa med pa'i tshul du rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas /
translated: And it is perfect buddhahood in the manner of the absence of perfect buddhahood, in the manner of the absence of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de'i phyir lha dang mir bcas pa'i 'jig rten na de ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir lha dang mir bcas pa'i 'jig rten na de ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, in the world with its gods and humans, he is called the perfect buddha.

original: chos rnams bsal dang gzhag med phyir //
analyzed: chos rnams bsal dang gzhag med phyir //
translated: Because phenomena are neither to be removed nor established,

original: chos nyid ji lta de bzhin du //🔽gang phyir de ni gshegs gyur pa //
analyzed: chos nyid ji lta de bzhin du // gang phyir de ni gshegs gyur pa //
translated: just as the nature of phenomena is,🔽he has gone to that,

original: de phyir de ni de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: de phyir de ni de bzhin gshegs //
translated: therefore he is the Tathāgata.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pas bsal ba med pa'i phyir dang / ther zug tu gnas pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pas gzhag pa med pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pas bsal ba med pa'i phyir dang / ther zug tu gnas pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pas gzhag pa med pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
translated: Whether the tathāgatas appear or not, the reality of phenomena remains just as it is.

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de ni gnas pa nyid yin pas de la cung zad kyang sel ba dang gzhog par mi mdzad par chos nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du mkhyen pa'i phyir de bzhin mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de ni gnas pa nyid yin pas de la cung zad kyang sel ba dang gzhog par mi mdzad par chos nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du mkhyen pa'i phyir de bzhin mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because they know reality just as it is, they are called “thus-gone.”

original: yang na de bzhin bzhud pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na de bzhin bzhud pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: Alternatively, they are called “tathāgatas” because they have gone to suchness.

original: gang gi phyir de ni chos nyid de las ma gol bar ngo bo nyid med par mnyam pa nyid du rtogs par gshegs par gyur pa de'i phyir de ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni chos nyid de las ma gol bar ngo bo nyid med par mnyam pa nyid du rtogs par gshegs par gyur pa de'i phyir de ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Because they have gone to the realization of the equality of the lack of inherent nature that is not deviating from that reality, they are called “tathāgatas.”

original: de nyid kyi rnam grangs gzhan brjod par bya ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rnam grangs gzhan brjod par bya ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Another synonym for that is stated in order to teach what is to be expressed:

original: rtogs bya gtan dang ma lus dang // mthar lhung rnam par spangs pa dag / rtog med tshul gyis rtogs pa yis //
analyzed: rtogs bya gtan dang ma lus dang // mthar lhung rnam par spangs pa dag / rtog med tshul gyis rtogs pa yis //
translated: The Sugata is the one who has realized the object of realization, which is eternal, complete, and free from falling into extremes, by means of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: bde gshegs phyir ni bde bar gshegs //
analyzed: bde gshegs phyir ni bde bar gshegs //
translated: He is the Sugata because he has gone to bliss.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'dir gtan du zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis ni yang bzlas mi dgos pa'i don bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir gtan du zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis ni yang bzlas mi dgos pa'i don bstan te /
translated: Here, the word eternal teaches the meaning of not needing to be repeated,

original: rims nad legs par byang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rims nad legs par byang ba bzhin no //
translated: like a fully cured illness.

original: ma lus par zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis ni mtha' dag gi don bstan te /
analyzed: ma lus par zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis ni mtha' dag gi don bstan te /
translated: The word complete teaches the meaning of all,

original: bum pa gang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa gang ba bzhin no //
translated: like a full vase.

original: mthar lhung ba rnam par spangs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis ni legs pa'i don bstan te gzugs bzang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mthar lhung ba rnam par spangs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis ni legs pa'i don bstan te gzugs bzang ba bzhin no //
translated: The word free from falling into extremes teaches the meaning of good, like a good form.

original: gshegs zhes bya ba'i sgra @124a * //
analyzed: gshegs zhes bya ba'i sgra @124a * //
translated: The word gone

original: ni rtogs pa dang song ba'i don rnam pa gnyis su 'dren te /
analyzed: ni rtogs pa dang song ba'i don rnam pa gnyis su 'dren te /
translated: is interpreted to have two meanings: realization and going.

original: de la rtogs pa ni phung po dang / khams dang skye mched kyi mtshan nyid kyi shes bya gtan du dang / ma lus par dang / mthar lhung ba rnam par spangs pa dag rtog pa med pa'i tshul gyis rtogs par gshegs shing rtogs pa'i phyir na bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya'o //🔽song ba ni lam gtan du legs par bsgoms pa'i phyir las dang nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag ma lus par yongs su zad pas srid par 'gro ba dag tu mthar lhung ba med par yang dag par drungs phyung ba'i
analyzed: de la rtogs pa ni phung po dang / khams dang skye mched kyi mtshan nyid kyi shes bya gtan du dang / ma lus par dang / mthar lhung ba rnam par spangs pa dag rtog pa med pa'i tshul gyis rtogs par gshegs shing rtogs pa'i phyir na bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya'o // song ba ni lam gtan du legs par bsgoms pa'i phyir las dang nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag ma lus par yongs su zad pas srid par 'gro ba dag tu mthar lhung ba med par yang dag par drungs phyung ba'i
translated: The gone to bliss is so called because he has gone and realized, by way of non-conceptualization, the objects of knowledge characterized by the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, in terms of their being forever, completely, and utterly abandoned, without falling into an extreme.🔽The gone well is so called because he has gone to the stage of the unsurpassed Dharma body, by way of non-going, by completely exhausting all aspects of the smallest of the small karma and afflictions, and so forth, and by completely uprooting the falling into an extreme of cyclic existence, by means of the path that is well cultivated forever.

original: phyir gshegs pa med pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa'i chos kyi sku'i gnas su gshegs pa'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya'o //🔽gzhal med gzhal yas rtogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: phyir gshegs pa med pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa'i chos kyi sku'i gnas su gshegs pa'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya'o // gzhal med gzhal yas rtogs pa'i phyir //
translated: The gone to bliss is so called because he has gone to the stage of the unsurpassed Dharma body, by way of non-going, by completely exhausting all aspects of the smallest of the small karma and afflictions, and so forth, and by completely uprooting the falling into an extreme of cyclic existence, by means of the path that is well cultivated forever.🔽Because of realizing the immeasurable and the inconceivable,

original: grangs med gzung du med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: grangs med gzung du med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of being beyond number and beyond apprehension,

original: bsam yas sems yul ma yin phyir //
analyzed: bsam yas sems yul ma yin phyir //
translated: Because it is not an object of the inconceivable mind.

original: bstan min bstan du med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bstan min bstan du med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is not shown, because it is not an object of demonstration.

original: zhes bya ba la 'dir skad cig gcig gis chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas sngar bstan pa de ni chos can no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'dir skad cig gcig gis chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas sngar bstan pa de ni chos can no //
translated: Here, the Buddha who was previously taught, called the knowledge that in a single moment knows the equality of all dharmas, is the subject.

original: de ni gzhal du med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i chos so //
analyzed: de ni gzhal du med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i chos so //
translated: That it is immeasurable is its property.

original: gzhal yas rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: gzhal yas rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: Because it is beyond measure is the reason.

original: de la rtogs par bya ba'i chos kyi dbyings mu med pa'i mtshan nyid gzhal yas pa mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rtogs par bya ba'i chos kyi dbyings mu med pa'i mtshan nyid gzhal yas pa mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it possesses the immeasurable characteristic of the dharmadhatu to be realized.

original: nam mkha' bzhin no zhes 'og nas 'byung ba ni dpe yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin no zhes 'og nas 'byung ba ni dpe yin no //
translated: Like space, as will be stated below, is the example.

original: de nyid grangs med pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid grangs med pa yin te /
translated: That itself is innumerable,

original: gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is ungraspable.

original: 'di ltar de ni dmigs su med pa'i phyir gzung du med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni dmigs su med pa'i phyir gzung du med do //
translated: In this way, it is ungraspable because it is not an object of perception.

original: dmigs su yod pa'i rdzas la ni gcig la sogs pa'i grangs su brjod pas gzung du yod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dmigs su yod pa'i rdzas la ni gcig la sogs pa'i grangs su brjod pas gzung du yod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: A substance that is perceived is apprehended because it is described as one, etc.

original: de ni chos thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shes rab kyi spyod yul yang ma yin te /🔽de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nyid bsam yas pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shes rab kyi spyod yul yang ma yin te / de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // de nyid bsam yas pa yin te /
translated: It is not the domain of the wisdom that discerns all phenomena because it is the reality of thusness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag gi sems kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag gi sems kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is inconceivable because it is not the object of the mind of the six collections of consciousness.

original: de ni chos kyi skye mched kyang ma yin zhing de chos kyang ma yin /
analyzed: de ni chos kyi skye mched kyang ma yin zhing de chos kyang ma yin /
translated: It is not the sense base of mental objects and it is not mental objects.

original: chos ma yin pas ma yin la /
analyzed: chos ma yin pas ma yin la /
translated: It is not not mental objects.

original: gnyi gar yang tha snyad gdags su med pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nyid bstan par bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyi gar yang tha snyad gdags su med pa'i phyir ro // de nyid bstan par bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not both because it cannot be designated as either.

original: bstan du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not something that can be shown because it cannot be shown.🔽It is not a different object of the same type because it is not a different object of the same type.

original: de la @124b rigs mthun pa'i don gzhan med pas dper na /
analyzed: de la @124b rigs mthun pa'i don gzhan med pas dper na /
translated: For example,

original: 'di lta bu zhes dpe bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di lta bu zhes dpe bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it cannot be indicated by an example such as this.

original: brtag med de ni 'di'o zhes //
analyzed: brtag med de ni 'di'o zhes //
translated: It is not an object of scrutiny,

original: rnam kun brtag tu med pa'i phyir //🔽zhes bya ba yang de ni brtag par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam kun brtag tu med pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba yang de ni brtag par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: because it is not an object of scrutiny in any way.🔽It is not an object of scrutiny because

original: de ni 'di'o zhes rnam pa kun du brtag tu med pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di ltar kha dog dang dbyibs dag la ni de ni 'di'o zhes brtag tu rung gi / de ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir sngon po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang dkar po dang ring po dang thung ngu dang /
analyzed: de ni 'di'o zhes rnam pa kun du brtag tu med pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar kha dog dang dbyibs dag la ni de ni 'di'o zhes brtag tu rung gi / de ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir sngon po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang dkar po dang ring po dang thung ngu dang /
translated: it is not an object of scrutiny in any way, such as this.🔽For it is appropriate to scrutinize color and shape, but it is not appropriate to scrutinize the self in terms of all the aspects of blue, yellow, red, white, long, short,

original: mthon po dang / dma' ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyis brtag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthon po dang / dma' ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyis brtag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: high, low, and so on, because the self does not have the nature of color and shape.

original: gsal min gsal byed med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gsal min gsal byed med pa'i phyir //
translated: It is not manifest, because it is not a manifestor.

original: zhi ba gnod pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: zhi ba gnod pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: It is peace, because it is free from injury.

original: zhes bya ba yang de ni gsal bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang de ni gsal bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not manifest because it is not a manifestor.

original: gsal byed med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal byed med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not a manifestor.

original: gsal byed ces bya ba ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dag dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / ma ning zhes bya ba dngos po gzhan gsal bar byed pa dag ste /
analyzed: gsal byed ces bya ba ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dag dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / ma ning zhes bya ba dngos po gzhan gsal bar byed pa dag ste /
translated: “Manifestor” refers to the manifestors of other things, such as birth, duration, and destruction, and male, female, and neuter.

original: de la de dag med pas de'i phyir gsal bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la de dag med pas de'i phyir gsal bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Since it does not have those, it is not a manifestor.

original: de ni zhi ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni zhi ba yin te /
translated: It is peace,

original: gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from harm.

original: 'di ltar de ni skye ba dang / rgas pa dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni skye ba dang / rgas pa dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is free from all harm, such as birth, aging, and death.🔽It is said to be permanent because it is

original: brtag par brjod de snang med pa'i //
analyzed: brtag par brjod de snang med pa'i //
translated: inconceivable,🔽because it is not an object of conceptual differentiation,

original: bdag nyid nyid kyis rnam kun du //🔽rnam rtog med pas rtag phyir dang // rtag tu don ni rab bsgrub phyir //🔽zhes bya ba yang de ni rtag par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid nyid kyis rnam kun du // rnam rtog med pas rtag phyir dang // rtag tu don ni rab bsgrub phyir // zhes bya ba yang de ni rtag par brjod pa yin te /
translated: because it is permanent in every way,🔽and because it always accomplishes its purpose.

original: snang ba med pa'i bdag nyid nyid kyis rnam pa kun tu rnam par rtog pa med pas rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i bdag nyid nyid kyis rnam pa kun tu rnam par rtog pa med pas rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said to be permanent because it is permanent in every way, since it is not an object of conceptual differentiation, because it is inconceivable, and because it is not an object of the eye, etc.🔽It is said to be permanent because it is not an object of conceptual differentiation.

original: 'di ltar gzugs kyi mtha' ni rdul phra rab kyi cha shas su snang ba med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs kyi mtha' ni rdul phra rab kyi cha shas su snang ba med par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, the limit of form would be the part of the subtle atom, which would not appear.

original: rdul phra rab kyi mtha' phyogs cha tha dad pa'i phyir ni mthar snang ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi mtha' phyogs cha tha dad pa'i phyir ni mthar snang ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the limit of the subtle atom would be the end, because of the difference of direction.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi gnas pa'i mtha' ni skad cig mar 'jug pa yin la ;
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi gnas pa'i mtha' ni skad cig mar 'jug pa yin la ;
translated: The limit of the duration of mind and mental factors is the momentary engagement.

original: de yang sngon dang bar dang tha ma'i dus kyi bye brag gis shin tu cha phra ba'i phyir snang ba med pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de yang sngon dang bar dang tha ma'i dus kyi bye brag gis shin tu cha phra ba'i phyir snang ba med pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: And that is subtle, because of the difference of the beginning, middle, and end, and so it would not appear.

original: chos kyi dbyings de la de'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ci zhig rtog na rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de la de'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ci zhig rtog na rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur /
translated: Since that is the dharmadhatu, and there is no entity of that, what is imagined? A conceptual consciousness would not arise.

original: rnam par rtog pa skye ba med na ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa med pa'i phyir @125a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa skye ba med na ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa med pa'i phyir @125a * //
translated: If there is no arising of conceptualization, there is no intrinsic destruction.

original: de ni rtag pa yin par brjod do //
analyzed: de ni rtag pa yin par brjod do //
translated: That is said to be permanent.

original: yang na de ni gang gi phyir rtag tu sems can gyi don rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir yang rtag par brjod de /
analyzed: yang na de ni gang gi phyir rtag tu sems can gyi don rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir yang rtag par brjod de /
translated: Or else, it is called permanent because it always accomplishes the aims of sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar mdo sde dag las /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo sde dag las /
translated: Thus, in the sutras,

original: nam mkha'i mtha' ci tsam pa sems can gyi mtha' dang / las dang nyon mongs pa'i mtha' yang de tsam par 'khor ba'i mtha' ji srid kyi bar du rgyun mi 'chad par smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub pa dag gis sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir rtag par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtha' ci tsam pa sems can gyi mtha' dang / las dang nyon mongs pa'i mtha' yang de tsam par 'khor ba'i mtha' ji srid kyi bar du rgyun mi 'chad par smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub pa dag gis sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir rtag par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: it is said to be permanent because it accomplishes the aims of sentient beings through the great vow to work for the welfare of sentient beings for as long as the world exists, for as long as space endures, for as long as the world exists, for as long as the end of cyclic life has not come.

original: zhi ba ngo bo nyid stong phyir //🔽mtshan ma med pa dngos med phyir /
analyzed: zhi ba ngo bo nyid stong phyir // mtshan ma med pa dngos med phyir /
translated: It is peace, because its nature is emptiness.🔽It is signless, because it is devoid of things.

original: mtshan ma nyid du mi 'gro dang // mtshan ma med phyir de yang yin ;
analyzed: mtshan ma nyid du mi 'gro dang // mtshan ma med phyir de yang yin ;
translated: It is also signless, because it is devoid of signs.

original: / zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid ji skad bstan pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid ji skad bstan pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: This is the remainder of the phrase “buddhahood, whose nature is as has been explained.”

original: de ni zhi ba yang yin te /
analyzed: de ni zhi ba yang yin te /
translated: It is peace,

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid du rtog pa yod na 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dang / 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang / tshig 'jug pa la sogs pa'i bya ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir dngos po rnams bya ba dang bcas pa lta bur nges par gzung du rung gi / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la ni bya ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir bya ba cung zad kyang
analyzed: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid du rtog pa yod na 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dang / 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang / tshig 'jug pa la sogs pa'i bya ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir dngos po rnams bya ba dang bcas pa lta bur nges par gzung du rung gi / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la ni bya ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir bya ba cung zad kyang
translated: But because of the absence of all action in the emptiness of intrinsic reality, there is not even the slightest action.

original: med pas de'i phyir de ni ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: med pas de'i phyir de ni ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir zhi ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is peace because of the emptiness of intrinsic reality.

original: de ni mtshan ma med pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma med pa yang yin te /
translated: It is also signless.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because of the absence of the intrinsic reality of things.

original: /'di ltar ngo bo nyid med pa kho na'i phyir yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar rtog par mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: /'di ltar ngo bo nyid med pa kho na'i phyir yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar rtog par mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, because of the absence of intrinsic reality, one does not engage in the conception of signs, such as existence and nonexistence, etc.

original: yang na de ni mtshan ma med pa yang yin te /
analyzed: yang na de ni mtshan ma med pa yang yin te /
translated: Or, it is also signless.

original: mtshan ma med pa nyid du mi 'gro ba'i phyir dang / mtshan ma med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa nyid du mi 'gro ba'i phyir dang / mtshan ma med pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: de ni gzhan gang la yang mtshan ma'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gro ba'i phyir dang / rang yang mtshan mar rtog par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not go as the reality of a sign for anything else, and it does not itself conceive a sign.

original: mtshan ma med phyir snang ba med //
analyzed: mtshan ma med phyir snang ba med //
translated: Because of signlessness, there is no appearance.

original: snang med phyir yang mtshan ma med //
analyzed: snang med phyir yang mtshan ma med //
translated: Because of nonappearance, there is also no sign.

original: mtshan ma med cing snang med pa //
analyzed: mtshan ma med cing snang med pa //
