original: lta 'dod bdag nyid grol bas mthong //
analyzed: lta 'dod bdag nyid grol bas mthong //
translated: are seen by the liberated self that desires to see.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang kho na'i phyir de mtshan ma med pa de kho na'i phyir snang ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang kho na'i phyir de mtshan ma med pa de kho na'i phyir snang ba med pa yin te /
translated: Because of the signlessness of that, there is nonappearance.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i ngo bo nyid du snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i ngo bo nyid du snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the nonappearance of permanence, impermanence, existence, nonexistence, etc.,

original: gang gi phyir snang ba med pa de'i phyir yang mtshan ma med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snang ba med pa de'i phyir yang mtshan ma med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because of nonappearance, there is also signlessness.

original: gang dag de mthong bar 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pa grol ba'i bdag nyid can de dag @125b gis kyang sangs rgyas de mtshan ma med pa dang snang ba med pa nyid du mthong ste /
analyzed: gang dag de mthong bar 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pa grol ba'i bdag nyid can de dag @125b gis kyang sangs rgyas de mtshan ma med pa dang snang ba med pa nyid du mthong ste /
translated: Those yogis who are liberated and who wish to see that Buddha see him as signless and as nonappearance.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' skye ba gcig gis thogs pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs las mi mthong ste /

original: mtshan ma las mi mthong /
analyzed: mtshan ma las mi mthong /

original: yon tan las mi mthong /🔽chos las mi mthong /
analyzed: yon tan las mi mthong / chos las mi mthong /

analyzed: chos ma yin pa las mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o // mi gnas mtshan ma med pa'i phyir //
translated: They do not see him as non-Dharma.🔽Because he does not abide and is signless,

original: rnam par mi rtog mi gnas phyir //🔽spros med rnam par mi rtog phyir //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog mi gnas phyir // spros med rnam par mi rtog phyir //
translated: Because he is nonconceptual and does not abide,🔽Because he is free of elaboration and nonconceptual,

original: dmigs med der 'dzin med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dmigs med der 'dzin med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because he is nonapprehensible and ungraspable,

original: zhes bya ba yang sangs rgyas de ni mi gnas pa yin te /🔽mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang sangs rgyas de ni mi gnas pa yin te /🔽mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha does not abide because he is signless.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas la ni gzugs su rung ba dang myong ba dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma 'ga' yang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas la ni gzugs su rung ba dang myong ba dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma 'ga' yang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in this way, no sign whatsoever of Buddha is perceived, such as suitability for form, experience, apprehension of signs, manifest effort, or consciousness.

original: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa yin te /
translated: It is non-conceptual,

original: mi gnas pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it does not abide.

original: / mi gnas na ci zhig la rnam par rtog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / mi gnas na ci zhig la rnam par rtog par 'gyur te /
translated: If it does not abide, what would it conceptualize?

original: de'i phyir de nyid rnam par mi rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid rnam par mi rtog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is itself non-conceptual.

original: de ni spros pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni spros pa med pa yin te /
translated: It is free from mental proliferation,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is non-conceptual.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog na ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po la tshig 'jug pa ni spros pa yin na rnam par rtog pa med pa la ni spros pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog na ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po la tshig 'jug pa ni spros pa yin na rnam par rtog pa med pa la ni spros pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when there is conceptualization, the engagement of words in the entity of conceptualization is mental proliferation, but in the absence of conceptualization, there is no mental proliferation.

original: de ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: It is signless,

original: dmigs pa der 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa der 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no apprehension of signs.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa kho na'i phyir dmigs par 'dzin par mi byed do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa kho na'i phyir dmigs par 'dzin par mi byed do //

original: ji skad bstan pa'i skabs kyis sangs rgyas de nyid kyang ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis na /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i skabs kyis sangs rgyas de nyid kyang ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis na /
translated: The Buddha himself, in the context of the teachings, is as follows, in the manner of the teachings.

original: skye ba med pa rnam pa med ;
analyzed: skye ba med pa rnam pa med ;
translated: He is unborn, nonmanifest,

original: /'gyur ba med pa 'od gsal ba //
analyzed: /'gyur ba med pa 'od gsal ba //

original: mnyam pa mi mnyam mu med pa //
analyzed: mnyam pa mi mnyam mu med pa //

original: rnam par mi rtog mtshan nyid med //🔽ces bya ba dag yin te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog mtshan nyid med // ces bya ba dag yin te /

analyzed: skye ba med pa zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pas blo skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is unborn because the mind is unborn due to the nonestablishment of the nature of objects of knowledge.

original: rnam pa med pa zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is nonmanifest because he is not the nature of color and shape.

original: 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is changeless because all activity has been pacified.

original: 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i mun pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i mun pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is clear light because he is free from the darkness of the afflictions and the obscurations to that which needs to be known.

original: mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas chos thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir @126a * //
analyzed: mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas chos thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir @126a * //

analyzed: ro ; / mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa gzhan dag dang mi mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Unequality” means it is unequal to other vehicles such as the Hearers’ and Solitary Realizers’ vehicles.

original: mu med pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu med pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Boundlessness” means it is the objective support of the Dharma Sphere.

analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid yin pas rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Non-conceptuality” means it is the characteristic of direct perception, because conceptual and memory-based thoughts do not engage it.

original: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i mtshan nyid dag gis mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i mtshan nyid dag gis mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Signlessness” means it is not indicated by the signs of the elements and the derivative forms.

original: de dag phyogs su byas nas sngar bstan pa'i gtan tshigs rnams dang sbyar nas /
analyzed: de dag phyogs su byas nas sngar bstan pa'i gtan tshigs rnams dang sbyar nas /
translated: Having made these divisions, they are to be applied to the reasons taught above.

original: mkha' bzhin de la lta med par //
analyzed: mkha' bzhin de la lta med par //

original: bdag nyid chen po de dag blta //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po de dag blta //

original: zhes bya bas phyogs dang phyogs kyi chos sngar bstan pa thams cad kyi chos mthun pa'i dpe nam mkha' bzhin zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas phyogs dang phyogs kyi chos sngar bstan pa thams cad kyi chos mthun pa'i dpe nam mkha' bzhin zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar te /

original: sangs rgyas de lta bu de la byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu pa'i dbang phyug bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa yang dag par nye bar bsags pa bdag nyid chen po de dag lta ba med pa'i tshul gyis lta bar byed do zhes
analyzed: sangs rgyas de lta bu de la byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu pa'i dbang phyug bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa yang dag par nye bar bsags pa bdag nyid chen po de dag lta ba med pa'i tshul gyis lta bar byed do zhes
translated: It shows that those great beings, the bodhisattvas on the tenth ground, who have perfectly accumulated immeasurable collections of merit and wisdom, behold those buddhas in a manner free from seeing.

analyzed: ston to // byang chub sems dpa' de dag nyid kyi bsngags pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the praise of those very bodhisattvas will be expressed:

original: gang dag rnam par mi rtog pa'i //
analyzed: gang dag rnam par mi rtog pa'i //
translated: Those who, through nonconceptual

original: gnas pas lhun grub dri ma med //
analyzed: gnas pas lhun grub dri ma med //
translated: spontaneous, stainless abiding,🔽bow down, mentally attend,

analyzed: 'dud par byed dang yid byed dang // brjod la sogs pa bsal ba dag / mgon po la ni phyag 'tshal ba //
translated: and express praise, and so forth, to the protector,

analyzed: de dag la yang gus phyag 'tshal //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang dag la lha'i gnas pa bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshangs pa'i gnas pa tshad med pa bzhi sngar goms par byas nas 'phags pa'i gnas pa stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i bdag nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas pas rtsol ba med par lhun gyis grub pa las skyes pa'i dri ma med pa'i mig yod pa de dag ni ji skad bstan pa dag yin no //
translated: Those who have previously cultivated the divine abodes, the four concentrations, and the pure abodes, the four immeasurables, and who are now striving with the noble abodes, the three doors of liberation, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and who have attained the stainless eye born of effortless spontaneous action, are those who are taught.

original: 'dud par byed pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyi thal mo sbyor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dud par byed pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyi thal mo sbyor ba la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni de dang 'brel ba'i yid nyid do //

analyzed: brjod ces bya ba ni bstod ra la sogs pa'i tshig brjod pa'o //
translated: Praising means uttering words of praise and so on.

analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas kun rdzob tu las rnam pa gsum po de dag la sogs pa byed du zin kyang don dam par byed pa po med pa'i phyir /
translated: Although they engage in the three kinds of actions, and so on, on the conventional level, with skill in means, ultimately, because there is no agent,

analyzed: sus @126b kyang las de byas pa med pa'i phyir las su rtog pa bsal ba dag / ji skad bstan pa'i ston pa mgon po la rnam pa de lta bus phyag 'tshal ba de dag la yang kho bos gus par phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya bar sbyar ro
translated: I also respectfully pay homage to those who, in the manner just explained, pay homage to the Teacher, the Protector, as stated.

original: // yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni byang chub sems dpa' rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shin tu goms par byas pa 'dod pa tsam gyis rtogs par bya ba yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ba de dag la yang gus par phyag 'tshal ba na
analyzed: // yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni byang chub sems dpa' rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shin tu goms par byas pa 'dod pa tsam gyis rtogs par bya ba yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ba de dag la yang gus par phyag 'tshal ba na
translated: The word “also” indicates that I respectfully pay homage to those bodhisattvas who, through mere desire, realize the object of unmediated transcendent wisdom and attain perfect buddhahood.🔽What need is there to mention that I respectfully pay homage to the one protector of the world who has fully awakened to the wisdom of omniscience?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa 'jig rten gyi mgon po gcig pu de la gus par phyag 'tshal ba lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don ston to /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa 'jig rten gyi mgon po gcig pu de la gus par phyag 'tshal ba lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don ston to /
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba /
analyzed: // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba /
translated: The Blaze of Reasoning, a Commentary on the Essence of the Middle Way

original: bam po bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu gcig pa /
translated: Chapter Eleven

original: gal te rnam pa de lta bu yin na ji ltar de sangs rgyas dang bde bar gshegs pa la sogs pa'i tshig tu brjod pa nyid du rung zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa de lta bu yin na ji ltar de sangs rgyas dang bde bar gshegs pa la sogs pa'i tshig tu brjod pa nyid du rung zhe na /
translated: If that is the case, how is it tenable to express the Buddha, the Sugata, and so on in words?🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / sangs rgyas la sogs sgro btags pas //
analyzed: bshad pa / sangs rgyas la sogs sgro btags pas //
translated: Through superimposition, the Buddha and so on

original: sgrub dang rjes su mthun par bstan //
analyzed: sgrub dang rjes su mthun par bstan //
translated: are taught in accord with the path of attainment.

original: de nyid du na rnam kun tu //
analyzed: de nyid du na rnam kun tu //
translated: But in reality,

original: rnam brtag min phyir brjod mi 'dod //
analyzed: rnam brtag min phyir brjod mi 'dod //
translated: since there is no conceptualization, they are not expressed.

original: ces bya ba ni rtog pa med pa'i tshul gyis rtogs pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bstan pa dag gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i tshig tu brjod par bya ba ma yin du zin kyang kun rdzob tu chos thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir sangs
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rtog pa med pa'i tshul gyis rtogs pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bstan pa dag gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i tshig tu brjod par bya ba ma yin du zin kyang kun rdzob tu chos thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir sangs
translated: The statement “because of realization through a nonconceptual manner” and so on explains that although the Buddha and so on are not to be expressed in words, conventionally they are expressed in words such as “Buddha” because of realizing all phenomena.

original: rgyas dang bgrod par bya bar legs par gshegs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyas dang bgrod par bya bar legs par gshegs pa'i phyir /
translated: Since they have gone well to the other side of the river of saṃsāra, they are the Sugata.

original: bde bar gshegs pa dang / de bzhin du gshegs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dang / bsod nams kyi phung po dpag tu med pa yang dag par nye bar bsags pa skal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das dang / mchod par 'os pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa dang /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa dang / de bzhin du gshegs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dang / bsod nams kyi phung po dpag tu med pa yang dag par nye bar bsags pa skal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das dang / mchod par 'os pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa dang /
translated: Because he is blissful and has gone thus, he is the Tathagata, and because he has accumulated an immeasurable mass of merit and is thus fortunate, he is the Bhagavan.

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par mkhyen pa'i phyir rang byung dang / bdud bzhi las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyir rgyal ba dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs thub pa'i phyir thub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag tu sgro btags pas tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par mkhyen pa'i phyir rang byung dang / bdud bzhi las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyir rgyal ba dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs thub pa'i phyir thub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag tu sgro btags pas tshul khrims dang /
translated: Because he is worthy of offerings, he is the Arhat, because he is self-arisen, he is the Self-Existent One, because he has conquered the four maras, he is the Victor, and because he is restrained in body, speech and mind, he is the Sage.🔽In this way, he is imputed with various names, and the practices of discipline,

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / ye shes zhes bya ba dag gi sgrub pa dang rjes su mthun par bstan par zad kyi /🔽don dam par de nyid du rnam pa kun tu rnam par brtag @127a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / ye shes zhes bya ba dag gi sgrub pa dang rjes su mthun par bstan par zad kyi / don dam par de nyid du rnam pa kun tu rnam par brtag @127a * //
translated: concentration, wisdom and gnosis are taught in accordance with these names.

original: par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir //
translated: However, in the ultimate sense, he is not to be imagined in any way whatsoever.

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du 'dod do //
translated: It is held to be inexpressible.

original: ji ltar rnam par brtags pa'i dngos po la ni rnam pa'i khyad par dag sgro btags nas brjod par bya ba dag tu sbyar du rung gi /'di ni yul nyid du rnam par brtag par bya ba ma yin pa kho na'i phyir ;
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par brtags pa'i dngos po la ni rnam pa'i khyad par dag sgro btags nas brjod par bya ba dag tu sbyar du rung gi /'di ni yul nyid du rnam par brtag par bya ba ma yin pa kho na'i phyir ;
translated: It is appropriate to apply expressions to things that are conceptually differentiated, having superimposed aspects on them. But this is not even a proper object of conceptual differentiation.

original: 'di la tshig dag ldog 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'di la tshig dag ldog 'gyur zhing //
translated: Here, words are reversed.

original: 'di ni sems kyi spyod yul min //
analyzed: 'di ni sems kyi spyod yul min //
translated: This is not the domain of mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag gi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag gi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not the domain of the six collections of consciousness, which have the characteristic of the individual perception of things.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de nyid dang ye shes gnyi ga la snyegs te /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de nyid dang ye shes gnyi ga la snyegs te /
translated: The word “this” refers to reality and intuition.

original: dmigs pa dang dmigs par byed pa mnyam pa nyid kyis de nyid dang ye shes gnyis tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang dmigs par byed pa mnyam pa nyid kyis de nyid dang ye shes gnyis tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because reality and intuition are not different, since the objective support and the one who has the objective support are the same.

original: 'di la kun rtog ldog 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'di la kun rtog ldog 'gyur zhing //
translated: Here, conceptualization is reversed.

original: shes pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Consciousness does not operate.

original: zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas brtag par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rtog ge'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas brtag par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rtog ge'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams so //
translated: This is because the dharmakāya is not an object of mental consciousness and is not an object of sophistry.🔽Endowed with the accumulation of immeasurable merit,

original: grangs med bsod nams tshogs ldan zhing //
analyzed: grangs med bsod nams tshogs ldan zhing //
translated: knowing the infinite knowable,🔽this dharmakāya of the buddhas🔽is the pacification of pacification, the pacification of elaborations.🔽This is because the dharmakāya is not an object of mental consciousness and is not an object of sophistry.🔽Endowed with the accumulation of immeasurable merit,

original: shes bya mtha' yas mkhyen gyur pa'i //
analyzed: shes bya mtha' yas mkhyen gyur pa'i //
translated: knowing the infinite knowable,🔽this dharmakāya of the buddhas🔽is the pacification of pacification, the pacification of elaborations.🔽This is because the dharmakāya is not an object of mental consciousness and is not an object of sophistry.🔽Endowed with the accumulation of immeasurable merit,🔽knowing the infinite knowable,🔽this dharmakāya of the buddhas🔽is the pacification of pacification, the pacification of elaborations.🔽This is because the dharmakāya is not an object of mental consciousness and is not an object of sophistry.🔽Endowed with the accumulation of immeasurable merit,🔽knowing the infinite knowable,🔽this dharmakāya of the buddhas

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos sku 'di //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos sku 'di //
translated: is the pacification of pacification, the pacification of elaborations.🔽This is because the dharmakāya is not an object of mental consciousness and is not an object of sophistry.🔽Endowed with the accumulation of immeasurable merit,🔽knowing the infinite knowable,🔽this dharmakāya of the buddhas

original: spros pa nyer zhi zhi ba yin //
analyzed: spros pa nyer zhi zhi ba yin //
translated: is the pacification of pacification, the pacification of elaborations.🔽This is because the dharmakāya is not an object of mental consciousness and is not an object of sophistry.🔽Endowed with the accumulation of immeasurable merit,🔽knowing the infinite knowable,🔽this dharmakāya of the buddhas

original: zhes bya ba ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du bsod nams kyi tshogs yang dag par bsags pa dang ldan zhing shes bya dus gsum dang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa mtha' yas pa dag legs par mkhyen par gyur pa'i sangs rgyas chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du bsod nams kyi tshogs yang dag par bsags pa dang ldan zhing shes bya dus gsum dang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa mtha' yas pa dag legs par mkhyen par gyur pa'i sangs rgyas chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: is the pacification of pacification, the pacification

original: ye shes kyi skad cig ma skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa sangs rgyas su bstan pa de nyid stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku yin te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi skad cig ma skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa sangs rgyas su bstan pa de nyid stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku yin te /
translated: The moment of transcendent wisdom that is the very essence of non-arising is taught to be buddhahood. It is the dharmakaya of the buddhas because it is the basis of the qualities of the buddhas, such as the powers, the fearlessnesses, and the unique qualities.

original: 'di ni tshig tu brjod pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir spros pa nye bar zhi ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni tshig tu brjod pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir spros pa nye bar zhi ba yin la /
translated: It is the pacification of elaborations because all verbal expressions are completely pacified.

original: rang nyid bsnyengs pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / gzhan dag gi 'jigs pa sel ba'i phyir zhi ba yin te /
analyzed: rang nyid bsnyengs pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / gzhan dag gi 'jigs pa sel ba'i phyir zhi ba yin te /
translated: It is peace because it is free of fear itself and it removes the fears of others.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i mdo las /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i mdo las /
translated: The Sutra of the Wisdom Seal of the Tathagata says:

original: yang dag pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ste /
translated: That which is real is the body of the Tathagata.

original: de ni mig gi lam thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mig gi lam thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
translated: It is beyond all paths of the eye.

original: @127b de ni sku med pa dang / ma byas pa dang / ma byung ba dang / ma 'gags pa dang / 'dus pa las ma byung ba dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma bzhugs pa dang / mngon par ma grub pa dang / mtha' yas pa dang /
analyzed: @127b de ni sku med pa dang / ma byas pa dang / ma byung ba dang / ma 'gags pa dang / 'dus pa las ma byung ba dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma bzhugs pa dang / mngon par ma grub pa dang / mtha' yas pa dang /
translated: It is without body, not made, not arisen, not ceased, not arisen from a collection, not produced, not present, not manifestly established, infinite,

original: mu med pa dang / zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mu med pa dang / zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: boundless, peaceful, and completely pacified.

original: de nyid rigs pas bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid rigs pas bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: That should be established through reasoning:

original: sha yi mig gis de blta min //
analyzed: sha yi mig gis de blta min //
translated: It is not seen with the fleshly eye,

original: lha yi mig gis blta ma yin //🔽rtog bcas rnam rtog med pa yi //
analyzed: lha yi mig gis blta ma yin // rtog bcas rnam rtog med pa yi //
translated: Nor is it seen with the divine eye.🔽It is difficult to see even with conceptual and non-conceptual

original: shes pas kyang ni mthong bar dka' //
analyzed: shes pas kyang ni mthong bar dka' //
translated: Cognitions.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa ni thag ring ba dang bsgribs pa'i phyir mi mthong ngo snyam du rtog pa dang / gzhan dag de bzhin gshegs pa de thag nye na mthong ngo snyam du rtog pa de dag gi phyir sha'i mig gis de blta ba ma yin pa nyid kyis yul na mi gnas pa nyid du ston te /🔽sha'i mig dri ma med pa ni bsgribs pa dang skal ba dag la yang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa ni thag ring ba dang bsgribs pa'i phyir mi mthong ngo snyam du rtog pa dang / gzhan dag de bzhin gshegs pa de thag nye na mthong ngo snyam du rtog pa de dag gi phyir sha'i mig gis de blta ba ma yin pa nyid kyis yul na mi gnas pa nyid du ston te / sha'i mig dri ma med pa ni bsgribs pa dang skal ba dag la yang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This shows that the Tathāgata does not exist in a location, because he is not seen by the fleshly eye, as some imagine, due to distance or obstruction, and because he is not seen by the divine eye, as others imagine, due to proximity.🔽The divine eye is not obstructed and is capable of seeing subtle forms, but the fleshly eye is not like that.

original: lha'i mig gis blta ba ma yin pa nyid ni de la gzugs cha phra ba yang med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis blta ba ma yin pa nyid ni de la gzugs cha phra ba yang med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The Tathāgata is not seen by the divine eye, because there is no subtle form there.

original: lha'i mig gis ni srid pa bar ma'i phung po shin tu cha phra ba yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i mig gis ni srid pa bar ma'i phung po shin tu cha phra ba yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The divine eye sees the subtle aggregates of the intermediate existence.🔽The Tathāgata is not seen by the wisdom eye, because he is not an object of wisdom.🔽The Tathāgata is not seen by the Dharma eye, because he is not an object of the Dharma.🔽The Tathāgata is not seen by the buddha eye, because he is not an object of the buddha eye.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is not seen by the knowledge eye, because he is not an object of knowledge.🔽The Tathāgata is not seen by the eye of insight, because he is not an object of insight.🔽The Tathāgata is not seen by the eye of the path, because he is not an object of the path.🔽The Tathāgata is not seen by the eye of the noble ones, because he is not an object of the noble ones.🔽The Tathāgata is not seen by the eye of the śrāvakas, because he is not an object of the śrāvakas.🔽The Tathāgata is not seen by the eye of the pratyekabuddhas, because he is not an object of the pratyekabuddhas.🔽The Tathāgata is not seen by the eye of the bodhisattvas, because he is not an object of the bodhisattvas.🔽The Tathāgata is not seen by the eye of the buddhas, because he is not an object of the buddhas.🔽The Tathāgata is not seen by the eye of the buddhas, because he is not an object of the buddhas.🔽The Tathāgata is not seen by the eye of the buddhas, because he is not an object of the buddhas.

original: rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Tathāgata is not seen by the eye of the buddhas, because he is not an object of the buddhas.🔽The Tath

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa ni mngon sum gyi shes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa ni mngon sum gyi shes pa ste /
translated: Non-conceptual is direct perception,

original: dngos po tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has as its object only the thing itself.

original: shes pa de nyid kyis kyang mthong bar dka' ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du shes pa thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: shes pa de nyid kyis kyang mthong bar dka' ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du shes pa thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: And because that cognition is difficult to see, it is shown to be the object of no cognition whatsoever.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: mtho ris sdig can yul min dang // nyon mongs med pa de bcas min //
analyzed: mtho ris sdig can yul min dang // nyon mongs med pa de bcas min //
translated: it is not the object of the sinful in the heavens, nor of those with afflictions, nor of those without afflictions.

original: nyi ma dmus long yul min ltar //
analyzed: nyi ma dmus long yul min ltar //
translated: Like the sun, it is not the object of the blind.

original: de yang rtog ge'i spyod yul min //
analyzed: de yang rtog ge'i spyod yul min //
translated: It is not the domain of sophists.

original: zhes bya ba la mtho ris zhes bya ba'i tshig gi phrad ni bdag gir 'dzin pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la mtho ris zhes bya ba'i tshig gi phrad ni bdag gir 'dzin pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: In the verse, the word “heavens” is a possessive compound.

original: de dang bral ba'i phyir mtho ris te lha'i gnas so //
analyzed: de dang bral ba'i phyir mtho ris te lha'i gnas so //
translated: Because it is free from that, it is a heaven, a divine abode.

original: de ni dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir sdig can rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyang ma yin na de dag gi spyod yul du mi 'gyur blta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de ni dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir sdig can rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyang ma yin na de dag gi spyod yul du mi 'gyur blta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: Since it is the result of virtuous karma, it is not even to be accomplished by the sinful, much less be their domain.

original: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i nyes rtsom thams cad kyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i nyes rtsom thams cad kyi rgyu yin te /
translated: The cause of all the faults of cyclic existence is called “afflictions.”

original: nyon mongs pa rnams so //🔽nyon mongs pa med pa ni de @128a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams so // nyon mongs pa med pa ni de @128a * //
translated: They are the afflictions.

original: dag skye bar bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: dag skye bar bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
translated: The absence of afflictions is the meditative concentration that generates them.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa de dang bcas pa rnams kyis skyed par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa de dang bcas pa rnams kyis skyed par mi nus so //
translated: It is not possible for those who possess those afflictions to generate it.

original: nyi ma ni dmus long rnams kyis ma mthong mi mthong mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyi ma ni dmus long rnams kyis ma mthong mi mthong mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The sun is not seen by the congenitally blind, nor will it be seen.

original: de dag gi yul ma yin pa de bzhin du chos kyi sku de yang rang dang gzhan gyi sde pa'i rtog ge ba 'bad pa'i blo gros can rnams kyis rjes su dpag pas kyang mthong bar mi nus te /
analyzed: de dag gi yul ma yin pa de bzhin du chos kyi sku de yang rang dang gzhan gyi sde pa'i rtog ge ba 'bad pa'i blo gros can rnams kyis rjes su dpag pas kyang mthong bar mi nus te /
translated: In the same way, that Dharma body is not seen by the logicians of our own and other schools, even with their inferential cognition, because it is not their domain.

original: de dag gi spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: It is not their domain.

original: ci'i phyir de dag gis mi mthong zhe na /🔽gang gi phyir de ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag gis mi mthong zhe na / gang gi phyir de ni /
translated: Why is it not seen by them?

original: yod min med min yod med min //
analyzed: yod min med min yod med min //
translated: Because it is not existent, not nonexistent, not existent and nonexistent,

original: de las gzhan min gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: de las gzhan min gzhan ma yin //
translated: not other than those, and not the same.

original: zhes bya ba la de ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not existent like form, etc.

original: yod pa'i blo'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i blo'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the domain of the cognition of the existent.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not nonexistent like the horns of a rabbit, etc.

original: med pa'i blo'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i blo'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the domain of the cognition of the nonexistent.

original: yod med kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: yod med kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not both existent and nonexistent,

original: gnyi ga'i blos nges par gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i blos nges par gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not apprehended by either cognition.

original: de dag las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not other than those two,

original: yod pa la sogs pa dag las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa la sogs pa dag las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no characteristic of the existent, etc.

original: gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not non-other,

original: kun rdzob tu rnam grangs las de nyid yod pa la sogs pa dag tu brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rnam grangs las de nyid yod pa la sogs pa dag tu brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be expressed as existent, etc. in the conventional sense, in terms of synonyms.

original: de ji ltar yod pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar yod pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is it existent?

original: stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the embodiment of the powers, the fearlessnesses, and the special qualities of the Buddha.

original: ji ltar med pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is it nonexistent?

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa tha dad pa dag la ngo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa tha dad pa dag la ngo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the collection of causes and conditions is not different from the nature of the self.

original: ji ltar yod med nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yod med nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is it both existent and non-existent?

original: gnyi ga dang 'brel pa las nye bar gdags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga dang 'brel pa las nye bar gdags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is imputed in relation to both.

original: mu stegs can dag gis yongs su btags pa'i bdag dam pa yang rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / rtag pa dang 'gyur ba med pa de lta bu'i rnam pa nyid du 'dod na de las chos kyi sku 'di khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: mu stegs can dag gis yongs su btags pa'i bdag dam pa yang rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / rtag pa dang 'gyur ba med pa de lta bu'i rnam pa nyid du 'dod na de las chos kyi sku 'di khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: If the self imagined by the tīrthikas is also considered to be nonconceptual, permanent, and unchanging, what is the difference between that and the Dharma Body?

original: de ni de dag ni phra ba nyid kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir phra bar bstan cing chen po nyid kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ni chen por bstan /
analyzed: de ni de dag ni phra ba nyid kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir phra bar bstan cing chen po nyid kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ni chen por bstan /
translated: The Dharma Body is taught as subtle because it possesses the quality of subtlety, and it is taught as great because it possesses the quality of greatness.

original: gcig pa nyid kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ni gcig tu bstan //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ni gcig tu bstan //
translated: It is taught as one because it possesses the quality of oneness.

original: thams cad du song ba'i phyir ni ring ba dang nye ba la khyab par bstan gyi /
analyzed: thams cad du song ba'i phyir ni ring ba dang nye ba la khyab par bstan gyi /
translated: It is taught as pervading the distant and the near because it extends everywhere.

original: chos kyi sku ni /
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni /
translated: The Dharma Body🔽is not like that.

original: phra ba ma yin chen po min //
analyzed: phra ba ma yin chen po min //
translated: Not subtle, not gross,

original: gcig min ring min nye ba'ang min //
analyzed: gcig min ring min nye ba'ang min //
translated: Not one, not many, not near, not far.

original: @128b zhes bya ba ni de yon tan can ma yin pa'i phyir dang yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @128b zhes bya ba ni de yon tan can ma yin pa'i phyir dang yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not a quality-possessor and it does not abide in a place.

original: de bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa'ang skyes bur smra ba dag ni skyes bu 'gro ba skye ba'i rgyu yin par 'dod la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa'ang skyes bur smra ba dag ni skyes bu 'gro ba skye ba'i rgyu yin par 'dod la /
translated: Likewise, the nonconceptual is not a person, because the proponents of the person assert that the person is the cause of the arising of the world.

original: gtso bor smra ba dag ni gtso bo 'gro ba mtha' dag gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin par 'dod pas chos kyi sku ni de dag dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtso bor smra ba dag ni gtso bo 'gro ba mtha' dag gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin par 'dod pas chos kyi sku ni de dag dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The proponents of primal matter assert that primal matter is the cause that manifests the entire world. In order to show that the dharma body is not similar to them in characteristics,

original: bshad pa / de la cung zad ji ltar yang //
analyzed: bshad pa / de la cung zad ji ltar yang //
translated: it is said:

original: skye ba med cing gsal ba med //
analyzed: skye ba med cing gsal ba med //
translated: In it, there is no arising at all,🔽nor is there any manifestation.

original: ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa nyid la rgyu nyid dang gsal byed nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa nyid la rgyu nyid dang gsal byed nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that in the absence of entities, there is no causality or manifestation.

original: de bzhin du grol ba'i bdag kyang 'jig rten gyi mthar song nas 'jig rten 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i thar pa na gnas la /
analyzed: de bzhin du grol ba'i bdag kyang 'jig rten gyi mthar song nas 'jig rten 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i thar pa na gnas la /
translated: Likewise, the self that is liberated goes to the end of the world and abides in the liberation called “the convergence of the world.”

original: skyes bu mun pa'i mthar gyur pa mthong na der bag la zha bar 'dod kyi /
analyzed: skyes bu mun pa'i mthar gyur pa mthong na der bag la zha bar 'dod kyi /
translated: When a person reaches the end of darkness, he is said to rest there.

original: 'di ni blta bar bya ba ma yin zhing mthong ba med de /
analyzed: 'di ni blta bar bya ba ma yin zhing mthong ba med de /
translated: But this is not something to be seen, nor is it seen.

original: 'di la 'ga' yang gnas pa med //
analyzed: 'di la 'ga' yang gnas pa med //
translated: No one abides in it.

original: 'ga' yang bag la zhar mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'ga' yang bag la zhar mi 'gyur //
translated: No one rests in it.

original: zhes bya ba ni grol ba'i lam yang dag par bskyed pa de yang de kho na bzhin du snang ba med pa na rang dang gzhan dmigs su med pa'i phyir gar yang gnas pa dang bag la zha bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni grol ba'i lam yang dag par bskyed pa de yang de kho na bzhin du snang ba med pa na rang dang gzhan dmigs su med pa'i phyir gar yang gnas pa dang bag la zha bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: The path of liberation is generated in that way, but when it is not seen, it is not observed in either self or other, and so it does not abide anywhere and it does not rest anywhere.

original: tshangs par smra ba dag tshangs pa ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi dam pa dang / 'gro ba rnams kyi mes po yin par 'dod pas de las 'dir khyad par du 'phags pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: tshangs par smra ba dag tshangs pa ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi dam pa dang / 'gro ba rnams kyi mes po yin par 'dod pas de las 'dir khyad par du 'phags pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: The Brahmins say that Brahmā is the best of all worlds and the grandfather of all beings. In order to show that he is not superior to the Buddha, the text says:

original: tshangs la sogs pa gang mi rtogs //
analyzed: tshangs la sogs pa gang mi rtogs //
translated: That which is not realized by Brahma and so on

original: de ni tshangs pa dam pa yin //
analyzed: de ni tshangs pa dam pa yin //
translated: is the highest Brahma.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa de nyid mthong ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa dmigs pa'i lta ba can dag gis gang mi rtogs pa de ni tshangs pa dam pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa de nyid mthong ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa dmigs pa'i lta ba can dag gis gang mi rtogs pa de ni tshangs pa dam pa yin te /
translated: That which is not realized by those who are endowed with the pride of seeing reality, who are possessed of the view of objectification, such as Brahma, Visnu, Maheśvara, and so on, is the highest Brahma.

original: tshangs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di skye dgu'i bdag po dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gnyi ga la yang snyegs mod kyi 'dir ni mya ngan las 'das pa nyid yin par gzung ngo /
analyzed: tshangs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di skye dgu'i bdag po dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gnyi ga la yang snyegs mod kyi 'dir ni mya ngan las 'das pa nyid yin par gzung ngo /
translated: The word Brahma applies to both the lord of beings and nirvana, but here it is nirvana that is intended.

original: de ni de dag gis rtogs par mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni de dag gis rtogs par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that it be realized by them,

original: dmigs pa can gyi shes pas blta bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa can gyi shes pas blta bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not an object of knowledge of those who objectify.

original: gang dag gis mi bslu ba'i tshig gi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gang dag gis mi bslu ba'i tshig gi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Those who are not deceived with regard to the power of words🔽say:

original: bden pa las lhag pa'i chos med do zhes zer ba de dag kyang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dang / spros pa dang bcas pa @129a * //🔽yin pa'i phyir gcig tu bden pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /🔽de ni bden pa dam pa zhes //
analyzed: bden pa las lhag pa'i chos med do zhes zer ba de dag kyang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dang / spros pa dang bcas pa @129a * // yin pa'i phyir gcig tu bden pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa / de ni bden pa dam pa zhes //
translated: But since they are conditioned, they are not exclusively true.🔽The Sage, who speaks the truth,

original: thub pa bden pa gsung bas gsungs //
analyzed: thub pa bden pa gsung bas gsungs //
translated: has said that is the highest truth.🔽Since that is nonerroneous, it is the highest truth.🔽The Sage, who speaks the truth, has said that is the highest truth.

original: zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa de ni ma log pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gcig tu bden pa dam pa'o zhes thub pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi bden pa gsung ba nyid kyis rdo rje gcod pa la sogs pa'i mdo
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa de ni ma log pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gcig tu bden pa dam pa'o zhes thub pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi bden pa gsung ba nyid kyis rdo rje gcod pa la sogs pa'i mdo
translated: The Vajracchedika-sutra and so on state:

original: las / ji tsam du 'dus byas pa de tsam du brdzun la /
analyzed: las / ji tsam du 'dus byas pa de tsam du brdzun la /
translated: To the extent that something is conditioned, to that extent it is false.

original: ci tsam du 'dus ma byas pa de tsam du mi brdzun no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci tsam du 'dus ma byas pa de tsam du mi brdzun no zhes gsungs so //
translated: To the extent that something is unconditioned, to that extent it is not false.

original: tshangs pa chen po ni stong la dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir gnas pa chen po nyid yin la ;
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po ni stong la dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir gnas pa chen po nyid yin la ;
translated: Mahatma means great being because he has great power over the thousand worlds.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa dag ni rang gi 'khor gyis bsnyen bkur byed pa'i phyir gnas pa chen po nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa dag ni rang gi 'khor gyis bsnyen bkur byed pa'i phyir gnas pa chen po nyid yin gyi /
translated: Maheśvara and so on are great because they are served by their own retinue.

original: 'di la ni /
analyzed: 'di la ni /
translated: But in this case,🔽the noble Avalokiteśvara,

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang dang // 'phags pa byams pa la sogs pa //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang dang // 'phags pa byams pa la sogs pa //
translated: the noble Maitreya, and so on,🔽the wise ones, the many sages,

original: mkhas pa thub pa mang po dag / bsnyen med tshul gyis de bsnyen byed //
analyzed: mkhas pa thub pa mang po dag / bsnyen med tshul gyis de bsnyen byed //
translated: are served by the bodhisattvas without being served.

original: ces bya ba ni 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang / 'phags pa byams pa dang / kun du bzang po dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas sa bcu pa'i dbang phyug brnyes pa dmigs su med pa goms par bsgoms pas dri ma med pa /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang / 'phags pa byams pa dang / kun du bzang po dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas sa bcu pa'i dbang phyug brnyes pa dmigs su med pa goms par bsgoms pas dri ma med pa /
translated: This means that the noble Avalokiteśvara, the noble Maitreya, Samantabhadra, Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, and so on, by perfecting all the perfections, have attained the lordship of the tenth stage, are accustomed to the stainless meditation of non-apprehending,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs pa med pa la mkhas pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs pa med pa la mkhas pa /
translated: are skilled in the non-apprehending nature,

original: thub pa mang po dag kyang lus dang ngag dang yid ngo bo nyid med pa sgyu ma lta bu'i phyag 'tshal ba dang / bstod ra dang bsam pa dag gis de la bsnyen bkur bya ba med pa'i tshul gyis bsnyen bkur byed de /
analyzed: thub pa mang po dag kyang lus dang ngag dang yid ngo bo nyid med pa sgyu ma lta bu'i phyag 'tshal ba dang / bstod ra dang bsam pa dag gis de la bsnyen bkur bya ba med pa'i tshul gyis bsnyen bkur byed de /
translated: The many sages also pay homage to the Buddha with bodies, speech, and minds that are essentially unreal and illusionlike, and they serve him with pure thoughts and praise, in a manner that is free of the idea of service.

original: bsnyen bkur bya ba med pa nyid bsnyen bkur yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya ba med pa nyid bsnyen bkur yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Service is itself free of service.

original: gal te smos pa med pa dang rnam par mi rtog pa thams cad du song ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te smos pa med pa dang rnam par mi rtog pa thams cad du song ba yin na /
translated: If the absence of conceptualization and the absence of expression are omnipresent,

original: 'o na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa kho na'i spu yin la gzhan dag gi ma yin par shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa kho na'i spu yin la gzhan dag gi ma yin par shes par bya zhe na /
translated: how should one understand that only the Tathāgatas have pores that contain universes, but others do not?🔽It is explained:

original: bshad pa / de las dngos nyid min gzhan dang // des ni thugs su chud pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bshad pa / de las dngos nyid min gzhan dang // des ni thugs su chud pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they are not essentially different from it,🔽and because he has realized it,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur 'dod de //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur 'dod de //
translated: the Tathāgata is considered to be the body of the Dharma.

original: gzhan gyi ma yin de ma rtogs //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ma yin de ma rtogs //
translated: Others are not, because they have not realized it.

original: zhes bya ba ni don dam par de tshig dang blo'i yul ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don dam par de tshig dang blo'i yul ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: Although ultimately the Dharma is not an object of words and mind,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po mnga' @129b ba gang yin pa de nyid nga'i yin pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po mnga' @129b ba gang yin pa de nyid nga'i yin pas /
translated: The essence of the Tathagata is the major and minor marks.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de las sku de'i dngos po nyid mi gzhan pa'i phyir de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de las sku de'i dngos po nyid mi gzhan pa'i phyir de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yin par 'dod do //
translated: Since that is mine, the body of the Tathagata is asserted to be the body of the Tathagata because it is not different from that body.

original: de'i dngos po nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i dngos po nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is its essence?

original: stong pa nyid de ji skad du //
analyzed: stong pa nyid de ji skad du //
translated: Emptiness. As it is said:

original: stong pa nyid la tha dad nyid //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la tha dad nyid //
translated: There is no difference in emptiness.

original: cung zad med par rab tu bstan //
analyzed: cung zad med par rab tu bstan //
translated: It is taught to be nothing at all.

original: stong nyid de ni gcig nyid de //
analyzed: stong nyid de ni gcig nyid de //
translated: That emptiness is one.

original: gang gis stong nyid de mthong ba //
analyzed: gang gis stong nyid de mthong ba //
translated: Whoever sees emptiness

original: des ni sangs rgyas mthong bar 'gyur //🔽stong pa nyid las de gzhan min //
analyzed: des ni sangs rgyas mthong bar 'gyur // stong pa nyid las de gzhan min //
translated: sees the Buddha.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is not different from emptiness.

original: yang na ye shes kyi skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa des gzugs la sogs pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i chos 'dus pa dag dmigs su med pa'i sgo nas dmigs par bya ba dang /
analyzed: yang na ye shes kyi skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa des gzugs la sogs pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i chos 'dus pa dag dmigs su med pa'i sgo nas dmigs par bya ba dang /
translated: Or else, the Tathāgata called the moment of transcendent wisdom realizes the identity of form and so on, the powers, the fearlessnesses, the unique qualities of a buddha, and so on, by means of the nonapprehension of phenomena, and

original: dmigs pa mnyam pas mnyam pa'i ngo bo nyid du thugs su chud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs pa mnyam pas mnyam pa'i ngo bo nyid du thugs su chud pa'i phyir /
translated: he realizes them as the identity of sameness, by means of the sameness of apprehension and the sameness of the object of apprehension.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pa kho na'i sku yin par 'dod kyi gzhan su'i yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pa kho na'i sku yin par 'dod kyi gzhan su'i yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that body is asserted to be the body of the Tathāgata alone, not anyone else’s.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyan thos la sogs pa gzhan dag gis de yang dag pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa gzhan dag gis de yang dag pa ji lta ba de bzhin du ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because others, such as the śrāvakas, do not realize it as it is.

original: sku gsum rnam par gzhag pa nyid kyang slob dpon gyis rang gi bstan bcos kyi skabs su 'di skad bshad de /
analyzed: sku gsum rnam par gzhag pa nyid kyang slob dpon gyis rang gi bstan bcos kyi skabs su 'di skad bshad de /
translated: The master also explains the presentation of the three bodies in his own treatise as follows:

original: 'og min gyi pho brang du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sems kyi mod la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ye shes kyi bdag nyid bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag grangs med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa nye bar
analyzed: 'og min gyi pho brang du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sems kyi mod la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ye shes kyi bdag nyid bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag grangs med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa nye bar
translated: The moment the mind of perfect enlightenment is attained in the Akaniṣhṭha palace, the kāya of the tathāgata, which is the nature of wisdom, is definitely born from incalculable, immeasurable accumulations of merit and wisdom gathered over countless quintillions of eons.

original: bsags pa las nges par 'khrungs pa yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal po gzugs sna tshogs can ltar rtog pa mi mnga' ba /
analyzed: bsags pa las nges par 'khrungs pa yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal po gzugs sna tshogs can ltar rtog pa mi mnga' ba /
translated: Like a wish-fulfilling gem with various forms, it is free from concepts.

original: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: It is free from all elaborations.

original: sgrib pa rnam pa gnyis spangs pa /
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam pa gnyis spangs pa /
translated: It is free from the two obscurations.

original: sa thams cad la phan gdags pa'i phyir gnas par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzugs kyi sku dang lhan cig nyid du mngon par 'grub po //
analyzed: sa thams cad la phan gdags pa'i phyir gnas par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzugs kyi sku dang lhan cig nyid du mngon par 'grub po //
translated: It is simultaneously accomplished together with the rūpakāya, which has the characteristic of abiding in order to benefit all the bhūmis.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam par mi rtog pa'i de las gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i tshul khrims kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyi dbang gis sprul pa'i skus thams cad la phan 'dogs par mthong ba /🔽'dzam bu'i gling bye ba phrag brgya dag tu dga' ldan @130a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam par mi rtog pa'i de las gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i tshul khrims kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyi dbang gis sprul pa'i skus thams cad la phan 'dogs par mthong ba / 'dzam bu'i gling bye ba phrag brgya dag tu dga' ldan @130a * //
translated: The emanation body of the Tathagata, which is the power of the force of his former prayers, is seen to benefit all beings by the morality of the way of accomplishing the benefit of others, which is the opposite of the nonconceptual body of the Tathagata.

original: gyi pho brang na bzhugs pa thog mar mdzad de /
analyzed: gyi pho brang na bzhugs pa thog mar mdzad de /
translated: In one hundred million Jambudvipas, he first manifests his presence in the Tuṣita palace.

original: 'pho ba dang / lhums su 'jug pa dang / lhums na bzhugs pa dang / bltams pa dang / gzhon nu rol pa dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / dka' ba spyod pa dang byang chub kyi snying por gshegs pa dang /
analyzed: 'pho ba dang / lhums su 'jug pa dang / lhums na bzhugs pa dang / bltams pa dang / gzhon nu rol pa dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / dka' ba spyod pa dang byang chub kyi snying por gshegs pa dang /
translated: He then manifests his passing away, entering the womb, remaining in the womb, being born, playing as a youth, living in the retinue of queens, leaving home, practicing austerities, going to the Bodhi tree,

original: bdud 'dul ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskul ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa kun du ston pa nyid 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdud 'dul ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskul ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa kun du ston pa nyid 'byung ngo //
translated: The Buddha's deeds are revealed, such as subduing Mara, attaining perfect enlightenment, turning the wheel of Dharma, and passing into great nirvana.

original: de la brten nas yi ge dang rtsa ba dang tshig gi go rims kyi mtshan nyid kyi gsung yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de la brten nas yi ge dang rtsa ba dang tshig gi go rims kyi mtshan nyid kyi gsung yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa /
translated: Based on that, the Buddha's speech endowed with sixty melodious qualities, characterized by letters, roots, and word order,

original: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa rangs par mdzad pa gang la theg pa mchog gis 'gro ba rnams kyi theg pa chen po zhes bya bar brjod pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa rangs par mdzad pa gang la theg pa mchog gis 'gro ba rnams kyi theg pa chen po zhes bya bar brjod pa 'byung ste /
translated: which delights the minds of all sentient beings, is expressed as the Great Vehicle for those who go by the supreme vehicle.

original: ye shes dang / gzugs dang / gsung gi sku gsum po de dag ni sdom pa gsum las nges par 'khrungs pa /
analyzed: ye shes dang / gzugs dang / gsung gi sku gsum po de dag ni sdom pa gsum las nges par 'khrungs pa /
translated: Those three bodies of wisdom, form, and speech are definitely born from the three vows,

original: lus dang ngag dang sems gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: and have the nature of the transformation of body, speech, and mind.

original: mdo sde las /
analyzed: mdo sde las /
translated: It is explained in the sutras:

original: gang dag nga la gzugs su mthong //
analyzed: gang dag nga la gzugs su mthong //
translated: Those who see me as form,

original: gang dag nga la sgrar shes pa //
analyzed: gang dag nga la sgrar shes pa //
translated: Those who know me as sound

original: log par spong bas zhugs pa ste //
analyzed: log par spong bas zhugs pa ste //
translated: are engaged in false rejection.

original: skye bo de dag nga mi mthong //
analyzed: skye bo de dag nga mi mthong //
translated: Those people do not see me.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos nyid blta //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos nyid blta //
translated: The Buddhas should be seen as reality.

original: 'dren pa rnams ni chos kyi sku //
analyzed: 'dren pa rnams ni chos kyi sku //
translated: The Leaders are the Dharma Body.

original: chos nyid shes par bya min pas //
analyzed: chos nyid shes par bya min pas //
translated: Reality cannot be known,

original: de ni rnam par shes mi nus //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes mi nus //
translated: so it cannot be cognized.

original: zhes gsungs pa des kyang sku gsum po de dag kun rdzobs dang don dam par rnam par gzhag pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa des kyang sku gsum po de dag kun rdzobs dang don dam par rnam par gzhag pa nyid du ston te /
translated: This also shows that the three bodies are presented as conventional and ultimate.

original: 'dir ye shes ni chos kyi skur bzhed do //
analyzed: 'dir ye shes ni chos kyi skur bzhed do //
translated: Here, gnosis is accepted as the Dharma Body.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po las kyang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po las kyang /
translated: The Great Perfection of Wisdom says,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de la chos kyi sku dang gzugs kyi sku dang gzugs kyi sku dang ye shes kyi skur blta bar 'dod pas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de la chos kyi sku dang gzugs kyi sku dang gzugs kyi sku dang ye shes kyi skur blta bar 'dod pas zhes gsungs te /
translated: “One who wishes to see the Tathagata should see him as the Dharma Body, the Form Body, and the gnosis body.”

original: der chos kyi sku zhes gsungs pa ni gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po dag yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: der chos kyi sku zhes gsungs pa ni gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po dag yin par 'dod do //
translated: Here, the Dharma Body is accepted as the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: 'o na skyabs gnyis pa med par 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na skyabs gnyis pa med par 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: But if there is no second refuge, then there is no refuge.

original: med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: There is no such fault,

original: sgrub pa dang 'bras bu'i chos yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang 'bras bu'i chos yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Dharma of practice and the Dharma of result exist.

original: 'phags pa rdo rje sdes ni gzugs kyi sku 'og min gyi spyod yul can chos kyi sku'i gzhi la brten pa ni rnam par smyin pa'i @130b sku zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa rdo rje sdes ni gzugs kyi sku 'og min gyi spyod yul can chos kyi sku'i gzhi la brten pa ni rnam par smyin pa'i @130b sku zhes bshad do //
translated: The noble Vajradatta explains that the form body, which has the Akaniṣṭha realm as its domain, is the body of maturation, based on the ground of the Dharma body.

original: 'phags pa thogs med kyis ni de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku zhes bstan la /
analyzed: 'phags pa thogs med kyis ni de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku zhes bstan la /
translated: The noble Asaṅga teaches that it is the body of enjoyment.

original: stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi gzhir gyur pa ni chos kyi skur bstan /
analyzed: stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi gzhir gyur pa ni chos kyi skur bstan /
translated: He teaches that the ground of the qualities of the powers, fearlessnesses, and the unique qualities of the Buddha is the Dharma body.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni sprul pa'i skur bstan to //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni sprul pa'i skur bstan to //
translated: He teaches that the full enlightenment in Jambudvīpa is the emanation body.

original: de ltar chos dang gzugs dang sprul pa'i sku gsum po de dag ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar chos dang gzugs dang sprul pa'i sku gsum po de dag ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, these three bodies, the Dharma body, the form body, and the emanation body, belong to the Tathāgata alone, not to others.

original: rnam par grol ba'i sku ni nyan thos la sogs pa dag la yang 'dra bar yod pa de dag las khyad par du chos kyi sku zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i sku ni nyan thos la sogs pa dag la yang 'dra bar yod pa de dag las khyad par du chos kyi sku zhes gsungs so //
translated: The liberated body is the same for śrāvakas and so on, but it is said that the dharmakāya is superior to those.

original: chos kyi sku de rnal 'byor pa tshangs pa bsgom pa goms par byed pas mthong bar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: chos kyi sku de rnal 'byor pa tshangs pa bsgom pa goms par byed pas mthong bar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To explain that the dharmakāya is seen by the yogi who cultivates the meditation of Brahmā, it is said:

original: de nyid bsgom pa goms byed pa //
analyzed: de nyid bsgom pa goms byed pa //
translated: That very one who cultivates meditation

original: dmigs med gnas pa de la yang //
analyzed: dmigs med gnas pa de la yang //
translated: on the non-apprehensible

original: gang la yid ni chags 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: gang la yid ni chags 'gyur zhing //
translated: where can the mind become attached,

original: sdang 'gyur rmongs 'gyur ga la yod //
analyzed: sdang 'gyur rmongs 'gyur ga la yod //
translated: averse, or deluded?

original: ces bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa de nyid shes pa tshol bar sems pa dang / bsgom pa dag gis dmigs su med pa'i rnam pa goms par byed pa de nyid mi rtog pa dmigs pa med par gnas pa de la yang gnas pa'i gzhi med pa'i phyir yul gang la yid chags pa dang sdang ba dang rmongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa de nyid shes pa tshol bar sems pa dang / bsgom pa dag gis dmigs su med pa'i rnam pa goms par byed pa de nyid mi rtog pa dmigs pa med par gnas pa de la yang gnas pa'i gzhi med pa'i phyir yul gang la yid chags pa dang sdang ba dang rmongs par 'gyur te /
translated: The yogi who seeks to know thatness and cultivates meditation on the non-apprehensible aspect is the one who abides in non-conceptuality and the absence of apprehension. Since there is no basis for abiding, where can the mind become attached, averse, or deluded with regard to any object?

original: gzhi med pa'i 'dod chags dang zhes sdang dang gti mug dag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi med pa'i 'dod chags dang zhes sdang dang gti mug dag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Desire, hatred, and delusion do not arise without a basis.

original: 'o na ji ltar de bsgom pa goms par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de bsgom pa goms par bya zhe na /
translated: But how is that meditation to be cultivated?

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pas de bsgom pa goms par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pas de bsgom pa goms par bya'o //
translated: It is cultivated by recollecting the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: Recollecting the Buddha is itself free of recollection and free of mental activity.🔽As it is said in the Perfection of Wisdom:🔽“Recollecting the Buddha is free of recollection and free of mental activity.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa med pa dang yid la byed pa med pa'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du sgo mtha' yas pa bsgrub pa'i gzungs las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa med pa dang yid la byed pa med pa'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du sgo mtha' yas pa bsgrub pa'i gzungs las /
translated: And in the Dhāraṇī of the Infinite Gate:

original: de sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa 'ba' zhig bsgom ste /
analyzed: de sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa 'ba' zhig bsgom ste /
translated: “He cultivates only the meditation of recollecting the Buddha.

original: gzugs las ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs las ma yin /
translated: Not from form,

original: mtshan dang dpe byad las ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad las ma yin /
translated: not from the major and minor marks,

original: yon tan las ma yin /
analyzed: yon tan las ma yin /
translated: not from the qualities,

original: chos las ma yin /
analyzed: chos las ma yin /
translated: not from the Dharma,🔽and not from the Saṅgha.

original: chos ma yin pa las ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i @131a * //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa las ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i @131a * //
translated: And likewise, the Tathagata Chapter says:

original: le'u las / de bzhin gshegs pa la lta ba ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang /
analyzed: le'u las / de bzhin gshegs pa la lta ba ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang /
translated: To see the Tathagata is to see emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-production, non-cessation, non-arising, non-entity,🔽non-conditioning, and so on.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med par lta ba yin no zhes ji skad gsungs ba dang / de bzhin du blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med par lta ba yin no zhes ji skad gsungs ba dang / de bzhin du blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: And likewise, the Aksayamatinirdesa says:

original: de la sangs rgyas su dran pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas su dran pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the recollection of the Buddha?

original: gzugs dang mtshan gyis rab tu phye ba ma yin pa dang / skye ba dang / rigs dang / dus kyis rab tu phye ba ma yin pa dang / sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa dkar pos rab tu phye ba ma yin pa dang ; phyi ma'i mtha'i shes pa rlom pas rab tu phye ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs dang mtshan gyis rab tu phye ba ma yin pa dang / skye ba dang / rigs dang / dus kyis rab tu phye ba ma yin pa dang / sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa dkar pos rab tu phye ba ma yin pa dang ; phyi ma'i mtha'i shes pa rlom pas rab tu phye ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: not distinguished by the conceit of knowledge of the future,

original: da ltar byung ba'i gnas pas rab tu phye ba ma yin pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i gnas pas rab tu phye ba ma yin pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: and not distinguished by the present state.

original: sgrib pa thams cad kyi gzhi ma yin pa dang / mtshan ma thams cad kun nas slong pa ma yin pa dang / rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba gang yin pa'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad kyi gzhi ma yin pa dang / mtshan ma thams cad kun nas slong pa ma yin pa dang / rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba gang yin pa'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is not the basis of any obscurations, does not give rise to any signs, and is the complete pacification of all thoughts, concepts, and ideas.

original: de nyid goms par byed pa la ni /🔽sdug bral mi sdug phrad pa las //
analyzed: de nyid goms par byed pa la ni / sdug bral mi sdug phrad pa las //
translated: In order to cultivate that suchness,🔽the root text says:🔽What suffering arises from

original: byung ba'i sdug bsngal ga las 'byung //
analyzed: byung ba'i sdug bsngal ga las 'byung //
translated: being separated from the pleasant and encountering the unpleasant?

original: 'jig rten chos kyis mi gos te //
analyzed: 'jig rten chos kyis mi gos te //
translated: You are not sullied by worldly phenomena.

original: padma la ni chus bzhin no //
analyzed: padma la ni chus bzhin no //
translated: Like a lotus in water.

original: zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa de dag dmigs su med pa'i phyir sdug pa dang bral ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa las sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba gang dag 'byung ba de dag kyang de la 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa de dag dmigs su med pa'i phyir sdug pa dang bral ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa las sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba gang dag 'byung ba de dag kyang de la 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he does not objectify the pleasant and the unpleasant, the feelings of pleasure and pain that arise from contact with the pleasant and the unpleasant do not affect him.

original: 'jig rten na gnas su zin kyang 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad po rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa zhes bya ba dag gis mi gos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na gnas su zin kyang 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad po rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa zhes bya ba dag gis mi gos te /
translated: Even though he remains in the world, he is not defiled by the eight worldly concerns gain and loss, pleasure and pain, fame and disgrace, praise and blame.

original: de la chags pa me pa'i phyir padma chu nas skyes kyang chu'i nyes pas mi gos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de la chags pa me pa'i phyir padma chu nas skyes kyang chu'i nyes pas mi gos pa bzhin no //
translated: Because he is not attached to them, like a lotus born in water that is not defiled by the water’s faults.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni sngar bstan mod kyi yang skabs su bab pas bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni sngar bstan mod kyi yang skabs su bab pas bstan par bya ste /
translated: Nonabiding nirvana was explained above, but it will be taught again here, since the occasion for it has arisen.

original: 'khor ba las ni 'byung ma yin //
analyzed: 'khor ba las ni 'byung ma yin //
translated: He does not emerge from cyclic existence.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the afflictions have not been abandoned.

original: 'khor ba las gnod bral ma yin //
analyzed: 'khor ba las gnod bral ma yin //
translated: They are not free from the harm of cyclic existence.

original: zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i chos mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa rnam par mnan pa'i phyir @131b ro ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i chos mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa rnam par mnan pa'i phyir @131b ro ;
translated: This is because they do not create nonvirtuous things and they suppress the afflictions.

original: / mya ngan 'das pa thob ma yin //
analyzed: / mya ngan 'das pa thob ma yin //
translated: They have not attained nirvana.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can la lta ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can la lta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they look after sentient beings.

original: mya ngan 'das la gnas dang 'dra //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das la gnas dang 'dra //
translated: They are like those who abide in nirvana.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi don byed nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi don byed nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are able to accomplish the aims of self and other.

original: nyon mongs me yis gdung ba med //
analyzed: nyon mongs me yis gdung ba med //
translated: They are not tormented by the fire of the afflictions.

original: ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they have abandoned the practice of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs ldan yang nam mkha' bzhin //
analyzed: nyon mongs ldan yang nam mkha' bzhin //
translated: They are like space, even though they have afflictions.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba bskyed pa'i sa bon gyi nyon mongs pa chung ngu yod kyang des mi gos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba bskyed pa'i sa bon gyi nyon mongs pa chung ngu yod kyang des mi gos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are not tainted by the small afflictions that are the seeds of the production of cyclic existence.

original: sems med sems med ma yin te //
analyzed: sems med sems med ma yin te //
translated: They are not mindless, nor are they not mindless.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags pa'i phyir dang / rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags pa'i phyir dang / rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the active consciousnesses cease and because the consciousness that is the result of ripening exists.

original: ji lta zhe na /
