analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?🔽Because it is the basis for the meditative attainment.

original: gang gi phyir de ni snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan shin tu goms par byas pas lus dang sems las su rung bas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan shin tu goms par byas pas lus dang sems las su rung bas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the attainment of the meditative attainment of cessation through the flexibility of body and mind that comes from thorough familiarity with the meditative concentrations.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob kyang byang chub ma rtogs pa'i mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa na yang /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob kyang byang chub ma rtogs pa'i mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa na yang /
translated: Even though one has attained the supramundane meditative attainment, one still abides in the nondwelling nirvana, without realizing enlightenment.

original: de ni shes rab lhun po'i rtser //
analyzed: de ni shes rab lhun po'i rtser //
translated: That one ascends to the peak of the mountain of wisdom

original: 'dzegs shing mya ngan med gyur kyang //🔽snying rje'i dbang gis 'jig rten pa //
analyzed: 'dzegs shing mya ngan med gyur kyang // snying rje'i dbang gis 'jig rten pa //
translated: and is free from sorrow,🔽but through the power of compassion,

original: mya ngan gdungs dang sdug bsngal lta //
analyzed: mya ngan gdungs dang sdug bsngal lta //
translated: appears to be sorrowful and in pain in the world.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab ni che ba'i phyir dang / mngon par mtho pa'i phyir lhun po'i rtse dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab ni che ba'i phyir dang / mngon par mtho pa'i phyir lhun po'i rtse dang 'dra'o //
translated: The wisdom that transcends the world is like the peak of a mountain, because it is exalted and lofty.

original: der 'dzegs pa ni thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa dag gis shin tu rab tu gnas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: der 'dzegs pa ni thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa dag gis shin tu rab tu gnas par gyur pa'o //
translated: One who has climbed it is one who has well attained the states of learning, reflection, and meditation.

original: mya ngan med par gyur kyang zhes bya ba ni des sgyu ma lta bu'i chos nyid rtogs pa'i phyir bdag nyid mya ngan med par gyur kyang ngo //
analyzed: mya ngan med par gyur kyang zhes bya ba ni des sgyu ma lta bu'i chos nyid rtogs pa'i phyir bdag nyid mya ngan med par gyur kyang ngo //
translated: Even though one has become free from sorrow means that, because one has realized the reality that is like an illusion, one is free from sorrow.

original: snying rje'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni de'i sems kyi rgyud snying rje la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni de'i sems kyi rgyud snying rje la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Out of compassion means that one's mental continuum is established in compassion.

original: 'jig rten pa mya ngan gyis gdungs pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la lta'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa pha ma dang bral ba la sogs pa'i mya ngan me lta bus sems gdungs pa dang ; rgyun du mi rtag pa nyid kyi rjes su 'brel pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa la rnam par lta bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa mya ngan gyis gdungs pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la lta'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa pha ma dang bral ba la sogs pa'i mya ngan me lta bus sems gdungs pa dang ; rgyun du mi rtag pa nyid kyi rjes su 'brel pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa la rnam par lta bar byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase and the world endowed with suffering means that the world is endowed with suffering that is related to impermanence.

original: de ni de tshe snying rje yis //🔽brlan pa'i mig gis 'jig rten pa //
analyzed: de ni de tshe snying rje yis // brlan pa'i mig gis 'jig rten pa //
translated: The phrase with eyes moistened by compassion means that the eyes are moistened by compassion.

original: rnam rtog bzo las byung ba yi //🔽rtog pa'i dra bas dkris pa dang // skye rgan chi'i zug rngu @132a * //
analyzed: rnam rtog bzo las byung ba yi // rtog pa'i dra bas dkris pa dang // skye rgan chi'i zug rngu @132a * //
translated: The phrase the world is bound by the net of imagination means that the world is bound by the net of imagination that arises from the imagination of what is unreal.🔽The phrase the world is pierced by the dart of sorrow means that the world is pierced by the dart of sorrow that arises from the suffering of birth, old age, disease, death, etc.🔽The phrase the world is weak, poor, and miserable means that the world is weak, poor, and miserable due to the suffering of change.

original: yis ; ; rma btod na bar gyur pa dang // zhan dang bkren dang mtha' ngan dang // mgon med dpung gnyen med pa dang // sdug bsngal nye bar zhi 'dod pas //
analyzed: yis ; ; rma btod na bar gyur pa dang // zhan dang bkren dang mtha' ngan dang // mgon med dpung gnyen med pa dang // sdug bsngal nye bar zhi 'dod pas //
translated: The phrase the world is without protection, without shelter, and without recourse means that the world is without protection, without shelter, and without recourse due to the suffering of the conditioned state of being.

original: sdug bsngal chu bo cher lhung dang // sdug bsngal rgyu dag spel ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sdug bsngal chu bo cher lhung dang // sdug bsngal rgyu dag spel ba'i phyir //
translated: The phrase the world is submerged in a great flood of suffering means that the world is submerged in a great flood of suffering that arises from the suffering of suffering.🔽The phrase the world is engaged in the activities that generate the causes of suffering means that the world is engaged in the activities that generate the causes of suffering that arise from the suffering of suffering.

original: rmongs pa'i yid kyis zhugs pa dang ; / de nyid bdud rtsi zhi ba dang // spros pa nyer zhi ston ka yi //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i yid kyis zhugs pa dang ; / de nyid bdud rtsi zhi ba dang // spros pa nyer zhi ston ka yi //
translated: the pacification of elaborations,

original: dri med mkha' blo spyod pa yi //
analyzed: dri med mkha' blo spyod pa yi //
translated: the stainless space of the mind.🔽The bodhisattvas, with their eyes of wisdom moistened by compassion,🔽look out over the world,🔽and with eyes that are unattached and unimpeded,

original: snang med mig med kun bltas nas //
analyzed: snang med mig med kun bltas nas //
translated: they see all.

original: zhes bya ba dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa' de mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de la gnas pa de'i tshe na snying rjes brlan pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis 'jig rten pa la kun du bltas nas snying rjes shin tu gdungs pa la sogs
analyzed: zhes bya ba dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa' de mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de la gnas pa de'i tshe na snying rjes brlan pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis 'jig rten pa la kun du bltas nas snying rjes shin tu gdungs pa la sogs
translated: With these verses, it is shown that when the bodhisattvas are abiding in that nonabiding nirvana, with eyes of wisdom moistened by compassion, they look out over the world and, with eyes that are unattached and unimpeded, they see all.🔽With the eyes of wisdom moistened by compassion, they see that beings are tormented by suffering and are the source of their own suffering.

original: pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas pha rol tu phyin pa'i chu bo 'bebs shing gzhan gyi sdug bsngal sel ba dang / bdag nyid dpag bsam gyi shing lta bur byed cing bde 'gro la sogs pa gang du gzhan la phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur pa'i gnas su skye ba dang /
analyzed: pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas pha rol tu phyin pa'i chu bo 'bebs shing gzhan gyi sdug bsngal sel ba dang / bdag nyid dpag bsam gyi shing lta bur byed cing bde 'gro la sogs pa gang du gzhan la phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur pa'i gnas su skye ba dang /
translated: They see that beings are tormented by suffering and are the source of their own suffering.

original: de dag tu skyes pa'i tshe na 'khor btsugs shing sran thub pa dag dang ldan zhing rgya mtsho bzhin du sgo mang po nas bsod nams kyi chu bo dag gis yongs su gang bar 'gyur ro zhes 'og nas 'byung ba'i don dang tshig gi mjug sdud 'byung ba
analyzed: de dag tu skyes pa'i tshe na 'khor btsugs shing sran thub pa dag dang ldan zhing rgya mtsho bzhin du sgo mang po nas bsod nams kyi chu bo dag gis yongs su gang bar 'gyur ro zhes 'og nas 'byung ba'i don dang tshig gi mjug sdud 'byung ba
translated: When they are born there, they are endowed with a retinue and patience, and they are completely filled with the river of merit through many doors, like the ocean.

original: dag spyir blo la bzhag ste ston to //
analyzed: dag spyir blo la bzhag ste ston to //
translated: This is the summary of the meaning and words that will be explained below.🔽When he sees the world with the eye of wisdom moistened by compassion, in what condition does he see the world?

original: de de'i tshe snying rjes brlan pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis 'jig rten pa la kun du blta ba na 'jig rten pa gnas skabs ji lta bur gyur pa dag la kun du blta zhe na /
analyzed: de de'i tshe snying rjes brlan pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis 'jig rten pa la kun du blta ba na 'jig rten pa gnas skabs ji lta bur gyur pa dag la kun du blta zhe na /
translated: He sees the world as bound by the net of imagination,

original: rnam rtog bzo las byung ba yi //
analyzed: rnam rtog bzo las byung ba yi //
translated: which arises from the fabrication of conceptualization.

original: rtog pa'i dra bas dkris pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'i gnas skabs su gyur pa la kun du blta'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rtog pa'i dra bas dkris pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'i gnas skabs su gyur pa la kun du blta'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: He sees the world in a condition like this.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas kun nas bslang pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid bzo yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas kun nas bslang pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid bzo yin te /
translated: Imagination is fabrication, because it is conceptualization that is motivated by mental consciousness.

original: de las byung ba'i rtog pa'i dra ba yod pa dang med pa la sogs par blta ba phung po dang / khams dang skye mched kyi gzhi la dmigs pa mang po dag gis kun nas dkris shing g-yogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i rtog pa'i dra ba yod pa dang med pa la sogs par blta ba phung po dang / khams dang skye mched kyi gzhi la dmigs pa mang po dag gis kun nas dkris shing g-yogs pa la'o //
translated: The net of conceptual thoughts that arise from that is the view of existence, nonexistence, and so on, which is the many entanglements and coverings that focus on the bases of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.🔽

original: rtog pa'i dra bas dkris pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de 'o na ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na /🔽skye rga na 'chi'i zug rngu yis //
analyzed: rtog pa'i dra bas dkris pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de 'o na ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na / skye rga na 'chi'i zug rngu yis //
translated: The net of conceptual thoughts that arise from that, such as the view of existence and non-existence, etc., completely entangle and cover the many objects of observation that are the bases of the aggregates, constituents, and sense-spheres.🔽Not only are they entangled by the net of conceptual thoughts, but also they are afflicted by the pain of birth, aging, sickness, and death.

original: rma btod na bar gyur pa dang // zhes bya ba ni phung po 'byung ba'i skye ba dang / yongs su 'gyur @132b ba'i rga ba dang / nad kyis na ba dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i 'chi ba de dag nyid yid mi bde ba'i bdag nyid kyi zug rngu yin te /
analyzed: rma btod na bar gyur pa dang // zhes bya ba ni phung po 'byung ba'i skye ba dang / yongs su 'gyur @132b ba'i rga ba dang / nad kyis na ba dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i 'chi ba de dag nyid yid mi bde ba'i bdag nyid kyi zug rngu yin te /
translated: The pain of birth, aging, sickness, and death, which are the arising, changing, sickness, and destruction of the aggregates, are the pain of mental dissatisfaction.

original: des rma btod pas rtag tu na par gyur cing mi bde bar gyur pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des rma btod pas rtag tu na par gyur cing mi bde bar gyur pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since they are afflicted by that, they are always sick and unhappy.

original: gzhan yang / zhan dang bkren dang mtha' ngan dang // mgon med dpung gnyen med pa dang // zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i khyim nas nges par 'byung ba'i bya ba la mong brtul bas zhan pa dang / dge ba'i chos kyis dbul bas bkren pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang / zhan dang bkren dang mtha' ngan dang // mgon med dpung gnyen med pa dang // zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i khyim nas nges par 'byung ba'i bya ba la mong brtul bas zhan pa dang / dge ba'i chos kyis dbul bas bkren pa dang /
translated: the weak are those who are not diligent in the activity of definite emergence from the house of cyclic existence. The poor are those who are impoverished by virtuous qualities.

original: mjug mi bzang bas mtha' ngan pa dang / dad pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i mgon byed pa'i chos bcu dang bral bas mgon med pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i lam la mi mkhas pas dpung gnyen med pa la'o //
analyzed: mjug mi bzang bas mtha' ngan pa dang / dad pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i mgon byed pa'i chos bcu dang bral bas mgon med pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i lam la mi mkhas pas dpung gnyen med pa la'o //
translated: The unfortunate are those who have an unfortunate end. The helpless are those who lack the ten qualities that protect, such as faith and ethical discipline. The friendless are those who are unskilled in the path of definite emergence.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / sdug bsngal nye bar zhi 'dod pas //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sdug bsngal nye bar zhi 'dod pas //
translated: those who desire to pacify suffering🔽should cross the great river of suffering

original: sdug bsngal chu bo cher lhung dang // sdug bsngal rgyu dag spel ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sdug bsngal chu bo cher lhung dang // sdug bsngal rgyu dag spel ba'i phyir //
translated: and should increase the causes of suffering.

original: rmongs pa'i yid kyis zhugs pa dang // zhes bya ba ni dper na 'ga' zhig 'bab chus khyer ba na de las bskyab pa'i phyir chu bor mchongs pa na des de shin tu snga ma pas cher khyer bar gyur pa de bzhin du 'jig rten 'di yang sngon nye bar blangs pa'i las dag gis sdug
analyzed: rmongs pa'i yid kyis zhugs pa dang // zhes bya ba ni dper na 'ga' zhig 'bab chus khyer ba na de las bskyab pa'i phyir chu bor mchongs pa na des de shin tu snga ma pas cher khyer bar gyur pa de bzhin du 'jig rten 'di yang sngon nye bar blangs pa'i las dag gis sdug
translated: The phrase “due to the deluded mind” is an analogy: for example, if someone is carried away by a river, in order to save them, one jumps into the river, but that causes them to be carried away even further by the river.

original: bsngal gyi chu bor bying ba na /
analyzed: bsngal gyi chu bor bying ba na /
translated: Similarly, this world is sinking in the river of suffering due to karma that was previously appropriated.

original: sdug bsngal ba de nye bar 'dod pas sgrib pa shas shin tu chen pos bsgribs par byas nas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba de nye bar 'dod pas sgrib pa shas shin tu chen pos bsgribs par byas nas /
translated: Due to the desire for that suffering, they are obscured by a very great degree of obscuration.🔽They appropriate karma that will cause them to be carried away for a long time in the great river of cyclic existence.

original: las gang dag gis yun ring por 'khor ba'i chu bo chen por 'khor bar 'gyur ba'i las nye bar len pa de dag nye bar len pas sdug bsngal gyi chu bor lhung ba dang / 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang bdag tu smra ba dang /
analyzed: las gang dag gis yun ring por 'khor ba'i chu bo chen por 'khor bar 'gyur ba'i las nye bar len pa de dag nye bar len pas sdug bsngal gyi chu bor lhung ba dang / 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang bdag tu smra ba dang /
translated: They fall into the river of suffering due to the appropriation of karma, and they are carried away by the river of desire, existence, and the assertion of self.

original: tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas 'di bden no snyam du mngon par zhen pa'i lta ba nye bar len pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dag spel ba'i phyir ma rig pas rmongs pa'i yid kyis 'khor ba'i rgyun du zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas 'di bden no snyam du mngon par zhen pa'i lta ba nye bar len pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dag spel ba'i phyir ma rig pas rmongs pa'i yid kyis 'khor ba'i rgyun du zhugs pa yin te /
translated: The mind that is deluded by ignorance, which is the cause of suffering such as the appropriation of views that conceive “this is true” due to the overesteeming of mere rules and ritual, enters into the stream of cyclic existence in order to increase those causes.

original: de lta bur gyur pa la kun du blta'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa la kun du blta'o //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān sees them in that way.

original: de ltar de dag gis ni 'khor ba'i rgyun du zhugs pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar de dag gis ni 'khor ba'i rgyun du zhugs pa nyid bstan te /
translated: Thus, they have been shown to enter into the stream of cyclic existence.

original: thar pa'i thabs rab tu nyams par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thar pa'i thabs rab tu nyams par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the complete absence of a method of liberation,🔽the Bhagavān says,🔽That is nectar, peace,

original: de nyid bdud rtsi zhi ba dang // spos pa nyer zhi ston ka yi //
analyzed: de nyid bdud rtsi zhi ba dang // spos pa nyer zhi ston ka yi //
translated: the pacification of all elaborations,🔽the autumn sky free of clouds,

original: dri med mkha' la blo spyod pa'i //
analyzed: dri med mkha' la blo spyod pa'i //
translated: the mind that moves in stainless space.

original: snang med mig med ces smras te //🔽don @133a * //
analyzed: snang med mig med ces smras te //🔽don @133a * //
translated: It is said to be without appearance and without eyes.

original: dam pa'i de nyid bdud rtsi ltar ngoms par byed pa skye ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa thams cad zhi ba mngon par brjod pa thams cad kyi spros pa nye bar zhi ba ston ka'i dus kyi nam mkha'i dkyil dri ma med pa lta bu la gang gi
analyzed: dam pa'i de nyid bdud rtsi ltar ngoms par byed pa skye ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa thams cad zhi ba mngon par brjod pa thams cad kyi spros pa nye bar zhi ba ston ka'i dus kyi nam mkha'i dkyil dri ma med pa lta bu la gang gi
translated: The ultimate truth is like nectar, satisfying, pacifying all the harms of birth and so on, and it is taught to be the pacification of all the elaborations of expression, like the center of an autumnal sky free from impurities.

original: blo'i spyod pa'i snang ba med pa de nyid shes rab kyi mig dang bral ba'i phyir mig med pa yin te /
analyzed: blo'i spyod pa'i snang ba med pa de nyid shes rab kyi mig dang bral ba'i phyir mig med pa yin te /
translated: Those who are devoid of the light of the mind, who are devoid of the eye of wisdom, are eyeless.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal dang nyon mongs pa mang pos gtses pa'i 'jig rten la kun du bltas nas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal dang nyon mongs pa mang pos gtses pa'i 'jig rten la kun du bltas nas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Having seen the world thus afflicted by many sufferings and afflictions, one should apply the phrase “having seen the world thus afflicted by many sufferings and afflictions.”

original: de lta bu'i 'jig rten la kun du bltas nas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'jig rten la kun du bltas nas /
translated: Having seen the world thus,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i chu bo 'bebs pa la sogs par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de yon tan ji lta bu dang ldan pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i chu bo 'bebs pa la sogs par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de yon tan ji lta bu dang ldan pa zhig ce na /
translated: what kind of qualities does the bodhisattva who causes the river of the perfections to flow and so on possess?

original: snying rjes shin tu yid gdungs pa //
analyzed: snying rjes shin tu yid gdungs pa //
translated: He is one whose mind is extremely tormented by compassion.

original: de la phan phyir brtul zhugs can //
analyzed: de la phan phyir brtul zhugs can //
translated: For their sake, the one with discipline

original: rdo rje rin chen sra ba'i sems //
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen sra ba'i sems //
translated: The mind of the adamantine jewel is firm.

original: sems can gtso bo legs bslabs pa //
analyzed: sems can gtso bo legs bslabs pa //
translated: The chief of beings is well trained.🔽He strives in generosity, morality, patience,

original: sbyin pa tshul khrims bzod pa dang // brtson 'grus bsam gtan shes rab brtson //
analyzed: sbyin pa tshul khrims bzod pa dang // brtson 'grus bsam gtan shes rab brtson //
translated: exertion, meditation, and wisdom.

original: dus bzhin dang ni mthu bzhin du //
analyzed: dus bzhin dang ni mthu bzhin du //
translated: In time and in power,

original: shes rab dran pa sngon 'gro ba //
analyzed: shes rab dran pa sngon 'gro ba //
translated: he is preceded by wisdom and mindfulness.

original: zhes bya ba ste /🔽snying rjes shin tu yid gdungs la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste / snying rjes shin tu yid gdungs la //
translated: This is what it says.🔽With a mind extremely tormented by compassion,

original: zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i shugs kyis shin tu sems gdungs pa'o //🔽de la phan phyir brtul zhugs can //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i shugs kyis shin tu sems gdungs pa'o // de la phan phyir brtul zhugs can //
translated: he is extremely tormented by the force of compassion.🔽For the sake of benefiting that world,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten de la phan gdags pa'i phyir brtul zhugs drag po blangs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten de la phan gdags pa'i phyir brtul zhugs drag po blangs pa'o //
translated: he takes up the strict vow.

original: rdo rje rin chen sra ba'i sems //
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen sra ba'i sems //
translated: The mind of the adamantine jewel is firm.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i ri bos kyang mi phred pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i ri bos kyang mi phred pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He has the mind of enlightenment that is not penetrated even by adamantine mountains.🔽The chief of beings,

original: sems can gtso bo zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa tsam kho nas nyan thos la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gtso bo zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa tsam kho nas nyan thos la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he surpasses the Sravakas, etc. merely by generating the thought of enlightenment.

original: legs bslabs pa zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dag la shin tu legs par bslabs pa'o //
analyzed: legs bslabs pa zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dag la shin tu legs par bslabs pa'o //
translated: Well-trained means well-trained in the bodhisattva trainings of superior morality and so forth.🔽Strive at generosity, morality, patience,

original: sbyin pa tshul khrims bzod pa dang // brtson 'grus bsam gtan shes rab brtson //
analyzed: sbyin pa tshul khrims bzod pa dang // brtson 'grus bsam gtan shes rab brtson //
translated: effort, concentration, and wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / snying rjes ni theg pa chen po'i don mtha' dag bsdus te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / snying rjes ni theg pa chen po'i don mtha' dag bsdus te /
translated: Thus, the perfections and compassion include the entire meaning of the Great Vehicle.

original: slob dpon chen po 'phags pa n'a ga rdzu nas ji skad du /
analyzed: slob dpon chen po 'phags pa n'a ga rdzu nas ji skad du /
translated: As the great master Ārya Nāgārjuna said:

original: sbyin pa tshul khrims bzod dang brtson //
analyzed: sbyin pa tshul khrims bzod dang brtson //
translated: Generosity, morality, patience, and effort,

original: bsam gtan shes rab snying rje yi //
analyzed: bsam gtan shes rab snying rje yi //
translated: Concentration, wisdom, and compassion,

original: bdag nyid theg pa chen po 'di //
analyzed: bdag nyid theg pa chen po 'di //
translated: This is the Great Vehicle

original: sangs rgyas byang chub sems @133b dpas bsngags //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub sems @133b dpas bsngags //
translated: Praised by the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: sbyin pa rang gi bdog pa gtong //
analyzed: sbyin pa rang gi bdog pa gtong //
translated: Generosity is giving away one's own possessions.

original: tshul khrims gzhan la phan pa byed //
analyzed: tshul khrims gzhan la phan pa byed //
translated: Morality is benefiting others.

original: bzod pa khro ba'i gnyen por gsungs //
analyzed: bzod pa khro ba'i gnyen por gsungs //
translated: Patience is said to be the antidote to anger.

original: brtson 'grus dge la brtson pa ste //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dge la brtson pa ste //
translated: Effort is striving at virtue.

original: bsam gtan nyon mongs med rtse gcig / shes rab bden don nges 'byed yin //
analyzed: bsam gtan nyon mongs med rtse gcig / shes rab bden don nges 'byed yin //
translated: Wisdom is the ascertainment of the meaning of the truths.

original: sbyin pas longs spyod khrims kyis bde //
analyzed: sbyin pas longs spyod khrims kyis bde //
translated: Generosity brings wealth; morality, happiness.

original: bzod bas mdangs dang brtson pas 'od //
analyzed: bzod bas mdangs dang brtson pas 'od //
translated: Patience, splendor; effort, brilliance.

original: bsam gtan zhi dang blo gros grol //
analyzed: bsam gtan zhi dang blo gros grol //
translated: Concentration, peace; wisdom, liberation.

original: snying rjes thams cad sgrub par byed //🔽cig car pha rol phyin gyur pa'i //
analyzed: snying rjes thams cad sgrub par byed // cig car pha rol phyin gyur pa'i //
translated: Compassion accomplishes everything.

original: dge ba bdun po 'di dag gis //
analyzed: dge ba bdun po 'di dag gis //
translated: The seven virtues are the perfections.🔽By these seven virtues, one attains the state of the Lord of the World,

original: shes bya dpag med yul gyur pa'i //🔽'jig rten mgon po nyid thob 'gyur //
analyzed: shes bya dpag med yul gyur pa'i // 'jig rten mgon po nyid thob 'gyur //
translated: who has the domain of the immeasurable object of knowledge.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said,

original: dus bzhin dang ni mthu bzhin du //
analyzed: dus bzhin dang ni mthu bzhin du //
translated: In accordance with the time and in accordance with power,

original: shes rab dran pa sngon 'gro ba //
analyzed: shes rab dran pa sngon 'gro ba //
translated: wisdom and mindfulness precede.

original: zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i dus ji lta ba bzhin dang / rang gi nus pa'i mthu ji lta ba bzhin du kun rdzob dang don dam pa pa'i shes rab rnam pa gnyis dang rjes su dran pa drug bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bas sbyin pa la sogs pa goms par byed pa ste //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i dus ji lta ba bzhin dang / rang gi nus pa'i mthu ji lta ba bzhin du kun rdzob dang don dam pa pa'i shes rab rnam pa gnyis dang rjes su dran pa drug bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bas sbyin pa la sogs pa goms par byed pa ste //
translated: One cultivates generosity and so forth, preceded by the cultivation of the two kinds of wisdom, conventional and ultimate, and of the six recollections, in accordance with the time to train and in accordance with one's own ability.

original: lag bzangs kyis zhus pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: lag bzangs kyis zhus pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: The Subahupariprccha-sutra says:

original: gal te sbyin pa dang / gtong ba dang / rnam par spong ba la slob par mi nus par gyur na 'di ltar so sor yang dag par slob par byed de /
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa dang / gtong ba dang / rnam par spong ba la slob par mi nus par gyur na 'di ltar so sor yang dag par slob par byed de /
translated: If you cannot train in generosity, giving, and renunciation, then you should train in this way:

original: dus dus su cung zad cung zad 'dod pa dang ser sna dang sbyin pas 'jigs pa nyid gdul ba dang / spang ba dang / rnam par spang ba dang / sbyin pa dang / gtong ba dang / rnam par spong ba la bslab pa dang /
analyzed: dus dus su cung zad cung zad 'dod pa dang ser sna dang sbyin pas 'jigs pa nyid gdul ba dang / spang ba dang / rnam par spang ba dang / sbyin pa dang / gtong ba dang / rnam par spong ba la bslab pa dang /
translated: From time to time, you should strive, struggle, and make an effort to subdue, abandon, and completely renounce your miserliness and fear of giving, and to train in generosity, giving, and renunciation.

original: spyad pa dang / mngon par spel bar brtsal ba dang / 'bad pa dang / brtson par bya'o snyam du so sor yang dag par slob par byed do //
analyzed: spyad pa dang / mngon par spel bar brtsal ba dang / 'bad pa dang / brtson par bya'o snyam du so sor yang dag par slob par byed do //
translated: You should strive, struggle, and make an effort to practice and increase them.

original: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po dag la yang rgya cher sbyar ro zhes gsungs pa las khong du chud par bya'o //

translated: The six perfections are taught in order to show that one who wishes to take up the six perfections and practice them, or who wishes to practice them in order to liberate and release all sentient beings, should take up the practice.

original: sems can kun la phan pa'i phyir //

analyzed: sbyin la sogs pa'i ri bo las //

analyzed: byung ba'i chu klung bsod nams dang // dri med dge ba'i chu ldan 'bebs // zhes bya ba ni sems can kun la phan gdags pa'i @134a * //

analyzed: phyir sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa drug po ri bo lta bur gyur pa las byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po chu klung lta bur 'dod pa med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa'i bdag nyid kyi bsod nams nyid dri ma med pa yin la /
translated: In order to benefit all sentient beings, the rivers of the six perfections, which are like water, flow down from the mountains of the six perfections, such as generosity and morality, which are like mountains. The six perfections are the water of merit, which is stainless, because they are by nature free of attachment, aversion and ignorance.

original: sdig pa spong bas dge ba'i chu de lta bu dang ldan pa 'bebs par byed do de'i 'og tu sbyin 'dod pa'i bsam pa ches shas chen po mngon bar 'phel bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: sdig pa spong bas dge ba'i chu de lta bu dang ldan pa 'bebs par byed do de'i 'og tu sbyin 'dod pa'i bsam pa ches shas chen po mngon bar 'phel bar gyur pa na /

analyzed: slong ba kun la dus kun tu //

analyzed: 'gro ba de dang de dag tu //

translated: This verse shows the mastery of intuition, in that it displays the perfect enlightenment of all aspects of all things.

original: chos rnams gzhag pa nyid rtogs shing //

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul pa yis //

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul pa ste //

original: gdul bya gang dang gang la sprul pa gang gis yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / sred med kyi bu la sogs pa'i sprul pa de dag gis phyogs thams cad khyab par byas nas sprul pa de dag las byung ba'i bstan pa rin @137b po che'i char gyis 'jig rten las shin tu 'das pa'i dga' ba bskyed do //
analyzed: gdul bya gang dang gang la sprul pa gang gis yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / sred med kyi bu la sogs pa'i sprul pa de dag gis phyogs thams cad khyab par byas nas sprul pa de dag las byung ba'i bstan pa rin @137b po che'i char gyis 'jig rten las shin tu 'das pa'i dga' ba bskyed do //
translated: By means of emanations as śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, Śakra, Brahmā, world guardians, Maheśvara, Nārāyaṇa, and so on, which are emanations that ripen whomever is to be tamed by whatever emanation, they pervade all directions. From those emanations, the rain of the precious teachings generates the joy of transcending the world.🔽The immeasurable bodies of the three times,🔽the perfect buddha fields,

original: dus gsum tshad med lus nyid dang // sangs rgyas zhing ni phun tshogs dang // 'jig rten khams rnams dpag med rnams //
analyzed: dus gsum tshad med lus nyid dang // sangs rgyas zhing ni phun tshogs dang // 'jig rten khams rnams dpag med rnams //
translated: and the immeasurable world systems

original: 'jig pa dang ni 'chags pa yang //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang ni 'chags pa yang //
translated: are created and destroyed.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams su dpag tu med pa'i lus byin gyis rlob par byed /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams su dpag tu med pa'i lus byin gyis rlob par byed /
translated: In the past, present, and future, they bless immeasurable bodies.

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i zhing rnams yongs su dag par byin gyis rlob par byed do //
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i zhing rnams yongs su dag par byin gyis rlob par byed do //
translated: He blesses impure fields to become pure.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med pa rnams dus su ma phyin par 'jig pa dang 'chags par byin gyis rlob par byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med pa rnams dus su ma phyin par 'jig pa dang 'chags par byin gyis rlob par byed de /
translated: He blesses immeasurable buddha-fields to be destroyed and created at the proper time.

original: 'jig pa rnams ni 'chags par byin gyis rlob par byed do //
analyzed: 'jig pa rnams ni 'chags par byin gyis rlob par byed do //
translated: He blesses those that are being destroyed to be created.

original: rang lus bde bar gshegs zhing du //
analyzed: rang lus bde bar gshegs zhing du //
translated: In his own body as a buddha-field,

original: de yang rang lus bdag nyid du //
analyzed: de yang rang lus bdag nyid du //
translated: and that as his own body,

original: rang gi zhing ni bde gshegs skur //
analyzed: rang gi zhing ni bde gshegs skur //
translated: he blesses his own field as the body of the Buddha,

original: bzhed pa tsam gyis byin gyis rlob //🔽rang gi lus sangs rgyas kyi zhing du byin gyis rlob par byed do //
analyzed: bzhed pa tsam gyis byin gyis rlob // rang gi lus sangs rgyas kyi zhing du byin gyis rlob par byed do //
translated: merely by his wish.🔽He blesses his own body as a buddha-field.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de yang rang gi lus su byin gyis rlob par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de yang rang gi lus su byin gyis rlob par byed do //
translated: He blesses that buddha-field as his own body.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur byin gyis rlob par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur byin gyis rlob par byed do //
translated: He blesses that buddha-field as the body of the Tathāgata.

original: ba spu'i khung dang 'od zer las //
analyzed: ba spu'i khung dang 'od zer las //
translated: From the pores of his skin and from light-rays,

original: nam mkha' las ni rol mo'i sgra //
analyzed: nam mkha' las ni rol mo'i sgra //
translated: from the sky, the sound of music.

original: sprul pa yis ni rab btang nas //
analyzed: sprul pa yis ni rab btang nas //
translated: And by emanations, he sends forth

original: thos na dga' bar 'gyur bas ni //
analyzed: thos na dga' bar 'gyur bas ni //
translated: The sound of his speech, which is delightful to hear,

original: mthar thug par ni khyab par 'gengs //
analyzed: mthar thug par ni khyab par 'gengs //
translated: Pervading, filling, and reaching the limits of the world.

original: ka la pingka'i sgra dbyangs ni //
analyzed: ka la pingka'i sgra dbyangs ni //
translated: With the sound of his speech, which is like the kalaviṅka’s

original: zab cing rgya che sgrogs pa yis //
analyzed: zab cing rgya che sgrogs pa yis //
translated: Deep and far-reaching,

original: 'jig rten rnams ni gsung gis 'gengs //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams ni gsung gis 'gengs //
translated: He fills the worlds with his voice.

original: rang gi lus kyi ba spu'i khung bu dang 'od zer las byung ba'i rnga dag las brdungs pa'am /🔽ma brdungs par nam mkha' las byung pa'am /
analyzed: rang gi lus kyi ba spu'i khung bu dang 'od zer las byung ba'i rnga dag las brdungs pa'am / ma brdungs par nam mkha' las byung pa'am /
translated: The sound of the Buddha’s speech issues from the pores of his body and from light rays.🔽It issues from the sky, either beaten or un-beaten from the drums that arise from the emanations previously mentioned.

original: sprul pa sngar bstan pa dag las nges par byung ba ni thos na yid dga' ba dang khyab par byed cing 'gengs pa dang / mthar thug par byed pas na /
analyzed: sprul pa sngar bstan pa dag las nges par byung ba ni thos na yid dga' ba dang khyab par byed cing 'gengs pa dang / mthar thug par byed pas na /
translated: It is delightful to hear, and it pervades, fills, and reaches the limits of the world.

original: mthar thug pa dang gsal bas na drang ba dang / ka la pingka'i dbyangs snyan pa dang / skye bo thams cad kyis don gzung bar mi nus pa dang / dbyangs chen pos gsung ba dang / khyad par gsung ba'i gsung dag gis so //
analyzed: mthar thug pa dang gsal bas na drang ba dang / ka la pingka'i dbyangs snyan pa dang / skye bo thams cad kyis don gzung bar mi nus pa dang / dbyangs chen pos gsung ba dang / khyad par gsung ba'i gsung dag gis so //
translated: It is direct, because it reaches its goal and is clear; it is the sweet sound of the kalaviṅka; it is not to be grasped by all beings as an object; it is a great sound; and it is a special sound.

original: ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: What does he do?

original: 'jig rten rnams la /🔽mos pa'i dbang dang dbang po bzhin //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams la / mos pa'i dbang dang dbang po bzhin //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to the world

original: zhi ba ro gcig zhi ba dang // gdul bya rnams ni gdul ba'i phyir //
analyzed: zhi ba ro gcig zhi ba dang // gdul bya rnams ni gdul ba'i phyir //
translated: in accordance with their faith and in accordance with their faculties.

original: @138a * // chos 'di rnams ni gsung bar mdzad //
analyzed: @138a * // chos 'di rnams ni gsung bar mdzad //
translated: He teaches the Dharma in order to tame those to be tamed,

original: mos pa'i stobs dang dang pa la sogs pa'i dbang po'i nus pa dang zhi ba nyid ro gcig pa 'di la yod pas zhi bar ro gcig pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa'i stobs dang dang pa la sogs pa'i dbang po'i nus pa dang zhi ba nyid ro gcig pa 'di la yod pas zhi bar ro gcig pa'o //
translated: in accordance with their faith, in accordance with their faculties, and in accordance with their single taste of peace.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad sel ba dang / skal ba dang ldan pa'i skye bo yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir chos rnam pa du mar ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad sel ba dang / skal ba dang ldan pa'i skye bo yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir chos rnam pa du mar ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He teaches the Dharma in many ways in order to eliminate all fears and to ripen those who are fortunate.

original: 'di dag ni rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba ste /
translated: These are the powers of his magical emanations.

original: rab tu byed pa bcu bdun gyis yang dag par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bcu bdun gyis yang dag par bstan pa yin no //
translated: They are taught in the seventeen chapters.

original: de ltar bstan pa'i dbang bcu'i bye brag shes par 'dod pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i dbang bcu'i bye brag shes par 'dod pa rnams kyis /
translated: Those who wish to know the distinctions of the ten powers taught in this way

original: mdo sde dkon mchog sprin las bye brag rgyas pa nges par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde dkon mchog sprin las bye brag rgyas pa nges par shes par bya'o //
translated: should understand them in detail from the Sutra of the Jewel Cloud.

original: de nas gzhan yang mngon par shes pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang mngon par shes pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the superknowledges will be described.🔽The inferior, with latent impressions,

original: dman dang bag la nyal bcas dag / bde dang sdug bsngal sogs dang bcas //
analyzed: dman dang bag la nyal bcas dag / bde dang sdug bsngal sogs dang bcas //
translated: with happiness, suffering, etc.🔽The inferior, middling, superior,

original: dman dang 'bring dang mchog rnams dang // yang dag gya nom sogs de rnams //
analyzed: dman dang 'bring dang mchog rnams dang // yang dag gya nom sogs de rnams //
translated: the pure, the very pure, etc.

original: gang la ji ltar ji srid du //
analyzed: gang la ji ltar ji srid du //
translated: Whatever, wherever, and however

original: lus can rnams kyi sems 'byung ba //
analyzed: lus can rnams kyi sems 'byung ba //
translated: the minds of embodied beings arise,🔽he knows them to be so,

original: de rnams de la de bzhin dang // de snyed mang rnams rig par byed //
analyzed: de rnams de la de bzhin dang // de snyed mang rnams rig par byed //
translated: and many more than that.

original: dman pa ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyams par byas pa'o //
analyzed: dman pa ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyams par byas pa'o //
translated: The inferior is that which is defiled by the passions and the secondary passions.

original: bag la nyal bcas pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / lta ba zhes bya ba'i bag la nyal gyi bag la nyal dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal bcas pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / lta ba zhes bya ba'i bag la nyal gyi bag la nyal dang bcas pa'o //
translated: That with latent impressions is that which is accompanied by the latent impressions of the lust, hatred, folly, pride, and false view that are called latent impressions.

original: dag pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal spangs pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal spangs pa'o //
translated: The pure is that which is free from the latent impressions of the passions.

original: sdug bsngal gsum dang bral ba ni bde ba dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum dang bral ba ni bde ba dang bcas pa'am /
translated: That with happiness is that which is free from the three kinds of suffering.

original: dus de srid pa'i tshor ba bde ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dus de srid pa'i tshor ba bde ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: For that long, there is the experience of pleasure in existence.

original: de las bzlog pa ni sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is associated with pain.

original: gnyi ga'i ngo bo ni sdug bsngal dang bde ba ma yin pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i ngo bo ni sdug bsngal dang bde ba ma yin pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The nature of both is associated with neither pleasure nor pain.

original: dman pa ni shin tu smad pa dang gzhan dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: dman pa ni shin tu smad pa dang gzhan dag kyang ngo //
translated: Inferior is very contemptible and also others.

original: 'bring ni de bas mtho bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'bring ni de bas mtho bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Middling is higher than that.

original: mchog ni dam pa dang mchog dang gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni dam pa dang mchog dang gya nom pa'o //
translated: Supreme is holy, best, and excellent.

original: theg pa gsum la zhugs par gyur pa ni yang dag pa'i gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum la zhugs par gyur pa ni yang dag pa'i gya nom pa'o //
translated: Engaged in the three vehicles is truly excellent.

original: srid pa la mngon par dga' ba ni phyin ci log gi gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa la mngon par dga' ba ni phyin ci log gi gya nom pa'o //
translated: Delighting in existence is distortedly excellent.

original: sems can de rnams yul gang la ji ltar dus ji srid du zhugs pa'i sems chung ngu dang yangs pa dang chen por gtogs pa dang / tshad med pa'i dbye bas sems ji lta bar skye bar gyur pa de thams cad @138b rten dang brten pa'i bye brag dang zhugs par gyur pa'i bye brag mang po dag skad cig la shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can de rnams yul gang la ji ltar dus ji srid du zhugs pa'i sems chung ngu dang yangs pa dang chen por gtogs pa dang / tshad med pa'i dbye bas sems ji lta bar skye bar gyur pa de thams cad @138b rten dang brten pa'i bye brag dang zhugs par gyur pa'i bye brag mang po dag skad cig la shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva knows in a single moment all the various states of mind of sentient beings, whether they are small, large, or immeasurable, and the various objects to which they are directed, the manner in which they are directed, and the length of time during which they are directed.

original: 'dis ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the superknowledge of the knowledge of the minds of others.

original: lha'i mig ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lha'i mig ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The divine eye is twofold:

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba'i yul can dang / gzugs kyi yul can no //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba'i yul can dang / gzugs kyi yul can no //
translated: that which has death and rebirth for its object and that which has form for its object.

original: de la sha'i mig dag pa ni phra mo dang bsgribs pa dang / ring ba dag la thogs pa med par 'jug cing 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs kyi yul can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la sha'i mig dag pa ni phra mo dang bsgribs pa dang / ring ba dag la thogs pa med par 'jug cing 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs kyi yul can zhes bya ste /
translated: The pure fleshly eye is called that which has form for its object because it is unobstructed in its engagement with subtle, obscured, and distant forms.

original: des rig pa de bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: des rig pa de bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate that knowledge, he says:

original: lha dang sprul pa phra mo dang // de las bzlog par gyur pa dag / kun du gzugs ni thams cad kyang //🔽lha yi mig gis de dag mthong //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni lha rnams kyis mi shes so //
analyzed: lha dang sprul pa phra mo dang // de las bzlog par gyur pa dag / kun du gzugs ni thams cad kyang // lha yi mig gis de dag mthong // byang chub sems dpa'i lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni lha rnams kyis mi shes so //
translated: The divine eye of the bodhisattva is not known to the gods.

original: gang yang lha rnams kyi lha'i mig de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gang yang lha rnams kyi lha'i mig de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes te /
translated: Whatever is the divine eye of the gods, that is known to the bodhisattva.

original: lha'i gnas kyi gzugs rnams kyang mthong ngo//
analyzed: lha'i gnas kyi gzugs rnams kyang mthong ngo//
translated: He sees the forms in the divine abodes.

original: sprul pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang dgra bcom pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sprul pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang dgra bcom pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Emanated forms are those of the Tathagatas and Arhats.

original: phra mo ni rdul phra rab la sogs pa'o //🔽de las bzlog pa ni lha la sogs pa las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: phra mo ni rdul phra rab la sogs pa'o // de las bzlog pa ni lha la sogs pa las bzlog pa ste /
translated: Subtle forms are atoms and so on.

original: mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dmyal ba dang / yi dags la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi gnas so //
analyzed: mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dmyal ba dang / yi dags la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi gnas so //
translated: The opposite of those are the human and other abodes of gods, demigods, hell beings, hungry ghosts, and so on.

original: ma sprul pa ni rgyu dang rkyen las yang dag par byung ba'o //
analyzed: ma sprul pa ni rgyu dang rkyen las yang dag par byung ba'o //
translated: Non-emanated forms are those that arise from causes and conditions.

original: rags pa ni lhun po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rags pa ni lhun po la sogs pa ste /
translated: Gross forms are Mount Meru and so on.

original: thams cad kyi 'gro ba thams cad dang lhag ma ma lus pa'i gzugs de dag rnams lha'i mig gis mthong ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi 'gro ba thams cad dang lhag ma ma lus pa'i gzugs de dag rnams lha'i mig gis mthong ste /
translated: The divine eye sees all the forms of all beings and all the remaining forms.

original: gzugs kyi yul can ni lha'i mig ces bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi yul can ni lha'i mig ces bstan to //
translated: The divine eye is taught as the object of form.🔽The divine ear hears the sounds of the gods,

original: lha dang 'phags pa bkod dang sprul //
analyzed: lha dang 'phags pa bkod dang sprul //
translated: the sounds of the noble ones, the sounds of the array, the sounds of emanations,

original: gsal po'i sgra dang mir bcas pa //
analyzed: gsal po'i sgra dang mir bcas pa //
translated: the sounds of the clear, the sounds of humans,

original: ring na gnas dang bzlog pa dag / lha yi rna ba 'di yis thos //
analyzed: ring na gnas dang bzlog pa dag / lha yi rna ba 'di yis thos //
translated: the sounds of the distant, and the sounds of the opposite.

original: lha rnams kyi sgra ni lha yin no //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi sgra ni lha yin no //
translated: The sounds of the gods are the sounds of the gods.

original: nyan thos la sogs pas brjod pa ni 'phags pa'i'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pas brjod pa ni 'phags pa'i'o //
translated: The sounds of the sravakas and so forth are the sounds of the noble ones.

original: 'og min gyi pho brang na bzhugs pa'i rgyal ba rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku las rab tu byung ba'i bkod pa'i sgra ni bkod pa ste /
analyzed: 'og min gyi pho brang na bzhugs pa'i rgyal ba rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku las rab tu byung ba'i bkod pa'i sgra ni bkod pa ste /
translated: The sounds of the array are the sounds that emerge from the body of the Victor Vairocana residing in the Akanistha palace,

original: sdong po bkod pa las bstan to //
analyzed: sdong po bkod pa las bstan to //
translated: as taught in the Gandavyuha.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gsung ni sprul pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gsung ni sprul pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The sounds of the emanations are the speech of the Buddha who fully awakens in Jambudvipa and so forth.

original: gsal ba ni yi ge gsal ba la sogs pa nges pa'i @139a * //
analyzed: gsal ba ni yi ge gsal ba la sogs pa nges pa'i @139a * //
translated: The clear is the clear syllables and so forth.

original: tshig gis gsal ba'o //
analyzed: tshig gis gsal ba'o //
translated: It is clear by means of words.

original: gling bzhi par byung ba ni mi rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gling bzhi par byung ba ni mi rnams kyi'o //
translated: The four continents is the domain of humans.

original: tha mal pa'i rna ba'i dbang po'i lam las 'das pa ni ring ba'o //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i rna ba'i dbang po'i lam las 'das pa ni ring ba'o //
translated: Far is beyond the range of the ordinary ear.

original: mi gsal ba dang nye ba ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: mi gsal ba dang nye ba ni bzlog pa'o //
translated: Near is the opposite of that.

original: de dag thams cad lha'i rna ba'i khams kyis 'dis thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad lha'i rna ba'i khams kyis 'dis thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: All of that is heard by this divine ear.

original: lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa bstan zin to //
translated: The superknowledge of the divine ear has been explained.

original: sngon gyi gnas rnams thams cad de //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rnams thams cad de //
translated: All former abodes

original: sems can rnams dang bdag nyid kyi //
analyzed: sems can rnams dang bdag nyid kyi //
translated: of oneself and of sentient beings,

original: ming dang rigs kyi bye brag rnams //
analyzed: ming dang rigs kyi bye brag rnams //
translated: their names and types,

original: dran zhing gzhan dag gi yang dran //
analyzed: dran zhing gzhan dag gi yang dran //
translated: are remembered, and also those of others.

original: des skye ba gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas skye ba stong phrag du ma'i bar yang rjes su dran te /
analyzed: des skye ba gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas skye ba stong phrag du ma'i bar yang rjes su dran te /
translated: By that, one remembers one life, up to one remembers many thousands of lives.

original: bdag gi ming ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: bdag gi ming ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: My name was such and such.

original: bdag 'di dag tu ni skyes /
analyzed: bdag 'di dag tu ni skyes /
translated: I was born in such and such a place.

original: bdag gi rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: bdag gi rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: My family was such and such.

original: bdag gi tshe'i tshad ni 'di snyed du gnas /
analyzed: bdag gi tshe'i tshad ni 'di snyed du gnas /
translated: My lifespan was such and such.

original: kha zas ni 'di lta bu zhig zos /
analyzed: kha zas ni 'di lta bu zhig zos /
translated: I ate such and such food.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig nyams su myong myong zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig nyams su myong myong zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: lag pa de dag gis gzung ba'i //

analyzed: mang ba dang mchog dang bzang ba dri gang la yod pa de ni rgyas pa mchog bzang dri ste /
translated: Those with many, the best, and good fragrances are the best fragrances.

original: tshad ni ri rab kyi tshad tsam mo //
analyzed: tshad ni ri rab kyi tshad tsam mo //
translated: The size of the offering is the size of Mount Meru.

original: grangs ni gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed de /
analyzed: grangs ni gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed de /
translated: The number is as many as the sands of the Ganges River.

original: dris bkang ba dang / me tog gis bkang ba dag go //
analyzed: dris bkang ba dang / me tog gis bkang ba dag go //
translated: They are filled with incense and filled with flowers.🔽The perfect buddhas, fully enlightened,🔽are the supreme benefactors of the world,

analyzed: rdzogs sangs rnam par sangs rgyas dag /'gro la phan pa byed pa'i mchog / shin tu gus pas mchod par byed //

analyzed: lan cig min par bstod pas bstod //

analyzed: yang dag pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs pas rdzogs sangs dag dang / mi shes pa'i gnyid sangs pas na /

original: sangs rgyas dag la 'gro ba la phan pa byed pa'i thabs kyi smon lam bya bar 'dod pas de'i phyir mchod pa byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dag la 'gro ba la phan pa byed pa'i thabs kyi smon lam bya bar 'dod pas de'i phyir mchod pa byed de /

original: gus pa chen po dang ldan pas /
analyzed: gus pa chen po dang ldan pas /
translated: Endowed with great devotion,

translated: with their emanated bodies they prostrate and so forth, and with their tongues they praise them by continuously expressing their unsurpassed qualities.

analyzed: gzhan yang / rin chen gdugs dang bla re sogs //

original: mu tig dra bas yongs brgyan pa //

original: tshad med rin chen myu gu las //
analyzed: tshad med rin chen myu gu las //

analyzed: mche ba lta bu'i 'od zer 'phro //

analyzed: mthon ka la sogs pa rin po che'i rang bzhin gdugs dang / bla re dang / rgyal mtshan la sogs pa dag la mu tig gi dra bas brgyan pa /
translated: The parasols, canopies, victory banners, and so forth, which are made of jewels such as sapphire, are adorned with pearl nets.

analyzed: tha mal pa'i tshad las shin tu 'das pa / 'od dang bcas pa 'phro ba lta bur gnas pa'i rin po che rnams las /

analyzed: 'od zer nyid myu gu ltar gyur pa ste /

original: de nyid mche ba ltar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid mche ba ltar gyur pa'o //

analyzed: gzhal yas khang gi bsngags pa brjod pa /

analyzed: mu tig phreng ba 'phyang ba dang // rin chen sna tshogs du ma las //

analyzed: sna tshogs las kyis bzo sbyar ba //

analyzed: gang la mu tig phreng ba 'phyang pa'i ngang tshul yod pa de ni mu tig phreng ba 'phyang ba'o //

analyzed: gang la zhe na /

original: mkhas pa legs par bslabs pa des //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyis rnam pa du mas bstan pa rnams /

analyzed: yang dang yang du mnyan nas thos pa rnams ji ltar thos pa bzhin du yi ge lhag chad med pas gzhan dag la ston par byed do //
translated: Having heard it again and again, he teaches it to others, without adding or omitting anything, just as he has heard it.🔽The mother of the supreme beings is the perfection of wisdom,🔽exalted through the power of merit and intuition

analyzed: bskal pa grangs med dpag med pa // bsod nams ye shes stobs kyis 'phags //

analyzed: 'di ni 'di ltar skyes bu mchog / dpag tu med pa'i bskal pa grangs med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi stobs kyis 'phags shing ji srid bstan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni ma'i mchog yin no
translated: The mother of the supreme beings is the perfection of wisdom, exalted through the power of merit and intuition for countless, immeasurable eons, having gone to the other side of the ten perfections of the teachings.

original: // ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: // ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: What does she do?

original: smras pa / rdzogs sangs nyi mar gyur nas ni //
analyzed: smras pa / rdzogs sangs nyi mar gyur nas ni //
translated: Having become the sun of perfect buddhahood,

original: gdul bya'i sems can padma'i mtsho //
analyzed: gdul bya'i sems can padma'i mtsho //
translated: she opens the lotus ponds of disciples

original: bstan pa'i 'od kyis rgyas par byed //
analyzed: bstan pa'i 'od kyis rgyas par byed //
translated: with the light of the teachings.

original: dri ma med pas dri ma @141a * //
analyzed: dri ma med pas dri ma @141a * //
translated: The stainless one makes the stainless

original: sbyong ; / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi pha rol tu song nas 'dod pa tsam gyis byang chub rtogs par mdzad de /
analyzed: sbyong ; / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi pha rol tu song nas 'dod pa tsam gyis byang chub rtogs par mdzad de /
translated: Having gone to the other side of the perfections, he realizes enlightenment merely by wishing.

original: de nas nam 'dod pa na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ri'i rtse mo'i spyod yul na bde bar gshegs pa nyi mar gyur nas gdul bya'i skye bo padmo'i 'byung gnas la mdo sde la sogs pa gsung gi 'od zer rang bzhin dri ma med pa
analyzed: de nas nam 'dod pa na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ri'i rtse mo'i spyod yul na bde bar gshegs pa nyi mar gyur nas gdul bya'i skye bo padmo'i 'byung gnas la mdo sde la sogs pa gsung gi 'od zer rang bzhin dri ma med pa

original: stong gis gdul bya'i yid kyi gti mug sel bar nus pas /
analyzed: stong gis gdul bya'i yid kyi gti mug sel bar nus pas /
translated: he is able to dispel the mental ignorance of the lotus-born beings to be trained.

original: smon lam ji lta ba bzhin du mngon bar sad par byed do //
analyzed: smon lam ji lta ba bzhin du mngon bar sad par byed do //
translated: Thus, he awakens them in accordance with their aspirations.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

analyzed: gangs phreng bsil ba'i 'od zer dang // tsandan pas lhag gsung gi chus / lus can yid kyi nyon mongs mes //

original: rab tu gdungs pa zhi bar byed //
analyzed: rab tu gdungs pa zhi bar byed //
translated: that are tormented by the fire of mental afflictions.

original: gangs la sogs pas zhi bar byas pa'i tsha ba ni rkyen rnyed nas slar yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gangs la sogs pas zhi bar byas pa'i tsha ba ni rkyen rnyed nas slar yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The heat that is pacified by snow, etc., arises again when the conditions are found.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung gi chus shin tu zhi bar byas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i me'i gdung ba ni gtan mi 'byung ba'i chos can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung gi chus shin tu zhi bar byas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i me'i gdung ba ni gtan mi 'byung ba'i chos can du 'gyur te /
translated: The fire of the afflictions, which is calmed by the water of the speech of the Sugata, will never arise again.

original: 'di ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i bye brag yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i bye brag yin no //
translated: This is the distinctive excellence.🔽Moreover, from the time they first generate the thought of enlightenment, they make the vow: “Having crossed over, I will be the means of crossing over those who have not yet crossed over,” and so on.

original: gang yang de dag gis dang po sems bskyed pa nas bzung nas ji ltar bdag rgal nas sems can ma rgal ba rnams bsgral bar bya ba la sogs pa'i smon lam de 'dis smon lam yongs su rdzogs par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang de dag gis dang po sems bskyed pa nas bzung nas ji ltar bdag rgal nas sems can ma rgal ba rnams bsgral bar bya ba la sogs pa'i smon lam de 'dis smon lam yongs su rdzogs par byas pa yin no //
translated: They have fulfilled that vow.

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las bdag nyid rgal te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las bdag nyid rgal te /
translated: They have crossed over the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: skye ba'i 'khor ba'i dpa' klong can //
analyzed: skye ba'i 'khor ba'i dpa' klong can //
translated: The ocean of birth, with its whirlpools of cyclic existence,

original: 'chi ba'i chu srin bcas mtsho las //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i chu srin bcas mtsho las //
translated: and its sea monsters of death,

original: theg pa gsum gyi gru chen gyis //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi gru chen gyis //
translated: with the great ship of the three vehicles,

original: 'di yis skye bo myur du sgrol //
analyzed: 'di yis skye bo myur du sgrol //
translated: they quickly deliver beings.

original: 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad ni yang dang yang du skye zhing 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi rlabs dang / 'chi ba'i chu srin gyis kun nas bskor ba'i 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor nub pa las //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad ni yang dang yang du skye zhing 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi rlabs dang / 'chi ba'i chu srin gyis kun nas bskor ba'i 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor nub pa las //
translated: All these beings are sinking in the ocean of cyclic existence, which is filled with the waves of the various sufferings of birth and cyclic existence and the sea monsters of death.

original: myur du nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang theg pa chen po'i gru bo che dag gis bsgral nas bcings pa med pa'i rnam par grol ba'i gling du 'god par byed do //
analyzed: myur du nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang theg pa chen po'i gru bo che dag gis bsgral nas bcings pa med pa'i rnam par grol ba'i gling du 'god par byed do //
translated: I will quickly rescue them with the great ships of the Hearers’ and Solitary Realizers’ Vehicles and the Great Vehicle and bring them to the island of liberation, which is free from bondage.

original: bdag gi legs bshad chu rgyun gyis /🔽thog med dus kyi 'gro ba rnams //
analyzed: bdag gi legs bshad chu rgyun gyis / thog med dus kyi 'gro ba rnams //
translated: The stream of my good explanations

original: shin tu skom pa sel bar byed //
analyzed: shin tu skom pa sel bar byed //
translated: quenches the thirst of beings from beginningless time

original: yon tan gyis phongs kyang sel byed //
analyzed: yon tan gyis phongs kyang sel byed //
translated: and removes the poverty of good qualities.

original: shin tu yon tan gyis dbul ba'i skye bo sred pa'i dbang du gyur pa la /
analyzed: shin tu yon tan gyis dbul ba'i skye bo sred pa'i dbang du gyur pa la /
translated: To the people who are extremely poor in good qualities and are under the power of craving,

original: des sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dang mthun pa'i legs par @141b bshad pa rin po che rnam pa du ma dag gis srid pa'i sred pa dag rnam par gcod par byed cing dad pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi nor rnams sdud du bcu gnas shin tu dbul
analyzed: des sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dang mthun pa'i legs par @141b bshad pa rin po che rnam pa du ma dag gis srid pa'i sred pa dag rnam par gcod par byed cing dad pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi nor rnams sdud du bcu gnas shin tu dbul
translated: He cuts off the craving for existence with the many jewels of good explanations that accord with the wisdom of the Buddha, and he gathers the wealth of such good qualities as faith.

original: ba sel bar byed do //
analyzed: ba sel bar byed do //
translated: He removes the extreme poverty of the ten grounds.

original: 'dis ni lam mkhan chen po ltar ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni lam mkhan chen po ltar ston pa yin te /
translated: This verse shows the Teacher to be like a great guide.🔽He shows the path to those

original: srid pa'i dgon par lam stor pas ;
analyzed: srid pa'i dgon par lam stor pas ;
translated: who have lost their way in the jungle of existence,🔽who are obscured by ignorance,

original: / ma rig pas bsgribs lam ston byed //
analyzed: / ma rig pas bsgribs lam ston byed //
translated: and who are confused about the path.

original: 'gro rnams shes rab mig phye nas //
analyzed: 'gro rnams shes rab mig phye nas //

original: mya ngan 'das par phyin par byed //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das par phyin par byed //
translated: and leads them to the city of nirvana.

original: rang gi las kyi bdag nyid kyis 'khor ba'i dgon pa tha dad du yongs su 'khor bar gyur cing mi shes pas bsgribs pas lam la mi mkhas pa'i 'gro ba rnams la lam nye bar bstan te /

translated: He shows the path to those beings who are confused about the path, who are ignorant, who are obscured by ignorance, who are wandering in the jungle of cyclic existence through the power of their own karma, and who are unskilled in the path.

analyzed: shes rab kyi mig rnam par phye nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'khrid bar byed do //
translated: Having opened the eye of wisdom, he leads them to the city of nirvana.

original: 'di ni dug gis zin pa la'ang sel ba la mkhas pa'i sman pa bzhin du ston te /
analyzed: 'di ni dug gis zin pa la'ang sel ba la mkhas pa'i sman pa bzhin du ston te /
translated: This is like a doctor skilled in removing poison.

original: nyon mongs sprul gdug mche bas btab //
analyzed: nyon mongs sprul gdug mche bas btab //
translated: The snake of the afflictions bites with its poisonous fangs,

original: rang la phan pa'i thabs las rgyal //
analyzed: rang la phan pa'i thabs las rgyal //
translated: and conquers the means of self-benefit.

original: ye shes sman ni yang dag pa //
analyzed: ye shes sman ni yang dag pa //
translated: The medicine of wisdom is truly

original: rig pa bstan pas 'gro rnams gso //
analyzed: rig pa bstan pas 'gro rnams gso //
