original: 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid kyi sbrul gdug pa'i mche bas btab par gyur pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid kyi sbrul gdug pa'i mche bas btab par gyur pa /
translated: The snake of the afflictions, desire and so on, bites with its poisonous fangs of affliction.

original: rang la phan par bya ba las rgyal zhing ma shes pa'i 'gro ba rnams la stong pa nyid dang ; mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa nyid kyi ye shes nyid ni rig pa yang yin la sman pa yang yin te /
analyzed: rang la phan par bya ba las rgyal zhing ma shes pa'i 'gro ba rnams la stong pa nyid dang ; mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa nyid kyi ye shes nyid ni rig pa yang yin la sman pa yang yin te /
translated: It conquers the means of self-benefit and infects ignorant beings. The medicine of wisdom, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, is truly known.

original: de dag gis de gso bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag gis de gso bar byed do //
translated: It heals by the teaching.

original: 'dis ni de sad par byed pa'i rol mo brdungs pa dang 'dra bar bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni de sad par byed pa'i rol mo brdungs pa dang 'dra bar bstan te /
translated: This is like the beating of a drum to awaken them.

original: srid par mgon med srog chags rnams //
analyzed: srid par mgon med srog chags rnams //
translated: Beings in cyclic existence are without a protector.

original: yun ring gnyid kyis log pa la //
analyzed: yun ring gnyid kyis log pa la //
translated: For a long time they have fallen asleep.🔽Out of compassion, the Buddha awakens them

original: bstan pa rnga yi sgra dag gi / snying rje yis ni sad par byed //
analyzed: bstan pa rnga yi sgra dag gi / snying rje yis ni sad par byed //
translated: with the sound of the drum of the teaching.

original: sad par byed pa'i bdag po med par 'gro ba rnams 'khor ba'i khyim rnams na thog ma med pa nas ma rig pa'i gnyid kyis non par gyur pa la snying rje skyes par gyur pas dam pa'i chos bstan pa'i rnga brdungs pa'i sgras sad par byed do //
analyzed: sad par byed pa'i bdag po med par 'gro ba rnams 'khor ba'i khyim rnams na thog ma med pa nas ma rig pa'i gnyid kyis non par gyur pa la snying rje skyes par gyur pas dam pa'i chos bstan pa'i rnga brdungs pa'i sgras sad par byed do //
translated: Without a master to awaken them, beings in the prison of cyclic existence have been overcome by the sleep of ignorance since beginningless time. Out of compassion, the Buddha awakens them with the sound of the drum of the teaching, which is the teaching of the excellent Dharma.

original: de ltar bdag nyid grol bar byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid grol bar byas nas /
translated: Having thus liberated himself,🔽he liberates those bound

original: yun ring 'khor ba'i btson ra na //🔽sad pa'i lcags sgrog gis bsdams pa //
analyzed: yun ring 'khor ba'i btson ra na // sad pa'i lcags sgrog gis bsdams pa //
translated: in the prison of cyclic existence.

original: bdud bzhi las ni rgyal byas nas //🔽bcings pa las ni grol bar byed //
analyzed: bdud bzhi las ni rgyal byas nas // bcings pa las ni grol bar byed //
translated: Having conquered the four maras,

original: sred pa rnam pa drug gi @142a * //
analyzed: sred pa rnam pa drug gi @142a * //
translated: he liberates those bound by the six existences.

original: lcags sgrog gis yun ring du 'khor bar sems bcings pa'i sems can rnams sred pa'i bcings pa las grol bar byed do //
analyzed: lcags sgrog gis yun ring du 'khor bar sems bcings pa'i sems can rnams sred pa'i bcings pa las grol bar byed do //
translated: The fetters bind sentient beings for a long time in cyclic existence.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni phung po'i bdud las rgyal bar byed do //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni phung po'i bdud las rgyal bar byed do //
translated: The vajra-like samadhi conquers the demon of the aggregates.

original: stong pa nyid kyis ni nyon mongs pa dang / 'chi bdag las rnam par rgyal lo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis ni nyon mongs pa dang / 'chi bdag las rnam par rgyal lo //
translated: Emptiness conquers the demons of afflictions and of the Lord of Death.

original: byams pas ni lha'i bu'i bdud las rgyal bar byed do //
analyzed: byams pas ni lha'i bu'i bdud las rgyal bar byed do //
translated: Loving-kindness conquers the demon of the sons of the gods.🔽Wisdom alone is like nectar, which satisfies.

original: shes rab gcig pu bdud rtsi dang 'dra bar tshim par byed pa yin pas des na /
analyzed: shes rab gcig pu bdud rtsi dang 'dra bar tshim par byed pa yin pas des na /
translated: Therefore,

original: byin za ngoms pa med pa bzhin //
analyzed: byin za ngoms pa med pa bzhin //
translated: like a hungry ghost not being satisfied,

original: lha dang mi yi yul dag gis //🔽shes rab bdud rtsi'i dri bzang pos ;
analyzed: lha dang mi yi yul dag gis // shes rab bdud rtsi'i dri bzang pos ;
translated: the objects of gods and humans

original: / lus can rnams ni tshim par byed //
analyzed: / lus can rnams ni tshim par byed //
translated: are not satisfied by the sweet scent of the nectar of wisdom.

original: ces bya ste /
analyzed: ces bya ste /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: shin tu 'bar bar gyur pa'i me ni ji lta ji ltar shing bsnan par gyur pa de lta de ltar shin tu cher 'bar bar 'gyur gyi zhi bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu 'bar bar gyur pa'i me ni ji lta ji ltar shing bsnan par gyur pa de lta de ltar shin tu cher 'bar bar 'gyur gyi zhi bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as a fire burns more and more intensely the more fuel one puts on it, and does not go out,

original: de bzhin du sems can rnams kyang lha dang mi'i gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams la ji lta ji ltar zhugs pa de lta de ltar sred pa 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can rnams kyang lha dang mi'i gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams la ji lta ji ltar zhugs pa de lta de ltar sred pa 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: so too, the more beings engage with objects such as the forms of gods and humans, the more their craving increases.

original: de dag rnams la 'di'i shes rab kyi bdud rtsi'i ros tshim par byed do //
analyzed: de dag rnams la 'di'i shes rab kyi bdud rtsi'i ros tshim par byed do //
translated: But the Buddha satisfies them with the taste of the nectar of his wisdom.

original: 'dis ni seng ge dang 'dra bar ston te /🔽'khor du stong nyid seng ge yi //
analyzed: 'dis ni seng ge dang 'dra bar ston te / 'khor du stong nyid seng ge yi //
translated: This shows that he is like a lion.🔽The great sound of the lion of emptiness

original: sgra chen sgra ni bsgrags pa yis //🔽gdul dka' mu stegs myos pa ni //
analyzed: sgra chen sgra ni bsgrags pa yis // gdul dka' mu stegs myos pa ni //
translated: in the assembly

original: shes pas myos pa'i nga rgyal sel //
analyzed: shes pas myos pa'i nga rgyal sel //
translated: removes the arrogance of those intoxicated by knowledge,🔽the wild beasts who are difficult to tame.

original: phyin ci log gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi che bar sems pa gzhan sus kyang gdul bar mi nus pa'i mu stegs nyid ni glang chen myos pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi che bar sems pa gzhan sus kyang gdul bar mi nus pa'i mu stegs nyid ni glang chen myos pa ste /
translated: The wild beasts who are difficult to tame are the tīrthikas, who are intoxicated by their own arrogance.

original: mi shes pa yin na yang shes par nga rgyal bas myos pa yin la de bsal ba'i phyir skye bo mang po 'dus pa'i nang du stong pa nyid ni seng ge'i sgra chen po yin la /
analyzed: mi shes pa yin na yang shes par nga rgyal bas myos pa yin la de bsal ba'i phyir skye bo mang po 'dus pa'i nang du stong pa nyid ni seng ge'i sgra chen po yin la /
translated: If one is ignorant, one is intoxicated with pride in one's knowledge. In order to dispel that, in the midst of a great assembly, emptiness is the great lion's roar.

original: der de sgrogs pa ni gang gis mu stegs byed kyi glang po shes pas myos pa sangs bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: der de sgrogs pa ni gang gis mu stegs byed kyi glang po shes pas myos pa sangs bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: In that, it is proclaimed by the Buddha, because it clears away the intoxication of knowledge of the elephant-like tirthikas.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi chos kyi sku bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi chos kyi sku bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of the Dharma Body, which is the nature of the gnosis of perfect buddhahood.

original: da ni longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sku brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sku brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the Bodies characterized by the Complete Enjoyment of the Dharma and by Emanation will be discussed.

original: dbang po chen po'i gzhu 'dra ba //
analyzed: dbang po chen po'i gzhu 'dra ba //
translated: Like the great bow of Indra,

original: 'dom gang 'od kyis kun du bskor //
analyzed: 'dom gang 'od kyis kun du bskor //
translated: Surrounded by light a fathom wide,

original: gzugs gnas 'bar ba yongs rdzogs pa'i //
analyzed: gzugs gnas 'bar ba yongs rdzogs pa'i //
translated: The abode of form, completely blazing,

original: mtshan dang dpe byad rnams kyi dpal //
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad rnams kyi dpal //
translated: The glory of the major and minor marks,

original: @142b dpal nyid rgyan du gyur pa yi //
analyzed: @142b dpal nyid rgyan du gyur pa yi //
translated: The very glory of adornment,

original: yid dang mig ni 'phrog byed pa'i //
analyzed: yid dang mig ni 'phrog byed pa'i //
translated: Stealing the mind and the eyes,

original: gzugs ni mnyam pa'i gzugs med pa //
analyzed: gzugs ni mnyam pa'i gzugs med pa //
translated: His form is equal, not inferior.

original: mdzes pa thams cad zil gyis gnon //🔽legs par spyad pa dpag tu med pa'i bzo brgyas bsgrubs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs kyi sku ni tshon rnam pa sna tshogs kyi phreng bas bris pa'i lha'i bdag po'i gzhu dang 'dra ba'i 'od 'dom gang gis bskor ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i yul las ma
analyzed: mdzes pa thams cad zil gyis gnon // legs par spyad pa dpag tu med pa'i bzo brgyas bsgrubs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs kyi sku ni tshon rnam pa sna tshogs kyi phreng bas bris pa'i lha'i bdag po'i gzhu dang 'dra ba'i 'od 'dom gang gis bskor ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i yul las ma
translated: It outshines all beauty.

original: g-yos pa'i nyams pa med cing mdangs 'bar ba'i mtshan dang dpe byad kyi dpal rnam par 'dzin pa /
analyzed: g-yos pa'i nyams pa med cing mdangs 'bar ba'i mtshan dang dpe byad kyi dpal rnam par 'dzin pa /
translated: The form body of the Bhagavat is accomplished by the hundred arts of immeasurable good conduct. It is like the bow of the lord of the gods, painted with a garland of various colors, surrounded by an armspan of light, and is the glory of the major and minor marks, which are not diminished by movement from the appropriate realm, but blaze with luster.

original: rang gi dpal nyid kyis brgyan par gyur pa /
analyzed: rang gi dpal nyid kyis brgyan par gyur pa /
translated: It is adorned by its own glory.

original: yid dang mig 'phrog pa /
analyzed: yid dang mig 'phrog pa /
translated: It captivates the mind and the eye.

original: dpe med pa'i sku gzhan gyi gzugs thams cad kyis mdzes pa /
analyzed: dpe med pa'i sku gzhan gyi gzugs thams cad kyis mdzes pa /
translated: It is incomparable, and the beauty of all other forms is eclipsed by it.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i ngang tshul can chos kyi sku'i dbang dang sngon gyi smon lam nyid las byung ba'o //
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i ngang tshul can chos kyi sku'i dbang dang sngon gyi smon lam nyid las byung ba'o //
translated: It arises from the power of the Dharma body and from former vows.

original: 'dis ni gzugs kyi sku de dag las yang dag par byung ba de ston te /🔽de yis rnam pa drug cu dang // ldan pa'i gsung dang cho 'phrul dang // bcas pas lha dang lha min mi //🔽la sogs yid ni dga' bar byed /
analyzed: 'dis ni gzugs kyi sku de dag las yang dag par byung ba de ston te / de yis rnam pa drug cu dang // ldan pa'i gsung dang cho 'phrul dang // bcas pas lha dang lha min mi // la sogs yid ni dga' bar byed /
translated: This shows that the enjoyment body arises from those form bodies.🔽The enjoyment body delights the minds of gods, demigods, humans,🔽and so on, with its speech endowed with sixty aspects and its miracles.

original: rdzu 'phrul dang / kun brjod pa dang / rjes su bstan pa dang / ldan pa ni cho 'phrul dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang / kun brjod pa dang / rjes su bstan pa dang / ldan pa ni cho 'phrul dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Endowed with the miracles of manifestation, telling the future, and instruction, it delights the minds of gods, demigods, humans, and so on, with its speech endowed with sixty aspects and its miracles.

original: 'di'i rdzu 'phrul ni khyab pa dang / snyan pa dang / zab pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i rdzu 'phrul ni khyab pa dang / snyan pa dang / zab pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Its miracles are its pervasion, its fame, its profundity, and so on.

original: kun brjod pa ni bu dang / bu mo la sogs pa tshe ring ba la sogs pa ston pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba las 'di dag las 'gro ba drug gi sems can rnams byung bar gyur to //🔽'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun brjod pa ni bu dang / bu mo la sogs pa tshe ring ba la sogs pa ston pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba las 'di dag las 'gro ba drug gi sems can rnams byung bar gyur to // 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Telling the future is the prediction of sons, daughters, and so on, of long life, and so on, and the prediction of good and bad destinies, that sentient beings of the six destinies have arisen from good and bad actions, will arise, and are arising.🔽Instruction is the teaching of the Dharma in order to eliminate the doubts of those who have heard the predictions.

original: dus 'di srid du 'khor bar gnas nas thar pa sgrub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus 'di srid du 'khor bar gnas nas thar pa sgrub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that one should remain in cyclic existence for so long, and then attain liberation.

original: rjes su bstan pa ni yang 'di ni chos so 'di ni chos ma yin pa'o //🔽'di la ni bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa ni yang 'di ni chos so 'di ni chos ma yin pa'o // 'di la ni bslab par bya'o //
translated: This is a dharma, that is not a dharma.

original: 'di la ni bslab par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni bslab par mi bya'o //
translated: This is to be practiced, that is not to be practiced.

original: chos 'di dag ni srid pa sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni srid pa sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: These dharmas are the accompaniments of existence,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as desire, etc.

original: chos 'di dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa ste /
translated: These dharmas are the factors of enlightenment,🔽such as the applications of mindfulness, etc.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dpag tu med pa'i cho 'phrul bstan pa rgyas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dpag tu med pa'i cho 'phrul bstan pa rgyas par rig par bya'o //
translated: The teaching of the immeasurable miracles should be understood in detail.

original: gsung dbyangs rnam pa drug cu dang bcas pa ni gsung dbyangs rnam pa drug cu dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gsung dbyangs rnam pa drug cu dang bcas pa ni gsung dbyangs rnam pa drug cu dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Possessed of sixty melodious voices means endowed with sixty melodious voices.

original: rnam pa drug cu dang ldan pa gang dag ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa drug cu dang ldan pa gang dag ce na /
translated: What are the sixty aspects?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: @143a * // mnyen pa dang / 'jam pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du 'thad pa dang / dag pa dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od gsal ba dang / snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / mnyan par 'os pa dang /
analyzed: @143a * // mnyen pa dang / 'jam pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du 'thad pa dang / dag pa dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od gsal ba dang / snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / mnyan par 'os pa dang /
translated: It is gentle, soft, pleasing, agreeable, pure, stainless, radiant, melodious, and worthy of being listened to.

original: mi tshugs pa dang / snyan pa dang / dul ba dang / mi rtsub pa dang ; mi brlang ba dang / rab tu dul ba dang / rnar snyan pa dang / lus tshim par byed pa dang / sems tshim par byed pa dang / snying dga' bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: mi tshugs pa dang / snyan pa dang / dul ba dang / mi rtsub pa dang ; mi brlang ba dang / rab tu dul ba dang / rnar snyan pa dang / lus tshim par byed pa dang / sems tshim par byed pa dang / snying dga' bar byed pa dang /
translated: It is unobjectionable, pleasant, disciplined, not harsh, not rude, well disciplined, pleasing to the ear, satisfying to the body, satisfying to the mind, and gladdening the heart.

original: dga' ba dang / bde ba skyed pa dang / yongs su gdung ba med pa dang / kun du shes par bya ba dang / rnam par shes par bya ba dang / rnam par gsal ba dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / kun du dga' bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: dga' ba dang / bde ba skyed pa dang / yongs su gdung ba med pa dang / kun du shes par bya ba dang / rnam par shes par bya ba dang / rnam par gsal ba dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / kun du dga' bar byed pa dang /
translated: It produces joy and happiness, is free from torment, is fully understood, is fully cognized, is fully illuminated, is delightful, is fully delightful,🔽and is fully satisfying.

original: kun du shes par byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa dang / rigs pa dang ldan pa dang / 'brel ba dang ldan pa dang / zlos pa'i skyon spangs pa dang / seng ge'i sgra'i shugs dang / glang po che'i nga ro'i sgra dang /
analyzed: kun du shes par byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa dang / rigs pa dang ldan pa dang / 'brel ba dang ldan pa dang / zlos pa'i skyon spangs pa dang / seng ge'i sgra'i shugs dang / glang po che'i nga ro'i sgra dang /
translated: It is a voice that is understood by all, a voice that is cognized by all, a voice that is reasonable, a voice that is connected, a voice that is free of the fault of repetition, a voice that is the power of a lion’s roar, a voice that is the sound of an elephant’s call,

original: 'brug gi dbyangs dang / klu'i dbang po'i dbyangs dang / mi'am ci'i dbyangs dang / rgya mtsho 'khrugs pa'i sgra dang / ka la pingka'i sgra dbyangs dang / tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs dang / shang shang te'u'i sgra dbyangs su sgrog pa dang / lha'i dbang po'i sgra dbyangs ltar snyan pa dang /
analyzed: 'brug gi dbyangs dang / klu'i dbang po'i dbyangs dang / mi'am ci'i dbyangs dang / rgya mtsho 'khrugs pa'i sgra dang / ka la pingka'i sgra dbyangs dang / tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs dang / shang shang te'u'i sgra dbyangs su sgrog pa dang / lha'i dbang po'i sgra dbyangs ltar snyan pa dang /
translated: a voice that is the sound of a dragon, a voice that is the sound of a lord of the nāgas, a voice that is the sound of a kinnara, a voice that is the sound of the ocean in turmoil, a voice that is the sound of the kalaviṅka bird, a voice that is the sound of Brahmā, a voice that is the sound of a peacock, a voice that is as pleasant as the sound of the lord of the gods,

original: rnga'i sgra dang / ma khengs pa dang / mi dma' ba /
analyzed: rnga'i sgra dang / ma khengs pa dang / mi dma' ba /
translated: a voice that is the sound of a drum, a voice that is not arrogant, a voice that is not low,

original: sgra thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa dang / tshi gzur chag pa med pa dang / mtshang ba med pa dang / ma zhum pa dang / mi zhan pa dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / khyab pa dang / phan pa dang / bcas pa dang ;
analyzed: sgra thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa dang / tshi gzur chag pa med pa dang / mtshang ba med pa dang / ma zhum pa dang / mi zhan pa dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / khyab pa dang / phan pa dang / bcas pa dang ;
translated: It is engaged in all sounds, it is not broken, it is not defective, it is not discouraged, it is not weak, it is very joyful, it is pervasive, it is beneficial, it is combined,

original: pha rol pa dang bcas pa dang / sgra thams cad rdzogs pa dang ldan pa dang / dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa dang / ma smad pa dang / mi 'gyur ba dang / ma rtabs  pa dang / 'khor kun la mthun par zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: pha rol pa dang bcas pa dang / sgra thams cad rdzogs pa dang ldan pa dang / dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa dang / ma smad pa dang / mi 'gyur ba dang / ma rtabs  pa dang / 'khor kun la mthun par zhugs pa dang /
translated: it is complete, it is endowed with all sounds, it satisfies all faculties, it is not contemptible, it is unchanging, it is not timid, and it is engaged in all retinues in a harmonious way.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is endowed with the supreme of all aspects.

original: rnam pa drug cu po 'di dag ni gsang ba blo gros kyi mdo las gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa drug cu po 'di dag ni gsang ba blo gros kyi mdo las gsungs so //
translated: These sixty aspects are taught in the Sūtra of Secret Intelligence.

original: de dag nyid kyis /🔽de yis sku dang gsung rnams kyis //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyis / de yis sku dang gsung rnams kyis //
translated: Those very [aspects]🔽are the speech and body

original: yid bzhin nor bu dpag bsam ltar //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu dpag bsam ltar //
translated: of the one who is like a wish-fulfilling gem or a wish-granting tree.🔽By the power of those to be tamed,

original: gdul ba'i dbang gis phyogs kun du //
analyzed: gdul ba'i dbang gis phyogs kun du //
translated: in all directions,

original: sna tshogs bdag po'i gzugs su bsgyur //🔽de ni @143b ji ltar bstan pa'i 'gro ba mos pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ba'i sku dang / ji ltar bstan pa'i gsung dag gis //
analyzed: sna tshogs bdag po'i gzugs su bsgyur // de ni @143b ji ltar bstan pa'i 'gro ba mos pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ba'i sku dang / ji ltar bstan pa'i gsung dag gis //
translated: He transforms himself into the form of Visnu.🔽His body is like a wish-fulfilling gem, fulfilling the wishes of beings to be trained, according to their faith, by means of the teachings.

original: sems can gyi khams kyi mthas gtugs pa la phan pa mngon par sgrub pa'i smon lam gyis ;
analyzed: sems can gyi khams kyi mthas gtugs pa la phan pa mngon par sgrub pa'i smon lam gyis ;
translated: By means of his speech, he accomplishes the welfare of beings to the limits of the realm of beings, through his vow to do so.

original: gdul bya gang dang gang la gzugs gang dang gang gis yongs su smin par 'gyur ba de dag gi ched du 'gro ba ma lus pa la ston pa'i dbang phyug tu gyur pa'i gzugs du ma ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: gdul bya gang dang gang la gzugs gang dang gang gis yongs su smin par 'gyur ba de dag gi ched du 'gro ba ma lus pa la ston pa'i dbang phyug tu gyur pa'i gzugs du ma ston par mdzad do //
translated: For the sake of those to be trained, he manifests many forms in order to bring them to maturity, in whatever form is necessary to do so.

original: de dag de ltar sogs grangs med //
analyzed: de dag de ltar sogs grangs med //
translated: They are thus innumerable,

original: dpag med rmad du byung ba'i gnas /
analyzed: dpag med rmad du byung ba'i gnas /
translated: immeasurable, and a source of marvels.

original: che ba'i bdag nyid mkhas pas lam //
analyzed: che ba'i bdag nyid mkhas pas lam //
translated: The wise one who aspires to greatness

original: 'di la brten nas thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di la brten nas thob par 'gyur //
translated: will attain it by relying on this path.

original: de dag ces bya ba'i sgras ni rab tu byed pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin par ston to //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba'i sgras ni rab tu byed pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin par ston to //
translated: The word “these” indicates the completion of the chapter.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ji ltar bstan pa'i yon tan gyi rnam pa ston to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ji ltar bstan pa'i yon tan gyi rnam pa ston to //
translated: The word “thus” indicates the qualities that have been taught.

original: sogs zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'di ltar bstan pa 'di ni nyung zad cig yin gyi brjod par bya ba ni mang du yod do zhes ston to //
analyzed: sogs zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'di ltar bstan pa 'di ni nyung zad cig yin gyi brjod par bya ba ni mang du yod do zhes ston to //
translated: The word “etc.” indicates that this teaching is only a small part of what should be said.

original: brgya dang stong la sogs pa grangs las 'das pa ni grangs med pa'o //
analyzed: brgya dang stong la sogs pa grangs las 'das pa ni grangs med pa'o //
translated: “Incalculable” means beyond counting, beyond a hundred, a thousand, and so on.

original: mthu chen po nyid kyis na dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: mthu chen po nyid kyis na dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: “Immeasurable” means beyond measure, because of its greatness.

original: yid la ngo mtshar skyed par byed pa ni rmad du byung ba'o //
analyzed: yid la ngo mtshar skyed par byed pa ni rmad du byung ba'o //
translated: “Marvelous” means that which causes the mind to be amazed.

original: 'di'i 'byung gnas ni de'i gnas so //
analyzed: 'di'i 'byung gnas ni de'i gnas so //
translated: “Source” means the place of origin.

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is it?

original: chen por gyur pa'i ngo bo ni che ba'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: chen por gyur pa'i ngo bo ni che ba'i bdag nyid de /
translated: “Greatness” means the nature of greatness.

original: sa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i rim gyis sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i rim gyis sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One attains buddhahood through the stages of realizing the earth and so on.

original: su zhig gis she na /
analyzed: su zhig gis she na /
translated: By whom?

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis shes rab kyis rab tu 'byed pa dang ldan pa'i mkhas pas so //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa gnyis shes rab kyis rab tu 'byed pa dang ldan pa'i mkhas pas so //
translated: The wise are those who are endowed with the discernment of the conventional and the ultimate by means of wisdom.

original: ji lta bu zhe na ;🔽byang chub sems ni mi gtong dang // thub pa'i brtul zhugs yang dag brten //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na ; byang chub sems ni mi gtong dang // thub pa'i brtul zhugs yang dag brten //
translated: What is it like?

original: de nyid shes pa'i tshol ba ni //
analyzed: de nyid shes pa'i tshol ba ni //
translated: The bodhisattva does not abandon the spirit of enlightenment and properly relies on the discipline of the Sage.🔽The seeker of reality

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig ji skad bstan pa'i theg pa chen po'i lam chen po la brten cing gnas nas 'thob po //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig ji skad bstan pa'i theg pa chen po'i lam chen po la brten cing gnas nas 'thob po //
translated: obtains it by relying on and abiding in the path of the Great Vehicle as it is taught in the above verses.

original: grangs med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / rmad du byung ba'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid chen po bstan pa ni mdo sde du ma las snang ste /
analyzed: grangs med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / rmad du byung ba'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid chen po bstan pa ni mdo sde du ma las snang ste /
translated: The teaching of the great nature of immeasurable, uncountable, and marvelous qualities appears in many sūtras.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gzugs kyi sku mtha' dang dbus med pa yongs su dag pa dang / rnyog pa med pa 'gro ba thams cad la gzigs pa mtha' dang dbus la ma chags pa'i spyan dang @144a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gzugs kyi sku mtha' dang dbus med pa yongs su dag pa dang / rnyog pa med pa 'gro ba thams cad la gzigs pa mtha' dang dbus la ma chags pa'i spyan dang @144a * //
translated: The form bodies of the bhagavat buddhas are pure, free of turbidity, and see all migrating beings with eyes that are not attached to the middle or the end.

original: ldan pas chos thams cad mngon par byang chub pa nyid dang / mtha' dang dbung med pa'i snyan rnam par dag pa 'gro ba thams cad kyi sgra rnams bsgribs pa med par rnam par mkhyen pa dang / shangs kyi skye mched mtha' dang dbung med pa sangs rgyas kyi dbang rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brnyes pa dang /🔽ljags kyi mchog mtha' dang dbung med pa ni sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa'i dbyangs dang ldan pa dang / sku'i phrin las kyang mtha' dang dbung med pa nyid de /
analyzed: ldan pas chos thams cad mngon par byang chub pa nyid dang / mtha' dang dbung med pa'i snyan rnam par dag pa 'gro ba thams cad kyi sgra rnams bsgribs pa med par rnam par mkhyen pa dang / shangs kyi skye mched mtha' dang dbung med pa sangs rgyas kyi dbang rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brnyes pa dang / ljags kyi mchog mtha' dang dbung med pa ni sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa'i dbyangs dang ldan pa dang / sku'i phrin las kyang mtha' dang dbung med pa nyid de /
translated: The supreme tongue faculty is free of limits and center and is endowed with a voice that pervades the realms of all sentient beings.🔽The enlightened activity of the body is also free of limits and center.

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa'i sems dang mthun par de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ston par mdzad pa nyid dang / thugs kyi phrin las kyang mtha' dang dbung med pa nyid de /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa'i sems dang mthun par de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ston par mdzad pa nyid dang / thugs kyi phrin las kyang mtha' dang dbung med pa nyid de /
translated: The enlightened body of the tathāgatas manifests in accordance with the minds of all sentient beings without exception.🔽The enlightened activity of the mind is also free of limits and center.

original: chos kyi sku dang tha mi dad par dus gsum la ma chags pa'i rjes su zhugs shing rnam par dag pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba ston pa la sogs pa rnam par 'phrul ba'i cho 'phrul ston pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa'i gnas pa bsgribs pa med pa yang mtha' dang dbung med pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyi sku dang tha mi dad par dus gsum la ma chags pa'i rjes su zhugs shing rnam par dag pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba ston pa la sogs pa rnam par 'phrul ba'i cho 'phrul ston pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa'i gnas pa bsgribs pa med pa yang mtha' dang dbung med pa dang /
translated: They display the miraculous power of the buddhas, such as revealing the appearance of buddhas and so on, and they are the unobscured, infinite, and boundless states of freedom of the buddhas.

original: bsam pa rnam par dag pa la ji lta ba bzhin du mtha' dang dbung med pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rnam par dag pa rnyog pa med pa'i bkod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bsam pa rnam par dag pa la ji lta ba bzhin du mtha' dang dbung med pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rnam par dag pa rnyog pa med pa'i bkod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: Just as their intentions are infinite and boundless, they are able to display the pure and unclouded array of all world systems.

original: snyigs ma dang bral ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du byin gyis brlabs nas ston par mdzad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i bye brag dang smon lam gyis yongs su 'phrul pa dang / ye shes kyi chos yongs su rdzogs pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa dang /
analyzed: snyigs ma dang bral ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du byin gyis brlabs nas ston par mdzad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i bye brag dang smon lam gyis yongs su 'phrul pa dang / ye shes kyi chos yongs su rdzogs pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa dang /
translated: They are able to display the blessing of transforming impure buddha realms into pure ones, the various kinds of bodhisattva conduct, the emanations of aspirations, the complete qualities of wisdom, and the attainment of manifest enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa dang mtha' dang dbung med pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa dang mtha' dang dbung med pa ste /
translated: They are the complete, infinite, and limitless qualities of the buddhas.

original: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' dang dbung med pa bcu yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' dang dbung med pa bcu yin no //
translated: These are the ten infinite and limitless qualities of the buddhas.

original: de bzhin du skad cig ma gcig la sangs rgyas rnams ye shes bcu mngon par sgrub ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig ma gcig la sangs rgyas rnams ye shes bcu mngon par sgrub ste /
translated: In the same way, in a single instant, the buddhas accomplish ten kinds of knowledge.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dus la mi 'da' ba bcu dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa bcu dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs mngon par sgrub pa'i ye shes bcu dang / gzhal du med pa'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid bcu dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dus la mi 'da' ba bcu dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa bcu dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs mngon par sgrub pa'i ye shes bcu dang / gzhal du med pa'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid bcu dang /
translated: The ten ways in which the buddhas never pass beyond the time for anything, the ten ways in which the objects of the buddhas’ experience are inconceivable, the ten ways in which the buddhas accomplish the knowledge of their blessings, the ten ways in which they are included in the immeasurable,

original: shes rab @144b 'chal bas bsnyen par dka' ba che zhing rgyas pa'i chos bcu dang / bdag nyid che ba nyid bcu dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa bcu dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi mdzad pa bcu dang / ye shes rgya mtsho'i rigs pa bcu dang /
analyzed: shes rab @144b 'chal bas bsnyen par dka' ba che zhing rgyas pa'i chos bcu dang / bdag nyid che ba nyid bcu dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa bcu dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi mdzad pa bcu dang / ye shes rgya mtsho'i rigs pa bcu dang /
translated: the ten qualities that are difficult for those with inferior wisdom to approach and that are vast and extensive; the ten greatnesses; the ten utter purities; the ten deeds of the buddhas; the ten kinds of reasoning of the ocean of wisdom;

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'dren pa bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan pa'i sgo mtha' yas pa bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi snying po'i chos bcu dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi ma chags par gnas pa bcu dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi rgyan bcu dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'dren pa bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan pa'i sgo mtha' yas pa bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi snying po'i chos bcu dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi ma chags par gnas pa bcu dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi rgyan bcu dang /
translated: the ten kinds of guidance of the buddhas; the ten kinds of gateways to the buddhas’ teaching of the Dharma; the ten dharmas of the buddhas’ essence; the ten kinds of nonattachment of the buddhas; the ten kinds of adornment of the buddhas;

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dbang phyug la dbang ba bcu dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa bcu dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pa bcu dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi dgongs pa bcu dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi stobs bcu dang /🔽chos kyis phyug pa'i chos bcu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa bcu dang / chos thams cad ma lus par mkhyen pa nyid bcu dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas pa bcu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rjes su dran pa rnam par dag pa bcu dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dbang phyug la dbang ba bcu dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa bcu dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pa bcu dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi dgongs pa bcu dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi stobs bcu dang / chos kyis phyug pa'i chos bcu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa bcu dang / chos thams cad ma lus par mkhyen pa nyid bcu dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas pa bcu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rjes su dran pa rnam par dag pa bcu dang /
translated: the ten masteries of the buddhas, the ten perfections of the buddhas, the ten skillful means of the buddhas, the ten intentions of the buddhas, the ten powers of the buddhas,🔽the ten dharmas of the one rich in Dharma, the ten abodes of the Tathāgata, the ten knowledges of all dharmas without exception, the ten abodes of omniscience, the ten pure recollections of the Tathāgata,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa myur du mthong ba'i chos bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin bcu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par gzhag pa bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa bcu ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa myur du mthong ba'i chos bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin bcu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par gzhag pa bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa bcu ste /
translated: the ten dharmas for quickly seeing the Tathāgata, the ten samādhis of the buddhas, the ten arrangements of the Tathāgata, and the ten liberations of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa sum brgya po 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa bcu pa'i mdo las bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa sum brgya po 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa bcu pa'i mdo las bstan to //
translated: These three hundred unshared qualities of the Buddha are taught in the Sutra on the Ten Stages of the Tathagata.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin no //
translated: They are unshared with sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on.

original: gang yang gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal po dang / dkon mchog sprin dang / sa bcu pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde las /
analyzed: gang yang gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal po dang / dkon mchog sprin dang / sa bcu pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde las /
translated: Also, in the Sutra of the Lord of Dharanis, the Sutra of the Cloud of Jewels, the Sutra of the Ten Stages, and so on,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid nye bar bstan pa rnams khyad par du shes par 'dod na mdo sde de dag nyid kun du blta bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid nye bar bstan pa rnams khyad par du shes par 'dod na mdo sde de dag nyid kun du blta bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: the greatness of the Tathagata is taught. If you want to know the distinctions, you should look at those sutras.

original: dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba las de kho na nyid kyi shes pa tshol ba'i le'u ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba las de kho na nyid kyi shes pa tshol ba'i le'u ste gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the third chapter of the commentary on the Madhyamakahrdaya, called the Illumination of the Middle Way, called the chapter investigating the knowledge of reality.

original: // / de nas de ni nyan thos kyi de kho na nyid rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i skabs kyi /
analyzed: // / de nas de ni nyan thos kyi de kho na nyid rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i skabs kyi /
translated: Now, in the section on the ascertainment of the reality of the sravakas,

original: theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi gsung nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa bzhi ba rtsom par byed de /
analyzed: theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi gsung nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa bzhi ba rtsom par byed de /
translated: The fourth chapter is composed in order to establish the Great Vehicle as the word of the Buddha.🔽The reality of the profound experience of gnosis,

original: @145a * // de ltar rnam par gzhag pa'i bla na med pa'i chos ye shes zab mos nyams su myong ba'i de kho na nyid ni /
analyzed: @145a * // de ltar rnam par gzhag pa'i bla na med pa'i chos ye shes zab mos nyams su myong ba'i de kho na nyid ni /
translated: The unexcelled Dharma so well taught,

original: rtogs par dka' ba'i lugs 'di la //
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba'i lugs 'di la //
translated: Is difficult to understand.

original: rtogs pa'i nus pa chung gyur pa //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i nus pa chung gyur pa //
translated: Those of little power to understand🔽Are frightened by it, and, with inferior aspirations,

original: gnas min skrag pa'i dman mos dag / yang dang yang du rtsod par rtsom //
analyzed: gnas min skrag pa'i dman mos dag / yang dang yang du rtsod par rtsom //
translated: They dispute it again and again.🔽Those who lack the power to enter into this reality, because they lack the means to eliminate the obscurations to omniscience, have little power to understand this system, which seeks to understand reality as it is taught.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba'i thabs yongs su shes pa med pas 'di la 'jug par 'gyur ba'i nus pa chung ba nyid kyis ji ltar bstan pa'i de kho na nyid kyang shes pa tshol ba'i lugs 'di rtogs par dka' ste /🔽'dis phyin par byed pa'am /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba'i thabs yongs su shes pa med pas 'di la 'jug par 'gyur ba'i nus pa chung ba nyid kyis ji ltar bstan pa'i de kho na nyid kyang shes pa tshol ba'i lugs 'di rtogs par dka' ste / 'dis phyin par byed pa'am /
translated: This is because it is difficult to understand.

original: thob par byed pas theg pa ste /
analyzed: thob par byed pas theg pa ste /
translated: The vehicle is that which carries one or that by which one is carried.

original: theg pa chen po'i lam ni lugs zhes bya ba la de rtogs pa'i nus pa med pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i lam ni lugs zhes bya ba la de rtogs pa'i nus pa med pa'o //
translated: The path of the Great Vehicle is called a system.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi stobs rnams nyams par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi stobs rnams nyams par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the powers of faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom are impaired.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i lta ba 'jigs par bya ba'i gnas ma yin la /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i lta ba 'jigs par bya ba'i gnas ma yin la /
translated: The view of nonexistence is not a basis for fear,🔽but this view of annihilation is a basis for fear.

original: chad lta 'di ni 'jigs par bya ba'i gnas yin no zhes nam mkha' 'jigs shing skrag pa bzhin du gyur pa na /
analyzed: chad lta 'di ni 'jigs par bya ba'i gnas yin no zhes nam mkha' 'jigs shing skrag pa bzhin du gyur pa na /
translated: When they become like the sky, fearful and terrified,🔽they do not see anything at all.

original: 'jigs pa med pa gang yang ma mthong zhing dngos por 'dzin pa'i gdon gyis zin pa'i dbang gis sems 'khrug par gyur pa rnams /
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa gang yang ma mthong zhing dngos por 'dzin pa'i gdon gyis zin pa'i dbang gis sems 'khrug par gyur pa rnams /
translated: Because of being seized by the demon of grasping things as real, their minds become disturbed.

original: me khyer gyi 'od kyis nyi ma rjes su dpog pa dang / ba lang gi rmig rjes kyi rjes su zhugs nas rgya mtsho chen po rjes su dpog par byed pa ltar nyan thos kyi theg pa rnams thab cing rgya che ba la mos pa dang bral bas theg pa chen po 'di ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin
analyzed: me khyer gyi 'od kyis nyi ma rjes su dpog pa dang / ba lang gi rmig rjes kyi rjes su zhugs nas rgya mtsho chen po rjes su dpog par byed pa ltar nyan thos kyi theg pa rnams thab cing rgya che ba la mos pa dang bral bas theg pa chen po 'di ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin
translated: Just as the light of a firefly cannot be compared to the light of the sun, or just as the footprint of a cow cannot be used to measure the great ocean, those of the Listeners' Vehicle, who are devoid of interest in the vast and profound, think and conclude that this Great Vehicle was not taught by the Buddha.

original: no snyam sems shing dpog par byed pas 'di la rigs pa yod pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: no snyam sems shing dpog par byed pas 'di la rigs pa yod pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: To prove to them that this is illogical, the following is said:

original: ston pa'i rnam par mi rtog blo //
analyzed: ston pa'i rnam par mi rtog blo //
translated: The Teacher's nonconceptual mind

original: sku la brten pa ma yin te //🔽lus can yin phyir ba rdzi yi //
analyzed: sku la brten pa ma yin te // lus can yin phyir ba rdzi yi //
translated: Is not based on the body.🔽Because it has a body, it is said

original: lus la ji lta ba bzhin zer //
analyzed: lus la ji lta ba bzhin zer //
translated: To be like a cowherd in relation to the body.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes thogs la sems kyi skad cig bcu drug gis rnam par grol ba'i lam thob pa'i ye shes kyi skad cig ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgras bstan te /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes thogs la sems kyi skad cig bcu drug gis rnam par grol ba'i lam thob pa'i ye shes kyi skad cig ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgras bstan te /
translated: The instant of wakefulness that is attained through the sixteen moments of mind that follow the vajralike samadhi is referred to by the word buddha.

original: sde pa thams cad kyi 'dod pa kun dang yang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: sde pa thams cad kyi 'dod pa kun dang yang mi 'gal lo //
translated: and it does not contradict the assertions of any of the schools.

original: yang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ni sangs rgyas nyid du rigs par 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: yang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ni sangs rgyas nyid du rigs par 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is reasonable that non-imagination is Buddhahood,

original: @145b 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i phyir rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no //
analyzed: @145b 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i phyir rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no //
translated: because it is the object of the four noble truths, like the awareness of the pratyekabuddha and so on.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo ni rnam par mi rtog pa yin na yang /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo ni rnam par mi rtog pa yin na yang /
translated: Although non-imagination is non-imagination,🔽it is not reasonable to say that Buddhahood is the body that is the support of the major and minor marks.

original: rten gyi sku mtshan dang dpe byad dang ldan pa yang sangs rgyas nyid yin par brjod pa de ni rigs pa ma yin pa'o zhes zer ba'i phyogs la ci'i phyir lus can yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rten gyi sku mtshan dang dpe byad dang ldan pa yang sangs rgyas nyid yin par brjod pa de ni rigs pa ma yin pa'o zhes zer ba'i phyogs la ci'i phyir lus can yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why? Because it has a body.

original: gang dang gang lus can yin pa de dang de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rten ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dang gang lus can yin pa de dang de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rten ma yin no //
translated: Whatever has a body is not the support of the non-imagination of Buddhahood.

original: dpe ci yod /
analyzed: dpe ci yod /
translated: What is the example?

original: ji ltar ba lang rdzi la sogs pa'i lus bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar ba lang rdzi la sogs pa'i lus bzhin no //
translated: Like the body of a cowherd and so on.

original: 'dis ni sangs rgyas ye shes kyi skad cig ma nyid yin par sems shing /
analyzed: 'dis ni sangs rgyas ye shes kyi skad cig ma nyid yin par sems shing /
translated: This means that Buddhahood is the moment of wisdom.

original: theg pa chen po las rab tu grags pa'i sku gsum du rnam par gzhag pa ni mi 'grub par bstan te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po las rab tu grags pa'i sku gsum du rnam par gzhag pa ni mi 'grub par bstan te /
translated: The three bodies that are renowned in the Mahayana are not established.

original: de ltar gzhan dag 'dod cing sgrogs pa'i gzhan gyi la nga smra ba'i tshig tsam yang bdag la sdig pa sogs par ma gyur cig ces bsams nas slob dpon bdag nyid kyis 'dod pa ma yin pas zer zhes bya ba'i sgra bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan dag 'dod cing sgrogs pa'i gzhan gyi la nga smra ba'i tshig tsam yang bdag la sdig pa sogs par ma gyur cig ces bsams nas slob dpon bdag nyid kyis 'dod pa ma yin pas zer zhes bya ba'i sgra bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, thinking, “May the mere words of others’ assertions and proclamations not become a sin for me,” the master himself taught the words “I say” out of dislike for others’ assertions.

original: gal te theg pa chen po pa 'di skad du /
analyzed: gal te theg pa chen po pa 'di skad du /
translated: If the Mahayanists say,🔽The body of attributes, the mere attributes,🔽the realization of conditions, the realization of nonarising,

original: rtag pa'i sku dang de bzhin chos tsam dang // rkyen rtogs pa dang skye med rtogs pa dang // thams cad rtogs pa bde gshegs byang chub ste //
analyzed: rtag pa'i sku dang de bzhin chos tsam dang // rkyen rtogs pa dang skye med rtogs pa dang // thams cad rtogs pa bde gshegs byang chub ste //
translated: and the realization of everything are the enlightenment of the sugatas.

original: rnam pa lngar ni theg pa mchog las bstan //
analyzed: rnam pa lngar ni theg pa mchog las bstan //
translated: These are taught in the supreme vehicle in five parts.

original: zhes brjod na /
analyzed: zhes brjod na /
translated: If they say that,

original: de dag ni lam gzhan dang gzhan gyis rtogs pa yin pas des na de dag ni gsung rab kyi lugs la mkhas pa ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di ltar /
analyzed: de dag ni lam gzhan dang gzhan gyis rtogs pa yin pas des na de dag ni gsung rab kyi lugs la mkhas pa ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di ltar /
translated: since those are realizations by other paths, they are not learned in the system of the scriptures. Therefore it is said,

original: yang dag lta sogs lam gyis ni //
analyzed: yang dag lta sogs lam gyis ni //
translated: The path of right view and so on

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byang chub cher //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byang chub cher //
translated: is the cause of perfect buddhahood,

original: 'dren byed yang dag rab rtogs byed //
analyzed: 'dren byed yang dag rab rtogs byed //
translated: the great enlightenment of the guides.

original: byang chub yin phyir slob ma'i bzhin //🔽yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i dag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub yin phyir slob ma'i bzhin // yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i dag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: It is enlightenment, like the disciples’ path.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid kyi 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thob par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lung gi rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid kyi 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thob par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lung gi rigs pa yin te /
translated: The eightfold noble path, which has the characteristics of right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration, is the cause of perfect buddhahood.

original: des na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub kyang lam 'dis rab tu rtogs shing nyams su myong ba 'thob bo //
analyzed: des na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub kyang lam 'dis rab tu rtogs shing nyams su myong ba 'thob bo //
translated: This is the reasoning of scripture, because the enlightenment of the transcendent lords is realized and attained by this path.

original: chos thams cad la rab tu @146a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad la rab tu @146a * //
translated: All phenomena are realized🔽through the power of the path.

original: 'byed pas rtogs pa ni byang chub yin te /
analyzed: 'byed pas rtogs pa ni byang chub yin te /
translated: Realization is enlightenment,

original: de'i ngo bo ni byang chub nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni byang chub nyid yin no //
translated: and its nature is enlightenment itself.

original: byang chub nyid yin pa de'i phyir gang dang gang byang chub yin pa de dang de ni lam 'di dag nyid kyis mngon par rtogs par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub nyid yin pa de'i phyir gang dang gang byang chub yin pa de dang de ni lam 'di dag nyid kyis mngon par rtogs par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis ma yin te /
translated: Because it is enlightenment itself, whatever is enlightenment is realized by means of these very paths, not by any other.

original: nyan thos kyi byang chub bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi byang chub bzhin no //
translated: It is like the enlightenment of the sravakas.

original: ji ltar nyan thos kyi byang chub yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'i lam gyis rtogs pa ltar sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos kyi byang chub yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'i lam gyis rtogs pa ltar sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as the enlightenment of the sravakas is realized by the path of right view, etc., so is the enlightenment of the Buddhas.

original: gal te yang lam thun mong ma yin na nyan thos rnams kyi phyogs gcig pa dang / gzhan gyi rkyen gyis shes par 'gyur la bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ni gzhan la rag ma las shing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa ji ltar srid ce na /
analyzed: gal te yang lam thun mong ma yin na nyan thos rnams kyi phyogs gcig pa dang / gzhan gyi rkyen gyis shes par 'gyur la bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ni gzhan la rag ma las shing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa ji ltar srid ce na /
translated: If the path is not common, how is it possible that the enlightenment of the sravakas is known by one part of the path and by the conditions of another, while the enlightenment of the Lord is omniscience not dependent on another?

original: ston pa'i dbang po khyad 'phags pas //
analyzed: ston pa'i dbang po khyad 'phags pas //
translated: The superiority of the Teacher's faculties is due to

original: kun mkhyen ye shes srid pa yin //
analyzed: kun mkhyen ye shes srid pa yin //
translated: The knowledge of the Omniscient One is the state of existence.

original: lam gcig na yang 'dod pa bzhin //
analyzed: lam gcig na yang 'dod pa bzhin //
translated: Even though there is one path, there are four results,

original: 'ga' yis so so yang dag rig / bcom ldan 'das kyi dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po ni shin tu rno ba yin la ;
analyzed: 'ga' yis so so yang dag rig / bcom ldan 'das kyi dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po ni shin tu rno ba yin la ;
translated: because the Blessed One has sharp faculties of faith, etc.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi ni rtul ba yin /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi ni rtul ba yin /
translated: The disciples have dull faculties.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni 'bring po yin te /
