translated: The Blaze of Argument, a commentary on the Heart of the Middle Way

original: theg pa chen po pa yang gang g'a dang / sin dhu dang / pakshu dang / sh'ita zhes bya ba'i chu klung bzhi'i chu la bkrus pa dang 'thungs pa dang der gnas pa'i rim gyis gzungs sngags dang / gsang sngags klags pa dang / bzlas brjod la sogs pa byas pas sdig pa zad cing bsod nams nye bar 'phel ba la sogs pa'i lam gzhan nye bar bstan pa'i phyir rig byed kyi mtha' pa'i lta ba dang 'dra ba nyid de /
analyzed: theg pa chen po pa yang gang g'a dang / sin dhu dang / pakshu dang / sh'ita zhes bya ba'i chu klung bzhi'i chu la bkrus pa dang 'thungs pa dang der gnas pa'i rim gyis gzungs sngags dang / gsang sngags klags pa dang / bzlas brjod la sogs pa byas pas sdig pa zad cing bsod nams nye bar 'phel ba la sogs pa'i lam gzhan nye bar bstan pa'i phyir rig byed kyi mtha' pa'i lta ba dang 'dra ba nyid de /
translated: The Mahayana is similar to the view of the Vedantins because it teaches that the four rivers Ganges, Sindhu, Pakshu, and Shai-ta are the means of purifying the sins of those who bathe in them, drink their water, and live on their banks, and that by reciting and chanting mantras and dharanis on their banks, sins are exhausted and merit increases.

original: de'i phyir na theg pa chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na theg pa chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Mahayana is not the word of the Buddha.

original: chad par lta ba de bzhin du //
analyzed: chad par lta ba de bzhin du //
translated: Likewise, the view of annihilation

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu skur 'debs pas //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu skur 'debs pas //
translated: Denies cause and effect.

original: de'i phyir yang ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang ste /
translated: And for that reason,

original: bdag nyid thams cad thams cad du stong pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir las dang / 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog rnams kyang med pas /🔽las kyang med /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad thams cad du stong pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir las dang / 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog rnams kyang med pas / las kyang med /
translated: Because they accept that everything is empty in every way, they deny the existence of karma, effects, the truths, and the jewels.🔽Thus, they say, “There is no karma,🔽no action,

original: bya ba yang med /🔽'bras bu yang med do zhes 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i sku la skur ba btab @148a * //
analyzed: bya ba yang med / 'bras bu yang med do zhes 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i sku la skur ba btab @148a * //
translated: and no effect.”

original: par gyur pas 'jig rten 'di tsam pa'i lta ba dang / theg pa chen po pa'i grub pa'i mtha' mtshungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: par gyur pas 'jig rten 'di tsam pa'i lta ba dang / theg pa chen po pa'i grub pa'i mtha' mtshungs par 'gyur te /
translated: Since they deny the existence of the body of effects, they come to have a view that is no different from that of the Cārvākas, and their tenets come to resemble those of the Lokāyatas.

original: chad par lta ba po yang med /
analyzed: chad par lta ba po yang med /
translated: They come to believe that there is no one who holds the view of nihilism,

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten 'di yang med /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten 'di yang med /
translated: that there is no such thing as this world,

original: 'jig rten pha rol yang med /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yang med /
translated: that there is no world beyond,

original: legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yang med do zhes bya ba la sogs par mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yang med do zhes bya ba la sogs par mngon par zhen to //
translated: and that there is no ripening of the effects of good and bad actions.

original: gal te 'di kun stong pa na //
analyzed: gal te 'di kun stong pa na //
translated: If all this is empty,

original: skye ba med cing 'gag med pas //
analyzed: skye ba med cing 'gag med pas //
translated: without origin and without cessation,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams //
translated: then the four noble truths

original: dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: It would follow that it is a non-entity.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dbu ma'i rab tu byed pa'i don yang 'dir sbyar bar bya'o //🔽gzhan yang / sde pa bco brgyad khongs su yang //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dbu ma'i rab tu byed pa'i don yang 'dir sbyar bar bya'o // gzhan yang / sde pa bco brgyad khongs su yang //
translated: The meaning of the Madhyamaka treatise should be applied here.🔽Moreover,

original: gtogs pa med pas ma yin nges //🔽theg pa chen po ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gtogs pa med pas ma yin nges // theg pa chen po ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not because it is not included among the eighteen schools.

original: sde pa bco brgyad kyi khongs su ma gtogs pa'i phyir rig byed mtha' pa'i lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni tshad ma nye bar dgod pa yin no //
analyzed: sde pa bco brgyad kyi khongs su ma gtogs pa'i phyir rig byed mtha' pa'i lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni tshad ma nye bar dgod pa yin no //
translated: The Mahāyāna is not the word of the Buddha because it is not included among the eighteen schools, like the Vedānta view. This is the statement of the evidence.

original: yang sde pa bco brgyad po de dag ni gang yin pa de dag gi bye brag ni ji ltar byung zhe na /
analyzed: yang sde pa bco brgyad po de dag ni gang yin pa de dag gi bye brag ni ji ltar byung zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what are those eighteen schools? How did their divisions arise?

original: bdag gi bla ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las 'di ltar rjes su thos te /
analyzed: bdag gi bla ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las 'di ltar rjes su thos te /
translated: I have heard this from my teacher's teacher:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas lo brgya bcu drug lon pa na grong khyer me tog gis rgyas pa zhes bya bar /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas lo brgya bcu drug lon pa na grong khyer me tog gis rgyas pa zhes bya bar /
translated: One hundred and sixteen years after the Blessed Buddha passed into parinirvāṇa, in the city called Puṣpāvatī,

original: rgyal po dharma aa sho ka zhes bya ba rgyal srid byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rgyal po dharma aa sho ka zhes bya ba rgyal srid byed pa'i tshe /
translated: When King Dharmāśoka was ruling,

original: rtsod pa'i chos 'ga' zhig byung ba'i dbang gis /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i chos 'ga' zhig byung ba'i dbang gis /
translated: due to some disputes,

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen chen por gyur to //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen chen por gyur to //
translated: there was a great schism in the saṃgha.

original: des re zhig dang por sde pa gnyis su chad nas gnas te /
analyzed: des re zhig dang por sde pa gnyis su chad nas gnas te /
translated: First, it remained divided into two sects:

original: dge 'dun phal chen po dang gnas brtan pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun phal chen po dang gnas brtan pa'o //
translated: the Mahāsāṃghika and Sthavira.

original: de la dge 'dun phal chen po'i sde yang rim gyis dbye bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: de la dge 'dun phal chen po'i sde yang rim gyis dbye bar gyur pa na /
translated: Then, as the Mahāsāṃghika sect gradually split,

original: rnam pa brgyad du gnas te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad du gnas te / 'di lta ste /
translated: it remained in eight forms:

original: dge 'dun phal chen sde pa dang / tha snyad gcig pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das par smra ba dang / mang du thos pa pa dang / btags par smra ba dang / mchod rten pa dang / shar gyi ri bo pa dang / nub kyi ri bo pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun phal chen sde pa dang / tha snyad gcig pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das par smra ba dang / mang du thos pa pa dang / btags par smra ba dang / mchod rten pa dang / shar gyi ri bo pa dang / nub kyi ri bo pa'o //
translated: 1. Mahāsāṃghika, 2. Ekavyāvahārika, 3. Lokottaravāda, 4. Bahuśrutīya, 5. Prajñaptivāda, 6. Caitika, 7. Pūrvaśaila, 8. Aparaśaila.

original: gnas brtan pa yang rim gyis dbye bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: gnas brtan pa yang rim gyis dbye bar gyur pa na /
translated: And as the Sthavira sect gradually split,

original: rnam pa bcur 'gyur te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcur 'gyur te / 'di lta ste /
translated: it became tenfold:

original: gnas brtan pa nyid la /
analyzed: gnas brtan pa nyid la /
translated: 1. Sthavira itself,🔽2. Sarvāstivāda, 3. Vātsīputrīya, 4. Mahīśāsaka, 5. Dharmaguptaka, 6. Bahuśrutīya, 7. Tāmraśāṭīya, 8. Vibhajyavāda, 9. Kaurukullaka, 10. Saṃkrāntivāda.

original: gangs ri ba zhes kyang brjod pa dang / thams cad yod par smra ba nyid la rnam par phye ste smra ba dang / rgyur @148b smra ba dang / kha cig mu run ta ka pa zhes kyang zer ba dang / gnas ma'i bu dang /🔽chos mchog pa dang / bzang po'i lam pa dang / kun gyis bkur ba la kha cig aa pan ta ka pa yang zer /
analyzed: gangs ri ba zhes kyang brjod pa dang / thams cad yod par smra ba nyid la rnam par phye ste smra ba dang / rgyur @148b smra ba dang / kha cig mu run ta ka pa zhes kyang zer ba dang / gnas ma'i bu dang / chos mchog pa dang / bzang po'i lam pa dang / kun gyis bkur ba la kha cig aa pan ta ka pa yang zer /
translated: and some call them the Mūrāṭas.🔽They are also called the Vātsīputrīyas, the Dharmottarīyas, the Bhadrāyanīyas, and the Saṃmitīyas.🔽Some call them the Apāntakas,🔽some call them the Kaurukullas, the Mahīśāsakas, the Dharmaguptakas, and the Sarvāstivādins.

original: kha cig ni ku ru ku la pa zhes kyang zer ba dang / mang ston pa dang / chos sbas pa dang / char bzangs 'bebs pa zhes bya ba la kha cig ni 'od srungs pha zhes zer ba dang / bla ma pa la kha cig ni 'pho bar smra ba zhes zer ba ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni ku ru ku la pa zhes kyang zer ba dang / mang ston pa dang / chos sbas pa dang / char bzangs 'bebs pa zhes bya ba la kha cig ni 'od srungs pha zhes zer ba dang / bla ma pa la kha cig ni 'pho bar smra ba zhes zer ba ste /
translated: Some call them the Kāśyapīyas and some call them the Uttaraśrāmaṇeras.

original: sde pa bco brgyad kyi dbye ba ni de dag go //
analyzed: sde pa bco brgyad kyi dbye ba ni de dag go //
translated: These are the divisions of the eighteen schools.

original: de la dge 'dun yang yin la phal che ba yin pas dge 'dun phal chen te /
analyzed: de la dge 'dun yang yin la phal che ba yin pas dge 'dun phal chen te /
translated: They are called the Mahāsāṃghikas because they are both saṃgha and mahāsāṃghika.

original: de nye bar ston par byed pa ni dge 'dun phal chen pa'o //
analyzed: de nye bar ston par byed pa ni dge 'dun phal chen pa'o //
translated: They are the Mahāsāṃghikas because they teach that.

original: kha cig ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos thams cad thugs gcig gis rnam par mkhyen cing skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis chos thams cad yongs su mkhyen to zhes tha snyad 'dogs te /
analyzed: kha cig ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos thams cad thugs gcig gis rnam par mkhyen cing skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis chos thams cad yongs su mkhyen to zhes tha snyad 'dogs te /
translated: Some say: The Bhagavān Buddhas know all phenomena with one mind and know all phenomena with the wisdom of one moment.

original: des na tha snyad gcig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na tha snyad gcig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore they are called those who speak of the same thing.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyi 'jig rten pa las sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'das par gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten pa'i chos mi mnga'o zhes smras pas ni 'jig rten las 'das par smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyi 'jig rten pa las sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'das par gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten pa'i chos mi mnga'o zhes smras pas ni 'jig rten las 'das par smra ba'o //
translated: Since the Bhagavān Buddhas transcend the world in all worlds, they say the Tathāgata does not possess worldly dharmas.

original: mang du thos pa'i slob dpon gyi rjes su ston par byed pas na mang du thos par smra ba'o //
analyzed: mang du thos pa'i slob dpon gyi rjes su ston par byed pas na mang du thos par smra ba'o //
translated: Since they teach the instructions of a master of much hearing, they are called those who speak of much hearing.

original: 'dus byas rnams phan tshun btags pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes smra ba'i phyir btags par smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams phan tshun btags pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes smra ba'i phyir btags par smra ba'o //
translated: Since they say that conditioned phenomena are suffering due to mutual imputation, they are called those who speak of imputation.

original: mchod rten can gyi ri la gnas bcas pa nyid ni mchod rten pa'o //
analyzed: mchod rten can gyi ri la gnas bcas pa nyid ni mchod rten pa'o //
translated: The Sthaviravādins are so called because they lived on a mountain with a stūpa.

original: shar gyi ri dang nub kyi ri la gnas pa nyid ni shar gyi ri bo pa dang / nub kyi ri bo pa'o //
analyzed: shar gyi ri dang nub kyi ri la gnas pa nyid ni shar gyi ri bo pa dang / nub kyi ri bo pa'o //
translated: The Pūrvaśailas and Aparaśailas are so called because they lived on the eastern and western mountains.

original: gnas brtan 'phags pa'i rigs yin par ston pa ni gnas brtan pa'o //🔽de nyid la gang ri ba zhes kyang zer te /
analyzed: gnas brtan 'phags pa'i rigs yin par ston pa ni gnas brtan pa'o // de nyid la gang ri ba zhes kyang zer te /
translated: The Sthaviravādins are so called because they are the lineage of the noble elders.

original: gangs kyi ri la brten nas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gangs kyi ri la brten nas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are also called Haimavata because they live in the Himalayas.

original: gang chung zhig 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad yod do zhes smra ba'i phyir thams cad yod par smra ba'o //
analyzed: gang chung zhig 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad yod do zhes smra ba'i phyir thams cad yod par smra ba'o //
translated: They are called Sarvāstivādins because they say that all exists, that is, past, future, and present.

original: de dag nyid las 'ga' zhig ni yod de /
analyzed: de dag nyid las 'ga' zhig ni yod de /
translated: They are called Vibhajyavādins because they say that some of those things exist and some do not.

original: 'das pa'i las 'bras bu ma byung ba nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i las 'bras bu ma byung ba nyid yin pa'o //
translated: They say that past karma that has not yet issued a result exists.

original: la la ni med de /
analyzed: la la ni med de /
translated: They say that some things do not exist,

original: gang 'bras bu myong zin pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dag go zhes rnam par phye nas smra bar byed pa'i phyir de nyid la rnam par phye ste smra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'bras bu myong zin pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dag go zhes rnam par phye nas smra bar byed pa'i phyir de nyid la rnam par phye ste smra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: such as the results of karma that has already issued a result and future results.

original: de dag @149a * //
analyzed: de dag @149a * //
translated: The first of these is the one that is the basis of the other two.🔽

original: nyid las gang cung zhig byung ba dang 'byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba de thams cad ni rgyu dang bcas pa'o zhes smra bas rgyur smra ba'o //
analyzed: nyid las gang cung zhig byung ba dang 'byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba de thams cad ni rgyu dang bcas pa'o zhes smra bas rgyur smra ba'o //
translated: They are called “the reasoners” because they say that whatever arises, is arising, or will arise from them is caused.

original: de rnams nyid las kha cig mu run ta'i ri la gnas pa'i phyir mu run ta ka pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams nyid las kha cig mu run ta'i ri la gnas pa'i phyir mu run ta ka pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Some of them are called “the mountain cow” because they live on Mount Muruntaka.

original: gnas pa'i rigs nyid kyi bud med ni gnas ma yin la de las skyes pa'i bu ni gnas ma'i bu ste /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rigs nyid kyi bud med ni gnas ma yin la de las skyes pa'i bu ni gnas ma'i bu ste /
translated: The son of a woman who is not a proper wife is a son of an improper wife.

original: de'i rigs yin par ston pa ni gnas ma'i bu'o //
analyzed: de'i rigs yin par ston pa ni gnas ma'i bu'o //
translated: The school that teaches that is the school of the sons of improper wives.

original: slob dpon chos mchog gis rjes su ston par byed pa ni chos mchog pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon chos mchog gis rjes su ston par byed pa ni chos mchog pa'o //
translated: The school that teaches the doctrines of the master Parśva is the school of Parśva.

original: bzang po'i lam pa'i slob ma ni bzang po'i lam pa'o //
analyzed: bzang po'i lam pa'i slob ma ni bzang po'i lam pa'o //
translated: The school of the disciples of Bṛhaspati is the school of Bṛhaspati.

original: kun gyis bkur ba'i slob dpon gyi lugs ston par byed pa ni kun gyis bkur ba'o //
analyzed: kun gyis bkur ba'i slob dpon gyi lugs ston par byed pa ni kun gyis bkur ba'o //
translated: The school that teaches the doctrines of the master revered by all is the school revered by all.

original: de nyid las aa pan ta'i grong khyer du yang dag par bsdu ba byas pa'i phyir aa pan ta ka pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid las aa pan ta'i grong khyer du yang dag par bsdu ba byas pa'i phyir aa pan ta ka pa'o //
translated: The school that compiled the scriptures in the city of Avantaka is the school of Avantaka.

original: kha cig ku ru ku la'i ri la gnas pa'i phyir ku ru ku la pa'o //🔽sa su'i skad kyi dbyings las rjes su ston du bsgyur te /
analyzed: kha cig ku ru ku la'i ri la gnas pa'i phyir ku ru ku la pa'o // sa su'i skad kyi dbyings las rjes su ston du bsgyur te /
translated: Some are called Kurukullas because they dwell on the Kurukulla mountain.🔽Some are called Mahavibhāṣikas because they teach in the language of the Mahāvibhāṣā.

original: skye bo'i tshogs chen po la yang srid par mi 'byung bar rjes su ston par byed pa ni mang ston pa'o //🔽slob dpon chos sbas kyi yin par smra ba ni chos sbas pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo'i tshogs chen po la yang srid par mi 'byung bar rjes su ston par byed pa ni mang ston pa'o // slob dpon chos sbas kyi yin par smra ba ni chos sbas pa'o //
translated: Some are called Mahīśāsakas because they teach that a great multitude of beings will not be reborn.🔽Some are called Dharmaguptakas because they claim to be the followers of the master Dharmagupta.🔽Some are called Vātsīputrīyas because they claim to be the followers of the master Vātsīputra.🔽Some are called Mahīśāsakas because they claim to be the followers of the master Pūrṇa.

original: rab tu bsngags pa'i dam pa'i chos kyi char 'bebs par byed pas na char bzangs 'bebs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu bsngags pa'i dam pa'i chos kyi char 'bebs par byed pas na char bzangs 'bebs pa'o //
translated: Some are called Vātsīputrīyas because they claim to be the followers of the master Vātsīputra.

original: de nyid slob dpon 'od srungs kyi yin par smra ba ni 'od srungs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid slob dpon 'od srungs kyi yin par smra ba ni 'od srungs pa'o //
translated: Some are called Saṃmitīyas because they claim to be the followers of the master Saṃmitīya.🔽Some are called Sarvāstivādins because they claim to be the followers of the master Kātyāyanīputra.🔽Some are called Vātsīputrīyas because they claim to be the followers of the master Vātsīputra.🔽Some are called Mahīśāsakas because they claim to be the followers of the master Pūrṇa.🔽Some are called Vātsīputrīyas because they claim to be the followers of the master Vātsīputra.

original: de bzhin du bla ma pa'i yin par smra ba ni bla ma pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bla ma pa'i yin par smra ba ni bla ma pa'o //
translated: Some are called Saṃmitīyas because they claim to be the followers of the master Saṃmitīya.🔽Some are called Sarvāstivādins because they claim to be the followers of the master Kātyāyanīputra.🔽Some are called Vātsīputrīyas because they claim to be the followers of the master Vātsīputra.🔽Some are called Mahīśāsakas because they claim to be the followers of the master Pūrṇa.🔽Some are called Vātsīputrīyas because they claim to be the followers of the master Vātsīputra.🔽Some are called Saṃmitīyas because they claim to be the followers of the master Saṃmitīya.🔽Some are called Sarvāstivādins because they claim to be the followers of the master Kātyāyanīputra.🔽Some are called Vātsīputrīyas because they claim to be the followers of the master Vātsīputra.

original: de nyid las kha cig na re 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol tu gang zag 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhes smra ba ni 'pho bar smra ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid las kha cig na re 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol tu gang zag 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhes smra ba ni 'pho bar smra ba'o //
translated: Some

original: de rnams las sngar bstan pa'i dge 'dun phal chen la sogs pa brgyad dang / phyis bstan pa'i gnas brtan pa dang / thams cad yod par smra ba dang / thams cad pa dang / chos mchog pa dang / 'od srungs pa rnams ni bdag med par smra ba yin te /
analyzed: de rnams las sngar bstan pa'i dge 'dun phal chen la sogs pa brgyad dang / phyis bstan pa'i gnas brtan pa dang / thams cad yod par smra ba dang / thams cad pa dang / chos mchog pa dang / 'od srungs pa rnams ni bdag med par smra ba yin te /
translated: Among these, the eight schools taught previously, such as the Mahāsāṃghika, and the schools taught later, such as the Sthavira, Sarvāstivāda, Sarvâstivāda, Kāśyapīya, and Mahīśāsaka, are proponents of selflessness.

original: mu stegs pa'i 'dod pas btags pa'i bdag dang bdag gi dag ni stong pa yin pa dang / chos thams cad ni bdag med pa yin par smra ba'o //
analyzed: mu stegs pa'i 'dod pas btags pa'i bdag dang bdag gi dag ni stong pa yin pa dang / chos thams cad ni bdag med pa yin par smra ba'o //
translated: They say that the self and entities connected to the self imputed by the assertions of tīrthikas are empty and that all phenomena are selfless.

original: lhag ma gnas ma'i bu la sogs pa sde pa lnga'i gang zag tu smra ba yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma gnas ma'i bu la sogs pa sde pa lnga'i gang zag tu smra ba yin te /
translated: The remaining five schools, such as the Vātsīputrīya, are proponents of the person.

original: gang zag ni phung po dag las de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa rnam par shes pa drug gis shes par bya ba 'khor bar @149b gyur pa yongs su gsal bar gyur pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang zag ni phung po dag las de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa rnam par shes pa drug gis shes par bya ba 'khor bar @149b gyur pa yongs su gsal bar gyur pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that the person is not expressible as the same as or different from the aggregates, is known by the six consciousnesses, transmigrates in saṃsāra, and is fully evident.

original: de dag ni sde pa bco brgyad kyi dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni sde pa bco brgyad kyi dbye ba yin no //
translated: These are the divisions of the eighteen schools.

original: gzhan nyid kyis smra ba ni gzhi ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyis smra ba ni gzhi ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The other schools are the Sthaviras, Mahāsāṃghikas, and Vibhajyavādins.

original: rtsa ba'i dbye ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i dbye ba ni gsum ste /
translated: The Sthaviras are of three types:

original: 'di ltar gnas brtan pa dang / dge 'dun phal chen pa dang / rnam par phye ste smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas brtan pa dang / dge 'dun phal chen pa dang / rnam par phye ste smra ba'o //
translated: Sthaviras, Mahāsāṃghikas, and Vibhajyavādins.

original: de la gnas brtan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gnas brtan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The Sthaviras are of two types:

original: thams cad yod par smra ba dang / gnas ma bu'i sde pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba dang / gnas ma bu'i sde pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Sarvāstivādins and Vātsīputrīyas.

original: yang thams cad yod par smra ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang thams cad yod par smra ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The Sarvāstivādins are of two types:

original: thams cad yod par smra ba dang / mdo sde smra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba dang / mdo sde smra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Sarvāstivādins and Sautrāntikas.

original: gnas ma bu yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gnas ma bu yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The Vātsīputrīyas are of four types:

original: mang pos bkur ba dang / chos mchog pa dang / bzang po'i lam pa dang / grong khyer drug pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mang pos bkur ba dang / chos mchog pa dang / bzang po'i lam pa dang / grong khyer drug pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Saṃmatīyas, Dharmottarīyas, Bhadrayāṇikas, and Kaurukullas.

original: de ltar na gnas brtan pa ni rnam pa drug tu gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar na gnas brtan pa ni rnam pa drug tu gnas so //
translated: Thus the Sthaviras are of six types.

original: yang dge 'dun phal chen sde ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: yang dge 'dun phal chen sde ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: The Mahāsāṃghikas are of eight types:

original: dge 'dun phal chen pa dang / shar gyi ri bo pa dang / nub kyi ri bo pa dang / rgyal po'i ri ba dang / gangs ri ba dang / mchod rten pa dang / don grub pa dang / ba lang gnas pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun phal chen pa dang / shar gyi ri bo pa dang / nub kyi ri bo pa dang / rgyal po'i ri ba dang / gangs ri ba dang / mchod rten pa dang / don grub pa dang / ba lang gnas pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Mahāsāṃghika, Pūrvaśaila, Aparaśaila, Rājagiriya, Siddhārthika, Caitika, Vātsīputrīya, and Kaurukullaka.

original: de ltar de dag ni dge 'dun phal chen gyi dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni dge 'dun phal chen gyi dbye ba yin no //
translated: Thus, these are the divisions of the Mahāsāṃghika.

original: rnam par phye ste smra ba yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam par phye ste smra ba yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The Vibhajyavādins are of four types:

original: sa ston pa dang / 'od srungs pa dang / chos sbas pa dang / gos dmar po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa ston pa dang / 'od srungs pa dang / chos sbas pa dang / gos dmar po zhes bya'o //
translated: Mahīśāsaka, Kāśyapīya, Dharmaguptaka, and Tāmraśāṭīya.

original: de ltar 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i sde pa rnams rnam par dbye nas rnam pa bco brgyad du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i sde pa rnams rnam par dbye nas rnam pa bco brgyad du gyur pa'o //
translated: Thus, the noble schools are divided into eighteen.

original: yang gzhan dag ni 'di skad smra ste /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag ni 'di skad smra ste /
translated: Others say:

original: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nas bzung nas lo brgya sum cu rtsa bdun lon pa na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nas bzung nas lo brgya sum cu rtsa bdun lon pa na /
translated: One hundred thirty-seven years after the Bhagavat’s parinirvāṇa,

original: rgyal po dga' bod pa padma chen po zhes bya bas grong khyer p'a ta la pu tra'i nang du sdud pa la sogs pa'i 'phags pa la ni yang len pa med pa na bsil ba'i dngos po thob par gyur pa na /
analyzed: rgyal po dga' bod pa padma chen po zhes bya bas grong khyer p'a ta la pu tra'i nang du sdud pa la sogs pa'i 'phags pa la ni yang len pa med pa na bsil ba'i dngos po thob par gyur pa na /
translated: in the city of Pāṭaliputra, the noble Saṅgha, who had attained the state of coolness,🔽such as the noble Mahākāśyapa, the noble Mahāloma, Mahātyāga, Guru, Repaṭa, and so forth, who were arhats with the correct discriminations,🔽when they were dwelling in that way, the evil Māra, who is the adversary of all that is good, taking on the appearance of a monk,

original: 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po dang / 'phags pa spu chen po dang / gtong ba chen po dang / bla ma dang / re pa ta la sogs pa so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa'i dgra bcom pa'i dge 'dun de ltar bzhugs pa na bdud sdig can bzang po thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dge slong gi cha byad 'dzin pas rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs
analyzed: 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po dang / 'phags pa spu chen po dang / gtong ba chen po dang / bla ma dang / re pa ta la sogs pa so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa'i dgra bcom pa'i dge 'dun de ltar bzhugs pa na bdud sdig can bzang po thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dge slong gi cha byad 'dzin pas rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs
translated: displayed various miracles,

original: bstan nas / gzhi lngas dge 'dun gyi dbyen chen po bskyed de gnas brtan klu zhes @150a * //
analyzed: bstan nas / gzhi lngas dge 'dun gyi dbyen chen po bskyed de gnas brtan klu zhes @150a * //
translated: and created a great schism in the Saṅgha with five bases. The elders called Nāga

original: bya ba dang / yid brtan pa zhes bya ba mang du thos pa dag gis gzhi lnga bsngags par byed /
analyzed: bya ba dang / yid brtan pa zhes bya ba mang du thos pa dag gis gzhi lnga bsngags par byed /
translated: and Śraddhā, who were very learned, praised the five bases.

original: rjes su ston par byed cing de gzhan la lan gdab pa dang / mi shes pa dang / yid gnyis dang / yongs su brtag pa dang / bdag nyid gso bar byed pa ni lam yin te /
analyzed: rjes su ston par byed cing de gzhan la lan gdab pa dang / mi shes pa dang / yid gnyis dang / yongs su brtag pa dang / bdag nyid gso bar byed pa ni lam yin te /
translated: The path is that which teaches, that which answers others, that which is unknown, that which is doubtful, that which is investigated, and that which is cured.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yin zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yin zhes zer ro //
translated: This is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: des na sde pa gnyis su chad nas gnas te /
analyzed: des na sde pa gnyis su chad nas gnas te /
translated: Thus, the Sangha split into two groups.

original: gnas brtan pa dang / dge 'dun phal chen sde zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan pa dang / dge 'dun phal chen sde zhes bya'o //
translated: They were called the Sthaviras and the Mahāsāṃghikas.

original: de ltar lo drug cu rtsa gsum gyi bar du dge 'dun bye nas 'khrug long gis gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar lo drug cu rtsa gsum gyi bar du dge 'dun bye nas 'khrug long gis gnas so //
translated: Thus, for sixty-three years the Sangha was divided and remained in turmoil.

original: de nas lo brgya phrag gnyis pa 'das pa'i rjes la gnas brtan gnas ma'i bus bstan pa yang dag par bsdus so //
analyzed: de nas lo brgya phrag gnyis pa 'das pa'i rjes la gnas brtan gnas ma'i bus bstan pa yang dag par bsdus so //
translated: Then, two hundred years after the Buddha’s passing, the elder Vṛjiputra gathered the community.

original: des yang dag par bsdus pa na dge 'dun phal chen yang rnam pa gnyis su byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: des yang dag par bsdus pa na dge 'dun phal chen yang rnam pa gnyis su byung bar gyur to //
translated: When he gathered the community, the Mahāsāṃghikas split into two groups.

original: tha snyad pa dang ba lang gnas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha snyad pa dang ba lang gnas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They were called the Ekavyāvahārikas and the Gokulika.

original: de la tha snyad pa rnams kyi dam tshig gi rtsa ba ni /
analyzed: de la tha snyad pa rnams kyi dam tshig gi rtsa ba ni /
translated: The root of the Ekavyāvahārikas’ discipline was:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are beyond the world.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten gyi chos ni mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten gyi chos ni mi mnga'o //
translated: The Tathagatas do not have the worldly dharmas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i rjes su gsung ni mi 'jug go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i rjes su gsung ni mi 'jug go //
translated: The speech of all the Tathagatas does not engage in turning the wheel of Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung ni snying po la mngon par mos pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung ni snying po la mngon par mos pa'o //
translated: The speech of all the Tathagatas is resolute in the essence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la gnas der gzugs nye bar len pa ni mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la gnas der gzugs nye bar len pa ni mi mnga'o //
translated: The Tathagata does not have the appropriation of form in that place.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dus na nur nur po dang mer mer po dang ltar ltar pos 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dus na nur nur po dang mer mer po dang ltar ltar pos 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: At the time of being a Bodhisattva, he does not enter through the stages of kalala, arbuda, and peśin.

original: glang po cher gyur nas yum gyi sku nas zhugs nas rang nyid nges par 'byung ba yin gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'dod pa'i 'du shes ni mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: glang po cher gyur nas yum gyi sku nas zhugs nas rang nyid nges par 'byung ba yin gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'dod pa'i 'du shes ni mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Having become an elephant, he enters his mother's womb and himself emerges, but for Bodhisattvas the perception of desire does not arise.

original: ngan 'gro rnams su bdag nyid kyi 'dod pas skye ba blangs te /
analyzed: ngan 'gro rnams su bdag nyid kyi 'dod pas skye ba blangs te /
translated: He takes birth in the lower realms by his own desire.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: He ripens beings.

original: ye shes gcig gis bden pa bzhi rnams yongs su shes so //
analyzed: ye shes gcig gis bden pa bzhi rnams yongs su shes so //
translated: By a single knowledge, he knows the four noble truths.

original: rnam par shes pa drug po rnams ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba yang yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug po rnams ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba yang yin no //
translated: The six consciousnesses are sometimes associated with attachment and sometimes disassociated from attachment.

original: mig gis ni gzugs rnams mthong ngo //
analyzed: mig gis ni gzugs rnams mthong ngo //
translated: The eye sees visible forms.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams kyang gzhan dag gis bstan pa sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams kyang gzhan dag gis bstan pa sgrub par byed do //
translated: The arhats also practice the teaching of others.

original: mi shes pa dang yid gnyis dang yongs su brtag pa dang sdug bsngal spong ba'i @150b lam yang yod do //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang yid gnyis dang yongs su brtag pa dang sdug bsngal spong ba'i @150b lam yang yod do //
translated: There is a path for the abandonment of ignorance, doubt, and investigation, and of suffering.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i tshe dag 'jug par byed pa yang yod do //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i tshe dag 'jug par byed pa yang yod do //
translated: There is a path for the entry into concentration.

original: mi gtsang ba spang ba yang yod do //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba spang ba yang yod do //
translated: There is a path for the abandonment of impurity.

original: yang dag par sdom pa mngon du byas pa nyid kyis kun du sbyor ba thams cad rab tu spangs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sdom pa mngon du byas pa nyid kyis kun du sbyor ba thams cad rab tu spangs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that the abandonment of all the fetters is due to the realization of perfect restraint.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ni mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ni mi mnga'o //
translated: The Tathāgatas do not have mundane right views.

original: sems ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin pas bag la nyal ba rnams sems dang mtshungs par ldan zhe'am /
analyzed: sems ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin pas bag la nyal ba rnams sems dang mtshungs par ldan zhe'am /
translated: Since the mind is naturally luminous, latent states are concomitant with the mind.🔽

original: mi ldan zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi ldan zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Since the mind is luminous by nature, it should not be said that the latent afflictions are associated with the mind or not associated with the mind.

original: bag la nyal yang gzhan la kun nas ldang ba yang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: bag la nyal yang gzhan la kun nas ldang ba yang gzhan yin no //
translated: The latent afflictions are not different from the mind, nor are they different from the manifest afflictions.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni med do //
translated: The past and future do not exist.🔽The stream-enterer attains the meditative absorptions.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa ni bsam gtan thob pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu rnams ni tha snyad gcig pa rnams kyi dam tshig yin no //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa ni bsam gtan thob pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu rnams ni tha snyad gcig pa rnams kyi dam tshig yin no //
translated: Such are the commitments of those who use the same terminology.

original: yang ba lang gnas pa rnams kyi dbye ba ni mang du thos pa dang btags par smra ba pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang ba lang gnas pa rnams kyi dbye ba ni mang du thos pa dang btags par smra ba pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The divisions of the Bahir-charanas are the Bahu-shruta and the Prajnapti-vada.

original: de la mang du thos pa rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni nges par 'byung ba'i lam la ni rnam par dpyod pa med do //
analyzed: de la mang du thos pa rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni nges par 'byung ba'i lam la ni rnam par dpyod pa med do //
translated: Among them, the root commitment of the Bahu-shruta is that there is no analysis on the path of renunciation.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa ni bden pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa ni bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of suffering, the conventional truth, and the noble truth are true.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal rnams mthong bas yang dag par skyon med pa la 'jug gi / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal mthong bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal rnams mthong bas yang dag par skyon med pa la 'jug gi / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal mthong bas ni ma yin no //
translated: The path of insight is the entry into the faultless state, by reason of the seeing of the suffering of conditioned states, and not by reason of the seeing of the suffering of suffering and the suffering of the.

original: dge 'dun ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: The Saṅgha is supramundane.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams la yang gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa sgrub pa yod do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams la yang gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa sgrub pa yod do //
translated: The Arhats have the practice of the teaching of another.

original: yang dag par bsgrags pa'i lam yang yod do //
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrags pa'i lam yang yod do //
translated: They have the path of the proclamation.🔽They have the entry into concentration.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa la yang dag 'jug pa yang yod do zhes bya ba rnams ni mang du thos pa rnams kyi dam tshig go //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa la yang dag 'jug pa yang yod do zhes bya ba rnams ni mang du thos pa rnams kyi dam tshig go //
translated: These are the rules of the learned.

original: yang btags par smra ba rnams ni phung po med pa'i sdug bsngal yang yod do //
analyzed: yang btags par smra ba rnams ni phung po med pa'i sdug bsngal yang yod do //
translated: The Vātsīputrīyas say that there is suffering without a basis,

original: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i skye mched kyang yod do //
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i skye mched kyang yod do //
translated: that there is a sense sphere which is not complete,

original: 'du byed rnams ni phan tshun btags pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni phan tshun btags pa yin no //
translated: that conditioned things are mutually dependent.

original: yang sdug bsngal ni don dam par ro //
analyzed: yang sdug bsngal ni don dam par ro //
translated: Suffering is in the ultimate sense.

original: sems las byung ba ni lam ma yin no //
analyzed: sems las byung ba ni lam ma yin no //
translated: The mental factors are not the path.

original: dus ma yin par 'chi ba ni med do //
analyzed: dus ma yin par 'chi ba ni med do //
translated: There is no untimely death.

original: skyes bu byed pa yang med do //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa yang med do //
translated: There is no human effort.🔽All suffering arises from karma.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad ni las las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu ni btags par smra ba rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig yin no //🔽yang ba lang gnas pa rnams kyi bye brag las gnas brtan mchod rten pa @151a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad ni las las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu ni btags par smra ba rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig yin no // yang ba lang gnas pa rnams kyi bye brag las gnas brtan mchod rten pa @151a * //
translated: This is the root vow of the Vātsīputrīyas.

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: The Sthaviras are also called the Caityakas.

original: de ni lha chen po zhes bya ba'i kun du rgyu zhig rab tu byung nas mchod rten can gyi ri la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni lha chen po zhes bya ba'i kun du rgyu zhig rab tu byung nas mchod rten can gyi ri la gnas pa yin te /
translated: They are so called because they are followers of a renunciate named Mahādeva who lived on Caitya Hill.

original: yang de ni dge 'dun phal chen pa'i gzhi 'dod par gyur pa ni mchod rten pa zhes bya ba'i sde par rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: yang de ni dge 'dun phal chen pa'i gzhi 'dod par gyur pa ni mchod rten pa zhes bya ba'i sde par rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: They are also called the Mahāsāṃghikas, because they desired the basis of the Mahāsāṃghikas.

original: de dag ni dge 'dun phal chen ba rnams kyi sde pa drug tu bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni dge 'dun phal chen ba rnams kyi sde pa drug tu bzhag pa yin no //
translated: These are the six divisions of the Mahāsāṃghikas.

original: yang gnas brtan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang gnas brtan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The Sthaviras are also of two types:

original: sngar gyi gnas brtan pa dang gangs ri ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi gnas brtan pa dang gangs ri ba zhes bya'o //
translated: the original Sthaviras and the Hemavata.

original: sngar gyi gnas brtan pa'i rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni dgra bcom pa rnams la gzhan gyis ston cing sgrub pa ni med do //
analyzed: sngar gyi gnas brtan pa'i rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni dgra bcom pa rnams la gzhan gyis ston cing sgrub pa ni med do //
translated: The fundamental tenets of the Sthaviras are that arhats do not have other teachers or practices.

original: de bzhin du gzhi lnga po yang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhi lnga po yang med do //
translated: Similarly, the five bases do not exist.

original: gang zag ni yod do //
analyzed: gang zag ni yod do //
translated: The person exists.

original: srid pa bar ma ni yod do //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ni yod do //
translated: The intermediate state of existence exists.

original: dgra bcom pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod do //
translated: The nirvana of arhats exists.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang yod do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang yod do //
translated: The past and future exist.🔽The meaning of nirvana exists.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i don ni yod do zhes bya ba ni dag ni gnas brtan pa'i rtsa ba'i dam tshig go //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i don ni yod do zhes bya ba ni dag ni gnas brtan pa'i rtsa ba'i dam tshig go //
translated: These are the fundamental tenets of the Sthaviras.

original: de la gangs ri ba'i rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni so so'i skye bo ma yin zhes bya'o //

original: mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba ni /

translated: The tenets of the Kāśyapīya are as follows: There are phenomena that are fully ripened and there are phenomena that are not fully ripened.🔽There is that which is abandoned but not fully known.

analyzed: gos dmar po rnams kyi dam tshig ni gang zag med do zhes bya ba'o //

original: yang thams cad yod par smra ba rnams kyi bye brag slob dpon bla ma'i gzhung ston par byed pa'i pho ba rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni phung po lnga ni 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'pho ba'o //

original: lam ma gtogs par phung po 'gag pa med do //
analyzed: lam ma gtogs par phung po 'gag pa med do //

analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang bcas pa'i phung po ni yod do //

original: gang zag ni don dam par mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gang zag ni don dam par mi dmigs so //

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod pa nyid dam /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod pa nyid dam /

analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa yang ma yin /

analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas ma bu rnams kyi dam tshig go //

original: yang ri chen po pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang ri chen po pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The Mahāśāsaṅghikas are also of two types:

original: chos mchog pa dang / lam bzangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos mchog pa dang / lam bzangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the Pūrvaśailas and the Aparaśailas.

original: chos mchog pa rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni skye la ma rag pa dang / skye ba dang 'gag pa la ma rag pa dang 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: chos mchog pa rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni skye la ma rag pa dang / skye ba dang 'gag pa la ma rag pa dang 'gag pa'o //
translated: The root doctrine of the Pūrvaśailas is that which is not born, that which is born, that which will cease, and that which ceases.

original: lam bzangs pa'i yang de bzhin no //🔽grong khyer drug pa la kha cig na re ri chen po pa'i bye brag yin zer /
analyzed: lam bzangs pa'i yang de bzhin no // grong khyer drug pa la kha cig na re ri chen po pa'i bye brag yin zer /
translated: The Aparaśailas are the same.🔽Some say that the Ṣaṇṇagarika are a subdivision of the Mahāśāsaṅghikas.

original: gzhan dag gis smra ba ni mang pos bkur ba pa dag gi bye brag yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smra ba ni mang pos bkur ba pa dag gi bye brag yin par 'dod de /
translated: Others say that they are a subdivision of the Sāmmitīyas.

original: de ltar de rnams ni gnas ma'i bu'i sde ba rnam pa @153a * //
analyzed: de ltar de rnams ni gnas ma'i bu'i sde ba rnam pa @153a * //
translated: Thus these are the divisions of the Vatsiputrīya school.🔽

original: bzhir gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhir gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, these are the four divisions of the Vatsiputrīya.

original: gang de dag ni slob dpon dag gi rjes su 'brang ba'i rim gyis rnam pa bco brgyad du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: gang de dag ni slob dpon dag gi rjes su 'brang ba'i rim gyis rnam pa bco brgyad du gyur pa yin te /
translated: These are the eighteen divisions of the schools that arose in sequence from the masters.

original: de dag ni rtsa ba'i rtog pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rtsa ba'i rtog pa dag yin no //
translated: These are the root schools.

original: gzhan nang gses kyi dbye ba ni mang du yod pas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan nang gses kyi dbye ba ni mang du yod pas brjod par bya'o //
translated: There are many other subdivisions, but they will not be described here.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How are they?

original: thams cad yod par smra ba rnams kyi 'dod gzhung gi bye brag kyang dbye ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba rnams kyi 'dod gzhung gi bye brag kyang dbye ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas are divided into four groups according to their differences of opinion on the doctrines of the scriptures.

original: dngos po dang / mtshan nyid dang / gnas skabs dang / gzhan gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyi bye brag gis so //
analyzed: dngos po dang / mtshan nyid dang / gnas skabs dang / gzhan gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyi bye brag gis so //
translated: They differ on the nature of things, on the characteristics of the conditioned, on the time periods, and on the transformation of the basis.

original: de la dang po dngos po gzhan nyid du gyur pa ni btsun pa chos skyob kyi ste /
analyzed: de la dang po dngos po gzhan nyid du gyur pa ni btsun pa chos skyob kyi ste /
translated: The first, the Bhadanta Dharmatrāta, maintains that the nature of things is transformation.

original: de ni chos rnams dus kyis 'jig par gyur pa na dngos po gzhan du gyur pa nyid ni yin gyi rdzas gzhan du gyur pa nyid ni ma yin te /🔽gser gyi snod bcom nas gzhan du byas pa ni dbyibs gzhan du gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni chos rnams dus kyis 'jig par gyur pa na dngos po gzhan du gyur pa nyid ni yin gyi rdzas gzhan du gyur pa nyid ni ma yin te / gser gyi snod bcom nas gzhan du byas pa ni dbyibs gzhan du gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: When things are destroyed by time, their state is transformed, but not their substance.

original: rdzas gzhan du gyur ba ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rdzas gzhan du gyur ba ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when a golden vessel is destroyed and remade into another vessel, its shape is transformed, but not its substance.

original: ji ltar 'o ma las zhor gyur pa na ro dang nus pa dang / smin pa gzhan du gyur pa las kha dog ni ma yin pa de bzhin du chos rnams kyang 'das pa'i dus nas da ltar gyi dus su byung ba na 'das pa'i dus kyi dngos po nyams pa yin gyi rdzas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'o ma las zhor gyur pa na ro dang nus pa dang / smin pa gzhan du gyur pa las kha dog ni ma yin pa de bzhin du chos rnams kyang 'das pa'i dus nas da ltar gyi dus su byung ba na 'das pa'i dus kyi dngos po nyams pa yin gyi rdzas ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as the taste, potency, and ripening of milk change when it becomes curd, but its color does not, so too, when a phenomenon arises in the present from the past, its state in the past is lost, but not its substance.

original: de bzhin du da ltar gyi dus nas ma 'ongs pa byung ba na yang da ltar gyi dngos po nyams pa yin gyi rdzas kyi dngos po ni ma yin zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du da ltar gyi dus nas ma 'ongs pa byung ba na yang da ltar gyi dngos po nyams pa yin gyi rdzas kyi dngos po ni ma yin zhes zer ro //
translated: Similarly, when it arises in the future from the present, its state in the present is lost, but not its substantial state.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan du gyur pa ni btsun pa dbyangs sgrog gi ste /🔽de na re chos rnams dus kyis 'jug par gyur pa na 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi mtshan nyid dag dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin la ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa na
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan du gyur pa ni btsun pa dbyangs sgrog gi ste / de na re chos rnams dus kyis 'jug par gyur pa na 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi mtshan nyid dag dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin la ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa na
translated: Bhadanta Ghoṣaka asserts that they are transformed through the transformation of characteristics.🔽He says that when phenomena engage their objects through time, they do not possess the characteristics of the future and present when they possess the characteristic of the past,

original: 'das pa dang da ltar dag gi dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar dag gi dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: nor do they not possess the characteristics of the past and present when they possess the characteristic of the future.

original: dper na skyes bu bud med gcig la chags par gyur pa na lhag ma rnams la yang chags pa dang bral ba ni ma yin pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu bud med gcig la chags par gyur pa na lhag ma rnams la yang chags pa dang bral ba ni ma yin pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, when a man is attached to one woman, he is not detached from other women.

original: gnas skabs gzhan du gyur pa ni btsun pa dbyig bshes kyi ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan du gyur pa ni btsun pa dbyig bshes kyi ste /
translated: Bhadanta Vasumitra asserts that they are transformed through the transformation of state.

original: de ni chos rnams dus kyis 'jug par gyur pa na gzhan dang gzhan du rjod par byed pa ni gnas skabs gzhan du gyur pa yin gyi rdzas gzhan du gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni chos rnams dus kyis 'jug par gyur pa na gzhan dang gzhan du rjod par byed pa ni gnas skabs gzhan du gyur pa yin gyi rdzas gzhan du gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: He says that when phenomena engage their objects through time, they are said to be different from each other through the transformation of state, but they are not different substances.

original: dper na sdod bu @153b gcig pu bgrang ba'i tshe na gcig ces brjod par bya la /🔽grangs brgyar gtogs pa'i tshe na brgya zhes bya /
analyzed: dper na sdod bu @153b gcig pu bgrang ba'i tshe na gcig ces brjod par bya la / grangs brgyar gtogs pa'i tshe na brgya zhes bya /
translated: For example, when counting one seed, one says one.🔽When counting one hundred, one says one hundred.

original: grangs stong du bgrang ba'i tshe ni stong zhes bya ba dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: grangs stong du bgrang ba'i tshe ni stong zhes bya ba dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: When counting one thousand, one says one thousand.

original: gzhan gzhan du gyur pa ni btsun pa sangs rgyas lha'i ste /
analyzed: gzhan gzhan du gyur pa ni btsun pa sangs rgyas lha'i ste /
translated: Bhadanta Buddhadeva says:

original: de ni chos rnams dus kyis 'jug par gyur na sngon dang phyi ma la ltos nas gzhan dang gzhan du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni chos rnams dus kyis 'jug par gyur na sngon dang phyi ma la ltos nas gzhan dang gzhan du brjod par bya ste /
translated: When dharmas are engaged in time, they are said to be different in dependence on prior and later.

original: dper na bud med gcig la ma zhes kyang brjod bu mo zhes kyang brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bud med gcig la ma zhes kyang brjod bu mo zhes kyang brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, one woman is called mother and daughter.

original: bzhi po de dag ji lta ba bzhin du thams cad yod do zhes bya ba'i phyir thams cad yod par smra ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi po de dag ji lta ba bzhin du thams cad yod do zhes bya ba'i phyir thams cad yod par smra ba'o //
translated: Because they say that all four exist, they are Sarvastivadins.

original: de bzhin du kha cig ni rkyen bdun te /
analyzed: de bzhin du kha cig ni rkyen bdun te /
translated: Some say that there are seven conditions:

original: rgyu dang dmigs pa dang de ma thag dang / bdag po dang las dang zas dang rten zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang dmigs pa dang de ma thag dang / bdag po dang las dang zas dang rten zhes bya'o //
translated: cause, object, immediately preceding, dominant, action, nutriment, and support.

original: de bzhin du la la ni rtogs pa'i sems bzhi ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du la la ni rtogs pa'i sems bzhi ste /
translated: Similarly, some say that the four minds of realization

original: bden pa so so ba'o //
analyzed: bden pa so so ba'o //
translated: are the individual truths.

original: gzhan rnams ni chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa brgyad yin te /
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa brgyad yin te /
translated: Others say that the eight are Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge,🔽but not the knowledge of individual knowledge.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni ma yin no zhes zer gzhan rnams ni bcu gnyis su 'dod do //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni ma yin no zhes zer gzhan rnams ni bcu gnyis su 'dod do //
translated: Others say that the twelve are the four Dharma knowledges and the four subsequent knowledges of the truths of cessation and path.

original: de las kyang gzhan pa rnams ni bcu drug tu 'dod do //
analyzed: de las kyang gzhan pa rnams ni bcu drug tu 'dod do //
translated: Others say that the sixteen are the four Dharma knowledges and the four subsequent knowledges of the truths of suffering and origin.

original: de bzhin du sems med pa'i gnyid la ni sems ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems med pa'i gnyid la ni sems ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, sleep that is without mind is not a mind.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa lhag ma rnams la ni yod do //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa lhag ma rnams la ni yod do //
translated: The remaining concomitant states exist.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la 'du shes dang tshor ba bkag pa ni yod do //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la 'du shes dang tshor ba bkag pa ni yod do //
translated: The cessation of discernment and feeling is the cessation of discernment and feeling.

original: lhag ma rnams la ni mtshungs par ldan pa yod do //🔽ji ltar yid gnyis kyis skyo bar 'gyur ba ni skyod pa med pa'i bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug la /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la ni mtshungs par ldan pa yod do // ji ltar yid gnyis kyis skyo bar 'gyur ba ni skyod pa med pa'i bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug la /
translated: The remaining concomitant states exist.🔽Just as one who is weary of doubt enters meditative attainment in the formless realm,

original: dga' bas skyo bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: dga' bas skyo bar gyur pa ni /
translated: one who is weary of joy enters meditative attainment in the third absorption.

original: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug / de bzhin du 'du shes dang tshor bas skyo bar gyur pa ni 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug la /
analyzed: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug / de bzhin du 'du shes dang tshor bas skyo bar gyur pa ni 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug la /
translated: Similarly, those who are weary of ideation and sensation enter the meditative attainment of the cessation of ideation and sensation.

original: de bzhin du kha cig na re sems kyi yul gyi khyad par thob pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du kha cig na re sems kyi yul gyi khyad par thob pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that nirvana is the attainment of a special object of mind.

original: la la na re phung po med par gyur pa mya ngan las 'das pa yin gyi dngos po'i don ni ma yin no zhes zer /
analyzed: la la na re phung po med par gyur pa mya ngan las 'das pa yin gyi dngos po'i don ni ma yin no zhes zer /
translated: Some say that nirvana is the non-existence of the aggregates, not an existent object.

original: kha cig na re rang bzhin gyis lung bstan du med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: kha cig na re rang bzhin gyis lung bstan du med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Some say that nirvana is the indeterminate by nature.

original: de bzhin du la la na re tshad med pa rnams ni byang chub kyi yan lag yin no yang zer /🔽kha cig na re 'bras bu che @154a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du la la na re tshad med pa rnams ni byang chub kyi yan lag yin no yang zer / kha cig na re 'bras bu che @154a * //
translated: Similarly, some say that the immeasurables are the factors of enlightenment.

original: ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: ba ni gsum ste /
translated: Some say that the great fruit is the three:

original: gzhan gyi sems ni 'bras bu dang 'bras bu che ba dang / tshad med che ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems ni 'bras bu dang 'bras bu che ba dang / tshad med che ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind of another is called the fruit, the great fruit, and the fruit of great immeasurables.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'gro bar 'gro ba na grogs su gyur pa ni las yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'gro bar 'gro ba na grogs su gyur pa ni las yin no //
translated: In the same way, action is the companion of the sentient beings who go to the plane of existence by the power of the defilements.

original: de bzhin du de spangs par gyur pa ni 'gro ba de dag tu 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de spangs par gyur pa ni 'gro ba de dag tu 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When the defilements are abandoned, the sentient beings no longer go to the planes of existence.

original: yang la lan re sngar byas pa'i las rnams kyi dbang gis dang por 'gro bar 'dod do //
analyzed: yang la lan re sngar byas pa'i las rnams kyi dbang gis dang por 'gro bar 'dod do //
translated: Some sentient beings go to the planes of existence by the power of actions that they have previously accomplished.

original: kha cig na re ji ltar goms pa'i las rnams kyi yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: kha cig na re ji ltar goms pa'i las rnams kyi yin par 'dod do //
translated: Some sentient beings go to the planes of existence by the power of actions that they have accomplished in the present.

original: la lan re ni rnam pa lnga goms pas te snga ma bzhi dang rkyen gyi khyad par goms pas so //
analyzed: la lan re ni rnam pa lnga goms pas te snga ma bzhi dang rkyen gyi khyad par goms pas so //
translated: Some sentient beings go to the planes of existence by the power of the five kinds of actions: the four previous kinds of actions and the power of the habitual practice of the conditions.

original: kha cig na re 'das pa'i nye bar len pa las me 'bar ro zhes zer /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'das pa'i nye bar len pa las me 'bar ro zhes zer /
translated: Some say that the fire of the planes of existence is fed by the fuel of the past action.

original: kha cig na re da ltar gyi las so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re da ltar gyi las so zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that it is fed by the fuel of present action.

original: kha cig na re sgrib pa lnga po rnams las gang yang rung ba la mi mthun par sems pa las so zhes zer /
analyzed: kha cig na re sgrib pa lnga po rnams las gang yang rung ba la mi mthun par sems pa las so zhes zer /
translated: Some say that it is fed by the fuel of the five hindrances.

original: kha cig ni gzugs kyi khams ni kha dog bzhi par 'dod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs kyi khams ni kha dog bzhi par 'dod do //
translated: Some say that the realm of fine-materiality is of four colors.

original: gzhan dag ni kha dog gcig par 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni kha dog gcig par 'dod do //
translated: Others believe that it is of a single color.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag ni gang zag yod de de yang phung po las gzhan yin no zhes zer /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag ni gang zag yod de de yang phung po las gzhan yin no zhes zer /
translated: Similarly, others say that the person exists and that it is different from the aggregates.

original: phung po tsam yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phung po tsam yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not just the aggregates,

original: phung po nye bar len pa'i nye bar blangs pa dang ldan par btags pa'o //
analyzed: phung po nye bar len pa'i nye bar blangs pa dang ldan par btags pa'o //
translated: because it is designated as possessing the appropriated aggregates that are to be appropriated.

original: nye bar len pa med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin pas so ;
analyzed: nye bar len pa med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin pas so ;
translated: Nirvana is without appropriation.

original: /'di ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la rim gyis brtags nas mngon par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: /'di ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la rim gyis brtags nas mngon par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, having investigated the four noble truths in sequence, one realizes them.

original: bar ma dor mi mthun pa'i sems 'byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: bar ma dor mi mthun pa'i sems 'byung ba ni med do //
translated: There is no arising of a dissimilar mind in the interval.

original: sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag gis skyon med par 'jug go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag gis skyon med par 'jug go //
translated: One enters into the faultless state through the factor of enlightenment that focuses on suffering.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa'i 'du byed mi rtag par yid la byed pa la brten pa'i sems bcu gsum gyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa'i 'du byed mi rtag par yid la byed pa la brten pa'i sems bcu gsum gyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur te /
translated: One attains the fruit of stream-entry through thirteen moments of the mind that are based on the contemplation of the impermanence of the formative forces that are included within the realm of desire.

original: chos de la gnas pa las nyams pa ni med de //
analyzed: chos de la gnas pa las nyams pa ni med de //
translated: There is no falling away from the state of abiding in that Dharma.

original: de bzhin du zhugs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhugs pa yang ngo //
translated: The same for the one who is engaged in the path.

original: dgra bcom pa la yang nyams pa'i chos yod do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la yang nyams pa'i chos yod do //
translated: The perfected being can retrogress.

original: srid pa bar mdo yang yod do //
analyzed: srid pa bar mdo yang yod do //
translated: There is an intermediate existence.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang yod do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang yod do //
translated: There is past and future.

original: gcig tu dge ba'i chos kyi don mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod do //
analyzed: gcig tu dge ba'i chos kyi don mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod do //
translated: There is a good realm of rebirth, namely nirvāṇa.

original: phung po 'gags pa ni dus las rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: phung po 'gags pa ni dus las rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: The cessation of the aggregates is liberation from time.

original: lha la yang tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa yod do //
analyzed: lha la yang tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa yod do //
translated: There are gods who practice chastity.

original: 'dod pa'i khams nas @154b skyon med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams nas @154b skyon med par 'gyur ro //
translated: There is a path of action in the realm of desire.

original: so so'i skye bos kyang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang gnod sems spong ngo //
analyzed: so so'i skye bos kyang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang gnod sems spong ngo //
translated: The ordinary worldling can abandon attachment and hatred.

original: rnam par shes ba'i tshogs lnga ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'am bral ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes ba'i tshogs lnga ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'am bral ba ma yin te /
translated: The five sensory consciousnesses are not associated with attachment or with non-attachment,

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are free from conceptual construction.

original: drug pa ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba yang yin no //
analyzed: drug pa ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba yang yin no //
translated: The sixth consciousness is associated with attachment and with non-attachment.

original: dgra bcom pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs dang / sems kyi zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs dang / sems kyi zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The perfected being is the object of the defilements of form and of thought, whether these defilements are impure or pure.

original: sems kyi yul gzhan du phyin pa ni ma yin gyi /🔽'di na gnas bzhin du thag ring po na gnas pa la dmigs par byed do ;
analyzed: sems kyi yul gzhan du phyin pa ni ma yin gyi / 'di na gnas bzhin du thag ring po na gnas pa la dmigs par byed do ;
translated: The perfected being is not the object of the mind which has another object.🔽The perfected being is the object of the mind which has him for its object, even though this mind is not in the stage of the perfected being.

original: / gzugs med pa'i khams la ni gzugs med do //
analyzed: / gzugs med pa'i khams la ni gzugs med do //
translated: In the realm of immateriality, there is no form.

original: dgra bcom pa la yang nyams pa'i chos yod do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la yang nyams pa'i chos yod do //
translated: The perfected being is subject to retrogressing.

original: dus ma yin par 'chi ba yod do //
analyzed: dus ma yin par 'chi ba yod do //
translated: The perfected being can die a violent death.

original: skyes bu'i byed pa yod do //
analyzed: skyes bu'i byed pa yod do //
translated: The perfected being can act as an agent.

original: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba yod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba yod do //
translated: The perfected being can have right views.

analyzed: phung po gsum gyi sems can thams cad bsdus kyis chos thams cad ni ma yin no //

analyzed: sngar byas pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i las thams cad ni las kyi rnam par smin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar te /

translated: If this Mahayana were included in any one of those divisions, it would be recognized as the word of the Buddha, but the Mahayana is not taught in any one of the scriptures of the eighteen schools.

original: yang ma bstan pas theg pa chen po 'di sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang ma bstan pas theg pa chen po 'di sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the Mahayana is not the word of the Buddha.

original: 'di'i phyir yang 'di ni sde pa bco brgyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang 'di ni sde pa bco brgyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: For this reason also it is not included in the eighteen schools.

original: bcom ldan 'das yongs @156a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yongs @156a * //
translated: The Bhagavat

original: su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus nyid ni rtsa ba'i yang dag par sdud par byed pas ma bsdus pa'i phyir dang / phyis bye bar gyur pa na yang sdud par byed pa rnams kyis ma bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus nyid ni rtsa ba'i yang dag par sdud par byed pas ma bsdus pa'i phyir dang / phyis bye bar gyur pa na yang sdud par byed pa rnams kyis ma bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the time of the parinirvana of the Buddha was not included by the compilers of the root text, and because it was not included by the compilers when it was divided into parts later.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa nyid du ston par byed pas 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa zhes bya ba dang 'gal ba'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa nyid du ston par byed pas 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa zhes bya ba dang 'gal ba'i yang phyir ro //
translated: And because it contradicts the statement that all conditioned things are impermanent, since it shows the Tathagata to be permanent.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying pos khyab pa nyid dang / len pa'i rnam par shes pa ston par byed pas bdag tu 'dzin pa ma spangs pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying pos khyab pa nyid dang / len pa'i rnam par shes pa ston par byed pas bdag tu 'dzin pa ma spangs pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: And because it shows the appropriating consciousness, since it shows the pervasion by the Tathagatagarbha, and because it shows the non-abandonment of self-grasping.

original: sangs rgyas mya ngan yongs mi 'da' //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mya ngan yongs mi 'da' //
translated: The Buddha does not pass into parinirvana.

original: zhes ston par byed pas de la zhi ba nyid med par bstan pas chos kyi phyag rgya gsum dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / nyan thos chen po rnams lung bstan pa dang / dgra bcom pa rnams la shin tu smod pa dang / khyim pa la phyag bya ba ston pa dang /

translated: Because it teaches that the great sravakas were prophesied, arhats are greatly disparaged, and laypeople are shown to be worthy of homage,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa las khyad par du byang chub sems dpa' la bsngags par byed pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam rnams kyang tshig tsam yin pa'i phyir dang / sh'akya thub pa sprul pa yin par smra bas bstan pa thams cad kyang log pa yin pa'i phyir dang ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa las khyad par du byang chub sems dpa' la bsngags par byed pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam rnams kyang tshig tsam yin pa'i phyir dang / sh'akya thub pa sprul pa yin par smra bas bstan pa thams cad kyang log pa yin pa'i phyir dang ;
translated: because it praises bodhisattvas as superior to tathagatas, because the prayers of bodhisattvas such as Akasagarbha are mere words and because it teaches that Shakyamuni is an emanation, all of its teachings are false.

original: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa yin zhes bya bar yang mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / mdo sde mang po las 'bras bu med pa'i bsngags pa ston pa'i phyir te /
